description:
WOW. This place should have a huge line out the door. Right when you walk in you can smell the great smells wafting through the air, it's like magic. They get you seated very quickly and have very nice staff. 

I went with my family and we had a great time, they are very kid friendly. I also think that they have very affordable prices. The owner is also very friendly.
author: Alexthebest 8.

description:
Can't give half stars but I agree with the consensus that this place is a solid 3.5. I love the decor and ambiance, keeping the old school drugs sign out front and the Texas looking decor inside. Although it was a little weird that the first thing we noticed were coffee bags hanging from the ceiling yet no coffee listed on the menu.. *insert thinking emoji face here*

We ordered the Conor fries, combo plate of brisket and ribs with a side of cornbread and Mac and cheese. The Conor fries were hands down my favorite part of the meal. It was a great way to sample all their homemade sauces to prepare what sauces to use for the BBQ. I loved the chunks of meat in the fries and the melted cheese was so good. 

Second best was the brisket but only because it was good to eat with the sauce. It wasn't as good alone, not as tender as I would've liked but ok nonetheless. The ribs were too burnt for me and definitely wasn't "fall off the bone" good. But not bad either. 

Another notable thing was the fresh lemonade. It was super sweet but I liked it. They seem to only have a small batch made since the table next to us tried to order but was told they were sold out.

The guy serving us was really nice and I loved the little kiddie corner they had next to our table. It goes well with the whole "Baby" name.
author: Jayne S.

description:
3.5 stars: TL;DR: decently large portion size, chill ambiance, open until 10, decent tasting meats (but brisket was cold), decent price

Came here on a Sunday night at 9 because I was craving BBQ. This was one of the few BBQ places that was open until 10, so we thought we'd give it a try. 

PRICE: The prices were standard and to be expected for a BBQ place in SF. A 2 meat combo plate was $21 with tax, and the yelp 7% cash back is also a nice perk too!

FOOD/MENU: We got a 2 meat combo plate with beef brisket (sliced and smoked) and baby back ribs with a side of creamed spinach and included cornbread to share between 2 people. I was pleasantly surprised by how big the portion was! It had 2 large baby back ribs and four 8"X1.5" (estimated) slices of brisket. We were both pretty satisfied with the amount of food and we didn't order anything extra. 

FLAVOR: Taste-wise, it was overall okay. The baby back ribs were flavorful and smokey and went well with the choice of 4 sauces at the table: original (had an interesting bitter kick to it), sweet molasses (my favorite! Not too sweet), medium (tasted like Tabasco), and XXX (which wasn't impossible to handle). The brisket also had nice flavor, but it was cold. Maybe it was because it was almost closing time but I wish the brisket were served hot. 

The creamed spinach was good too, but I think I was a little too lactose intolerant to fully enjoy it  It wasn't very thick and it had a slight bitter taste, but it wasn't bad. 

Overall, it was fine, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here. Maybe if I'm craving BBQ at 9 pm again!
author: Rebecca T.

description:
We found this local gem from eater.com.  We had friends from Philly coming in to visit and needed a kid friendly place.  This place was great.  There's a little nook for kids the play in, there we're TVs around so we can watch the Giants game, and there was a nice selection of beer to choose from.  The best part was the food.  For a group of eight, it barely cost us $170 and there were plenty of leftovers! The ribs and brisket were delicious (love that sassy molasses with the XXX sauce), and the cornbread was addicting.  Roasted Chicken was a little dry, but the fried chicken was spot on. They had a small kids menu but overall, it was all good. 

We also discovered that the owner is from Philly and that his brothers own the other restaurants in Philly (and I think LA).  One downer is that there is no dessert on the menu, but don't despair!  Mitchell's ice cream is in walking distance (a local institution!) 

This was a great way to wrap up our friends' SF visit. As the sign said in the restaurant "From the 215 to the 415".....thanks for helping us make some wonderful memories!!
author: Sue E.

description: We have been eating here for years but the sides Togo are redicously small.. Also 1lbs of brisket that cost 20+ dollars is actually 13oz of brisket.. I'm really disappointed and def won't be doing take out here again..
author: D J.

description: This is the first review I've ever written. I ordered takeout salads from baby blues. When I received the $12 Cesar salad it was nothing but romaine lettuce a few sprinkles of cheese and 1 tsp of Cesar dressing. I called the restaurant to express my disappointment  and asked to return it for a refund. The owner proceeded to berate me, told me I'm insulting his food and hung up on me. I called back to make sure he was issuing a refund and he told me to figure it out myself with the delivery company. The delivery company apologized and issued a refund. The craziest part... 5 minutes later the owner of the restaurant called me back to yell at me and told me to NEVER step foot into his restaurant again. I gladly will never step foot into th place again and will also tell all my friends and neighbors who have been frequenting the restaurant since it's inception.
author: Amelia M.

description: Their phone does not work and I had a reservation for 20 people that I wanted to confirm and the day of they didn't pick up the phone. It was for my 18th birthday, we got there and the restaurant was nothing like it looked like on yelp and the food was awful and one of my friends got food poisoning.
author: Sophie S.

description: Enjoyed it!  Super easy I parked around the block, but there's a paid parking lot on mission just half a block up.
author: Anonnymous U.

description: Indifferent service. (are you sure you want me in you restaurant?) Somewhat dry and overly charred ribs. Grey brisket. Small, overpriced sides. Fries that tasted they had been refried three times and dipped in warm oil before serving for good measure. But what takes the bisket is the woeful grilled shrimp "platter" Seven small shrimp on a bed of coleslaw with a piece of dry cornbread, with a side of more watery coleslaw for around $20! A la carte the shrimp are an unbelievable $1.50 each. But even at that incredible price it would have been cheaper to order them individually than as a "platter". How do they get away with this? So disappointing. I will never go back.
author: Andy C.

description: This is in a tight corner but parking is doable in this area of the city. We ordered the biggest party platter for a party of 12 and finished more than half! I also tried collard greens for the first time ever here and it was pretty delicious. Overall, one thing I think that makes their place for BBQ different from others is their variety of sauces for you to try with all the assorted meat that comes with the party platter. This place can be a little tight with space. I have 2 children and I don't recommend taking in a stroller. However, they do have baby chairs that you can flip upside down for the car seat or just leave up for your toddler to sit in. We ordered their banana cream sundae I think it's called and it was delicious! I am not a banana person or anything flavored banana but that was definitely something sweet I enjoyed after some good bbq!
author: Joyce D.

description:
Nice and short. Came here on a Saturday morning and were seated promptly. Surprisingly, we were the only patrons at that time. Overall the Bf and I were really satisfied with our meals. I opted for the 2 meat combo with one side and he went for their pulled pork sandwich. I can't rave enough about how tender and juicy the smoked chicken was. You can really mess up a good BBQ chicken by making it too dry and they definitely didn't do that. My second meat open was the beef brisket and dear god that was some intense flavors going on. My Bf couldn't stop picking at my plate. 

He also enjoyed his sandwich but probably would have opted for a combo plate instead. We also shared their candid bacon which was such a treat. Sometimes when folks make sweeten bacon they over sweeten it and forget to let the savory goodness of bacon shine. I really appreciate the bit of spice and smokiness that came through. If you've ever been to some of the brunch places in the city where they serve millionaire dollar bacon, well this place has a much better version. 

Overall a great meal. It's pricey though. But what good BBQ isn't?
author: Diane T.

description: $20 for a few pieces lol. I'm never going to order from here again. Cornbread is burnt and super drylime is all dried out. Mac n Cheese isn't good either. This should be more like an appetizer. Chefs platter: 3 ribs & 3 pieces of shrimp?
author: Tim M.

description: Super good barbecue, super nice staff! Mac and cheese out of this world! Cornbread outstanding!
author: James D.

description:
Food is good. BBQ ribs were very tasty. fries were home cut and cooked fresh. I asked for them extra crispy, and they came out that way.

But the portion sizes are child sizes. Half rack of ribs was less than 4 oz of actual meat. Side order of fries came out in a tiny cup. Beverage comes out in a small 12 oz bottle. Even the amount of ice in the glass was Tiny. 

Servers were friendly and service was relatively fast. There are much better places in San Francisco to get ribs. If they double the serving size I'd come back.
author: scott h.

description: Probably one of the worst bbq's I've had in SF, or anywhere. The ribs were covered in black char burns. All of our meats were dry. Worst of all, their smoker imparts strong acrid flavors that are reminiscent of gasoline than smoke. Every single bite had that nasty, stinging taste and it just wasn't good...
author: Kazu O.

description:
We had a good experience at baby blues. They were out of the baby back ribs so we had the spare ribs and the sliced brisket. Both were very good. Moist and flavored well. 

The spare ribs were the star of the show. The rub as well as smoked flavor hit the spot. Didn't need any BBQ sauce!
author: Joey C.

description:
Great location and the BBQ is excellent. I started eating at the Original location in Venice, California. All of the BBQ here is great and that includes the wings that are char broiled. The sauces are another favorite. The best is the spicy bbq sauce that provides a great kick.

Baby Blues has closed a few locations over the last 2 years that include Downtown Los Angeles and a great location in West Hollywood. Sometimes the liquor license is worth more than what the location earns in revenue.

West Hollywood will be missed. Downtown Los Angeles was at a location that would have never worked.

All in all, Baby Blues is always excellent!
author: Anthony D.

description:
This place is wonderful!
If you only try one thing on the menu, get the shrimp
Everything else is good-to-great.
PARENTS: there is a play area for kids near the front. This is as close to having a date night as you are going to get. 

Buying meat al a carte can save you money, especially if you opt for take out.

Sometimes I wish they had a full bar instead of just a good selection of beer, and wine.
Obviously I love the non-food aspects of this place, and staff ARE super nice, so you can take my 5* rating with a grain of salt if all you care about is BBQ.
The owner is frequently floating around the place and he has a super friendly yet low-key vibe that makes people feel welcome. He was extremely gracious when my 2-year-old was actin a fool. His family owns the Baby Blues in Venice, which catered my rehearsal dinner and is also fantastic.
author: Dave M.

description:
3 stars was indeed right. Some food was good (ribs, hot link) some was just OK (brisket) some was bleh (the candied bacon--not nearly crispy enough in my opinion). The creamed spinach and okra sides were both meh.

The sauces were good. The service was to the point.

I'm disappointed they don't have Diet Coke, especially since their fancy soda is $4/bottle.

I'd certainly come back, but probably focus on the highlights next time.
author: O W.

description:
Best American food I ever tried.
                                       ---A guy from China mainland.
author: Wang E.

description: After having a great bbq meal a month earlier at Minnie's in the city we decided to go there again but it was closed that day. Benihana was a hour wait so we ended up here.most the food was just average but the brisket was terrible and pick something else or waste your money also the computer was down so we couldn't get a receipt for the meal for reimbursement..had to call the establishment over half a dozen times to get it and never did get the correct bill with the tip included resulting in ten bucks we couldn't get reimbursed.lemonade was non existent also today.
author: Greg D.

description: Was underwhelmed by the overwhelmingly fatty brisket. Less than half of the brisket was actually edible meat. The look of the brisket with massive additions of fat caused me to loose my appetite. I must concede - the meat itself was very tasty if you cut past all the gristle. For the amount of we got it wasn't worth the price. The catfish was undercooked ( translucent at places ) but had a descent flavor where fully cooked. The Mac and cheese was made with bleu cheese and was greasy and inedible. The baked beans were pretty much flavorless. My kids chicken strips were great and the corn bread was awesome! Although the extra I ordered were left out of our food we had delivered. I was really excited to try this place and was bummed at the outcome. We're new to SF from Texas and hunting for strong BBQ, but probably won't eat from here again:/
author: Kait P.

description: This place had a cool quirky vibe. The grilled meats were pretty good, and the bbq sauce variety was new and interesting. Overall the service was attentive. Baby blues did fall short on the sides the greens were cooked in a tomato sauces and included big chunks of tomatoes (very off putting). The potato salad was made with red potatoes (also off putting, I'm a stickler for the classics). The mac and cheese was average, but nothing spectacular. Overall this place was ok, not sure if I'd dine here again.
author: Catherine P.

description: In reality it's zero stars for me. After I had paid for the check for my friends and I. Two of us went outside while our other friend was using the bathroom. As my friend and I stood outside, the owner/manager came out abruptly, yelling at us, calling us "sons of b*tch*s!", "you don't leave a fucking tip?!". And came very close within our personal space. Practically face to face. He then proceeded to push my friend and I and eventually, started throwing punches, kicks and slaps here and there. We were not confronting this man at all but in self defense. (He eventually slapped my nose and glasses at the same time only to push the nose pads of my frame onto my nose with extreme pressure and next day not being able to support any kind of pressure or weight no matter what pair of frames I put on my nose). As he was fighting with us, my friend was coming out the bathroom only to see the owner/manager hitting us and runs outside to help push him off us or at least try to keep distance, asking what's going on. The owner/manager proceeds to fight with the friend that came out the restroom and outside the restaurant and my friend starts to fight back in self defense only to have me try to break them apart and at the same time realize that I had left my skateboard inside. I try to make my way to the door and the owner/manager shoves me back and asks where are you going? I simply said I forgot my board, I'm going to grab it and we're going to continue from where we left off-outside, waiting for our friend, so that we would leave. He then says to me "here I'll grab your board for you", proceeds to go in and grab the skateboard, come back outside only to aggressively hand it to me. Unbearably long review, unnecessary confrontation, and an utter disappointment.
author: Abe M.

description:
Not a whole lot to say here....service was impeccable. We were promptly greeted upon arrival. The server/bartender was friendly, personable, and professional. She was very well knowledgeable on her beer selections. Which was extremely helpful.

Food came out in pretty good time. It was hot, flavorful, very nice presentation and tasted delicious!! I'm not from this area. My husband is. And he says this is always one of his favorite BBQ spots to go to. 

Small details....place is clean. Has nice decor. I came on a Sunday evening. Was not packed at all. Hubby says this place is usually jammed pack. 

Everything that you would want in a restaurant....good pricing, good ambiance, good drinks, and good food. Yeah, I'll be here again for sure.
author: Grace G.

description: Awesome Sauce Awesome Sauce did I say Awesome Sauce. The food was excellent. Our waitress Holly is the bomb.com. We ordered The combo platter called blue. The brisket was super juicy and the chicken was so tender!!! We also enjoyed some mouth watering Memphis style ribs!!! Great tunes in the background ! A definite must try!!!! Let's not forget this banana pudding !!! Holly You Rock!!!
author: Darryl B.

description: For BBQ in SF, the prices are pretty affordable. Order the ribs... nice and juicy. The brisket was dry and lacked a crust and a smoke ring. Everything is well-seasoned, so you don't really need sauce. But the hot sauce is tasty. The mac was disappointing. It tasted less like cheddar cheese and more like cottage cheese. The pasta was pretty mushy. The corn bread was just the way I like it. If you're in the hood and craving BBQ, it's worth a stop-in.
author: William B.

description: Best burger in the mission!!! XXX hot bbq is just perfect! Great for dining while watching a sports game!
author: Casa I.

description: Food is great here! I love how everyone is very friendly and attentive. Their BBQ ribs are delicious and tender.
author: Bob B.

description: Home of the 49ers, I watch all my games here. Home of the warriors, I watch that here too. The second home of Philadelphia. It's definitely a Philly's fan home away from home. The food is authentic, the drinks are perfect. The room is right, when you come in this place, you belong. I been here several times and I feel like they treat me and everyone else that comes here like a part of the family. Holly the bartender is a doll, the staff is attentive and very on top of their game . The BBQ is the cherry on top.... Love this place!!!!!
author: Barney E.

description: Ate in over a year ago and had the catfish it wasn't good. Tried it again a few months ago and the ribs and potato salad were great. Made up for the first time, I ordered again and the food was awful. The combo plate came with 3 shrimp. The cornbread was awful and cold. The mac and cheese was watery and tasted like easy Mac. Def won't be eating here again, the only decent thing on the menu are the ribs.
author: Admin A.

description:
Memphis Ribs!!!! To die for. The seasoning/rub is subtle and delicious. 
Wait staff attentive and knowledgeable.
author: tiyfly p.

description: Good food, great for families ("Kid's Korner"), chill vibe and quality service. Perfect place, with a little something for everyone, on low key Sunday afternoon! Glad I came and will be going home with a full belly and a box of leftovers...will definitely be coming back!
author: Ruben S.

description: In search for bbq in san francisco came across baby blue bbq I highly do not recommend this bbq restaurant in san francisco reason is that i order bbq ribs plate two side orders the mac and cheese was soup and no cheese the ribs were dry and overcooked and the beans were cold and sour do not go here try at your own risk!
author: sean g.

description: Ordered the Conor fries and chefs plate with Memphis ribs, shredded brisket, and coleslaw!!!  Everything I ate was perfect!!  The Conor fries were full of flavor because of the pork, fries and cheese combination.  The coleslaw was creamy, the ribs we moist and smokey, and the brisket was definitely a pleasant surprise as I have never had brisket shredded before.  All the bbq sauces were fantastic and the perfect compliment to everything I ordered!!  I also was able to sample the potato salad that my friend received with her pulled pork sandwich that also looked so delicious.  The service was great too and they offered recommendations that we loved!!  I will definitely be back!
author: Heather C.

description: Granted I didn't try a lot, but everything I did get was very tasty.  I will certainly be back for the brisket and BBQ sauces. The best part is you smell like delicious smokey BBQ for a couple hours after you leave!
author: Kate P.

description: Awesome food! No wait on a Tuesday night. And the staff was amazing. Got the ribs, brisket (so juicy and tender), a hot link, and tons of sides. Plus we got the bread pudding for dessert with Jack Daniels syrup! Yum!
author: Jaclyn M.

description: This place is top notch and consistently so. I've been coming here for years. Anyone who gives this place a bad rating is just hating. The best ribs are the Memphis in my opinion, but it's so hard to say since it's all extra delicious.
author: Light E.

description: Ordered delivery from here and the ribs were not even cut up. Seriously had two or three pieces that had multiple uncut ribs in them. The ribs themselves were not cooked long enough!  Finished ribs should tug and pull off of the bone and these had another hour or so to go as the fat still hadn't rendered, making for very pink and overly fatty ribs!  They warm them up on the grill before serving as they arrived and were still steaming. Don't take shorts!  Ribs take time and they are done when they're done! The Mac and cheese was super heavy and oily. I just done understand why bbq joints feel like they have to make everything so unhealthy to make it seem good. Their cole slaw and potato salad were ok, but didn't seem all that fresh. Same with their beans. Probably won't be eating here again, unfortunately...
author: Jesus H.

description:
I thought my last review was going to be my last.

Yet, things change in life, and most certainly at Baby Blues.

I called in to order the same dish I've been ordering from there for years. It ends up being about $17 with tax for some ribs, pork, a piece of cornbread and a side. I was told that the combo plates that used to exist are now gone. In order to receive the same food that I had previously ordered, I would have to pay $26 before tax.

Two years ago Baby Blues raised their prices and fired many of their staff. It resulted in a lengthy period of poor service and mediocre food. Now, they've raised the prices again on the other dishes, and eliminated the only dishes that provided any value over another BBQ joint. This seems to be continuing in that trend of prioritizing profit over customer happiness, and could be why I always saw new faces whenever I would eat there.

Hey, maybe in a year the good plates will be back, but hopefully at that point I'll have learned my lesson about not eating at places with poor management.
author: Michael J.

description: Too of the line bbq your gonna find in SF, great atmosphere, reminds me of back home in Georgia, the meat is quality and they know exactly how to cook it, don't waist your time at those hipster bbq places around city and check this one out!
author: Rob B.

description: Most of their food is really good but I got take out and payed $5 for this tiny ceaser salad that was mostly white leaf with no substance.
author: Kari G.

description: Disappointing. Was a regular of Baby Blues Venica CA for 10 years, and SF location doesn't even compare on quality. Taste aside, portions are less then half the size and cost the same if not more. This place is basically a sports bar, not a legit BBQ establishment.
author: Ben N.

description: I finally made it here! Service was awesome and the food was great! I would come back. I made reservations on Yelp, easy peasy!
author: Deanna L.

description: Those of you who see my 5 Stars may think I'm some yahoo who doesn't know good BBQ. You'd be wrong. I know Arthur Bryant's on Brooklyn St.in Kansas City. BBQ in N. Philly. Also routinely ate at Bo's in Lafayette, CA until he closed. The only BBQ on Michael Bauer's 100 Best Restaurant List a few years ago. Used to go to Flint's in Oakland way back when. Sometimes still hit Memphis Minnie's on Haight. Others in SF & Oakland. Tonight I ordered 2 1/4 slabs of Baby's ribs to go. 1 of each variety. Damn juicy & delicious! Very tasty. The regular sauce, served on the side, had just enough kick. Service was terrific for my to-go order. Great conversation with the owner's brother  Embarrassed I don't remember his name. Super Friendly & caring about what I ordered. Very helpful. Yes, I read many of the 1 & 2 Star reviews. Thankfully my experience went the other way!  I'll be back!
author: Joshua C.

description:
Tried this place on Saturday with the family. The food and sides were awesome. I had ribs and pulled pork with potato salad. My daughter had the brisket with greens and Mac n cheese. My other daughter had the salmon which she loved. My only complaint would be how extremely hot it was in the restaurant. There is no Ac and the waiter explained its that hot because of the smoker inside the restaurant. I mean it was sweaty I need a fan type of hot. Second complaint would be the corn bread that they served us was burnt. When we asked them to replace it they said they were out of corn bread. Over all based on the food quality and
Portions for the price I would definitely go back. Just not on a warm sunny day lol!
author: Dianna G.

description: I just moved here from Texas and it's been hard to find a BBQ place to satisfy my southern palette. Until I came across Baby Blues BBQ and was completely satisfied with my brisket sandwich. If you don't need any sauce than the food was good and the environment was nice and friendly. I will definitely be going back here.
author: Jordan M.

description: First BBQ joint, nice place. Clean, friendly staff and the beef brisket is off the hook. Hard to find parking on a weekend but it's the place to be. They have four different sauces you can try that's already set on the table. My favorite is the ginger tobasco. I ordered the blue platter which comes with two choices of meat I chose pull pork and baby rack ribs. Pull pork is the way to go, also the sides. Mac and Cheese is bomb. Will come again
author: Josh S.

description:
BBQ spot on Precita and Mission. 

Beef rib - NA - Came here specifically to try the beef rib that is on their online menu. The waitress assured me that they had it. Got there and she asked if I wanted the beef or the rib. (/facepalm) Apparently it is no longer on the menu. 

Beef brisket - 1/5 - Tough and chewy, this was clearly not smoked. Took one bite and was glad I only ordered the smallest ala carte option. Didn't finish the rest.

Overall, I'm definitely not interested in coming back here. "I think not."
author: Mark O.

description: Best BBQ in SF , the locations in LA are amazing also. Great memphis style family recipe. By far my favorite spot for BBQ in the Bay area. Good food, good beer, good people
author: TRee G.

description: My work came here for a co-workers welcome lunch and we had a big feast! They have a lot of space to fit large groups.  They combined tables to fit 15 of us.  The food is delicious. I tried their ribs,  briskets, pulled pork,  corn bread,  candied yams,  and veggies.  However,  this restaurant is a bit expensive.  There are no lunch specials. I would come here more often if they have lunch specials and if the price is cheaper.
author: Jennifer T.

description: Best place for barbecue in SF. First time I came, one of the owners personally had me try a ton of meats until I built the perfect sandwich. Had similar experiences every time after that. Been coming ever since. One of the rare places in sf that you get that truly local neighborhood feel
author: Andrew X.

description: This place is on point!  Food is insanely good, good pours, prices low and the owner personally introduces himself.   Definitely coming back soon
author: Tyler R.

description:
The hot link was edible and that was the best part.

The brisket looked and tasted like shredded tires. Brownish though.

The corn bread was tired and funky, greasy.

The beans were foamy and it was too late because my appetite had already been lost.

Ordered via delivery and will not be returning. Wish I had checked the reviews first. 

BBQ as a food genre is amazing so I really hope they find a way to improve their quality.

Time to brush my teeth.
author: Arjun B.

description: Excellent food when it comes to the meat, side dishes left me lacking a little as did the service. Location certainly smokes there meat onsite which is awesome. There is a full bar as you enter which has quite a few offerings. Restaurant layout is a bit unimpressive.
author: Ryan L.

description:
I had such high hopes. I'm a brisket devotee. Every city I go to, I'm looking for the good smoked (preferably Texas style) brisket. I looked at the menu online. 1/2 pound of brisket for $10.95. perfect. That ordered, I added a side of creamed spinach. I got charged 18.95, and it looks like they just charged me for a brisket plate. Not. What. I. Ordered. 
I paid and left and won't be back.
They had $6 Skinner Bock, and my partner seemed to enjoy the chicken in his 2 meat 2 sides plate that cost 39.95. He liked the molasses sauce.
The sides we're just blah. Creamed spinach is not usually watery, though was perked up by the XXX sauce. The potato salad was bland. It was an unique interpretation of Mac & cheese... kind of sweet... maybe those were tomatoes in it... The cornbread muffins were not bad, but a bit flat, maybe day-olds? No pickles or onions to go with any of it? 
And the punk on the uke live serenade: 3/5. Two sublime songs too many.
author: Char Z.

description:
How to show a guy that YOU are a keeper:

(1) Bring him to Baby Blues BBQ.

(2) Skip the generically mediocre apps, Grilled Shrimp ($8): http://bit.ly/1w5rTu4 or Grilled Chicken Wings ($6): http://bit.ly/1ArWv7l.

(3) Order an entrée: The Blue Devil ($38)...to share: http://bit.ly/1zsXTUH.

(4) Manners? Pffft. Get down and dirty like you would behind closed doors. 

a. Devour the moist chicken and tender but not fall-off-the-bone ribs. Don't be shy, lick your fingers and give him a *wink wink*. 

b. Forget about the chewy brisket and wet mop of pulled pork.

c. Don't waste calories on the prison food sides; gummy mash potatoes, mushy corn (where's the blue cheese?), or wet mop pork and beans: http://bit.ly/1Ju10FR.

d. Stay away from the terrible corn bread unless you have a knack for eating old sponges.

e. Do share nostalgic the Banana Pudding ($5): http://bit.ly/1BuVNJB especially if you like whip cream in and out of the bed. 

(5) Give your leftovers to a person in need outside: http://bit.ly/17jxCk4. 

Not only are YOU a sexy beast, you have a kind heart to boot. Now what guy can resist that?
author: Cherylynn N.

description: The food is always great, especially their mac n cheese. Service is always a bit slow but what is to be expected of a busy amazing spot?
author: Tamara R.

description: OMG! This is where they're hiding the meat! Brisket, chicken, mac n chesse, cornbread and banana pudding on point! Really recommend this place for bbq. For out of town people, just take bart and get off at 24th & mission, walk two to three blocks heading towards cesar chavez street.
author: Barbara P.

description:
I've been to this restaurant a couple to times and have found it terrible.  This afternoon I went in after finding my favorite Taqueria closed for the holidays and thought I'd give Baby Blue another try.  Bad idea.

I order the Bisque Sandwich and order of fries. Not to difficult...right?  Well the meat was tough, the bread wasn't fresh, and the french fries were soggy and cold.  $20 down the drain.

I won't be back.
author: Marvelous Margaret M.

description:
Oh Baby Blues, I really wanted to love you.

My man had been wanting to try this place forever.  He ordered the ribs & pulled pork combo.  It comes w a side, & he picked coleslaw.  It also comes w cornbread.

I ordered the a la carte chicken, w a side of baked beans.  I'm on a protein kick.

It sure smelled great in the car on the way home.  
That was the best part.

Let me start w the good.  Both the coleslaw & the baked beans were solid.  Would totally recommend.  And my chicken was not bad.  Not great, but not bad.

The pulled pork was...mushy.  Watered down.  Flavor not bad, but...mushy.

The ribs.  I thought these were going to be the highlight of the meal.  They were not.  Dry & bland.  My man had to doctor them up.  Really?  

The cornbread.  I only tried a bite.  My protein thing.  All I'm going to say is that Cherylynn N. was right about it.  Skip the cornbread.

All in all?  No way am I going to quit 4505 Meats for my ribs/brisket/pulled pork needs anytime soon.

2 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
This place is really good. I ordered the combination plate with Memphis ribs and beef brisket, along with Mac-n-Cheese and banana pudding for dessert. Only reason I didn't give 5 stars is that my food wasn't very hot when it arrived. It was seasoned well and the BBQ sauce selection is great. Definitely a place to try if you're hungry for a variety of classic American BBQ...

Friendly service, good food, fair prices and a noisy, fun atmosphere. I will definitely try this place again when I'm in the mission district.
author: Jeremy W.

description: Had the pulled pork, now I've had it in other places and the pork is usually dry.  Not here with the Guinness sauce that it's cooked in the pork is nice and tender and not dry.  Recommend the spicy sauce it goes well with it.
author: Juan O.

description: To think I had high hopes for this place... every single rib I had was burnt... great if I was at the restaurant, I would've gotten a replacement. Wasted $$.... then the chicken was not completely cooked/had some pink, which I had to reheat. On top of that...those little corn breads are gross. Worse recipe ever. I have to say their BBQ sauce was good but... I'm reviewing the food though..
author: Ann L.

description:
I ordered carryout thru the Yelp app.  
The chicken was both dry and emaciated.  The brisket was bland.  They neglected to provide one of my sides and did not include napkins or a fork or offer them to me upon pickup.  I will not likely return because the chicken was so bad.
author: Victor C.

description: Just had food and drinks with the family, don't know why but I think that was the best BBQ I've ever had at this place maybe a different chief? Great atmosphere kid's Loved hanging out in kids corner
author: Sean M.

description:
Pretty amazing little BBQ place in the mission. Really great pork and chicken, homemade sauces and incredibly friendly service. Also extremely kid-friendly with a little room full of toys.

Highly recommended - definitely have the cornbread!!
author: Bob K.

description:
Totally hit the spot! Not sure why it has only 3.5 stars!

Got the plate with 3 types of meat and 1 side. We got the Memphis BBQ ribs (which they said is more flavorful and more meat) compared to the Baby Back Ribs (which is more tender and fall off the bone), which we also got. Both were fantastic! The last meat we got was the BBQ beef brisket, which was super juicy and had smoky flavor!  For the sides, we got cole slaw and pork and beans. Slaw was delicious, pork and beans was a little too heavy, next time I will probably get another slaw to balance out the meal.

Love the fact that they have 4 different types of bbq sauce at the table. One is original, one is a sweet one, and 2 spicy ones. They really put thought into their customers by providing wet napkins and plenty of extra napkins at the table for messes. 

Customer service was fantastic. Definitely coming back :D
author: Carmen C.

description: An absolute gem of a place, with cry-it's-so-good beef brisket and plenty of BBQ sauce. Owners and cooks are amazing and gracious hosts, down to earth and plenty of friendliness for any crowd. It doesn't feel like SF, and that's a total compliment.
author: Jacob H.

description:
I ordered the beef brisket and pulled pork combo with cow slaw to go.
And what did I get?
A $16 TV dinner.  My beef brisket was shredded and not good!  Pulled pork was OK but I can do better in my slow cooker at home.  Meat was "mushy".  Sauce OK.  I also got a small corn muffin which was good and the slaw was also good, but this is a BBQ joint and I'm judging the food based on the meat.  Please see photo.
Service was not good, but not bad.
Will not be coming back.
author: Angelique B.

description:
Walked in on Tuesday evening. Open tables and bar seating. At 5'2'' I'd opt for regular floor seating so that my feet can be planted onto the floor. It just makes eating easier (I think). Watch where your bum and back of knees land because I walked out with a gunk of nasty pasted on the back of my right knee.

Baby Back ribs are more curved. 
Memphis style ribs are straighter and longer. 

***Beef Ribs are currently off the menu because of the high market prices.*** 
(Call first.)

Bones and Blues (something like that) came with Memphis ribs and your choice of beef brisket or pulled pork. We asked for beef brisket and got pulled pork and didn't realize it until after dinner. We thought the beef tasted a bit off. The two sides: mash poatatoes (dry) and chicken smoked rice (yummy). The Memphis style rib was my favorite. The long skinny bones made the meat easier to eat. 

Baby Back Ribs (full rack) - it was a bit too spicy (peppery) for me, but I was able to put it down with their mild sauce. 

I was super excited for the cornbread (half the size of a credit card). It's sweet. I didn't see any corn pieces. It tasted great after the first bite, then second bite on it started tasting like chemicals. I'm not sure how else to explain it. 

Overall service was attentive, but I could've used more water refills. I got a total of 2 filled 8oz cups during my 50 minute dinner. 

If you plan on bringing your little one, they had a nook/corner for the kiddos to play - matted, shelf full of books and toys. 

$54 + tip for two people is a bit steep for okay-not bad ribs.
author: Jess W.

description:
Chicken was under cooked and pink
Ribs was burnt
This was my first and last time here
This place was god awful
author: Daniel T.

description:
I really wanted to like this place. It's super close to my work and I love barbecue and southern food, however, this place was not up to par. Since I didn't want a huge meal, I decided to go for a few sides. 

Creamed Spinach: whole spinach leaves (stems and all) lightly sautéed in a watery cream sauce. It was somewhat wilted and did not have the consistency I typically experience when ordering creamed spinach. 

Mac N Cheese: Just no. Selling this to people is wrong on so many levels! It had the worst fake cheese sauce and no sign of authentic melted cheese. I'd rather pay the $5 and have someone serve me Kraft macaroni and cheese. 
(Note: it was so bad that I took two bites and got afraid for my stomach so I actually returned it, they allowed me to exchange for another side- corn bread)

Corn Bread: (my Mac n cheese substitute) 2 biscuits of cornbread for $5?! Not to mention they were fairly tasteless and SOGGY!

Banana Pudding: this was the winner. It wasn't the best I've had, but it was actually on the same level of banana puddings I've had at other restaurants so that was an accomplishment for this place. Very whipped texture and a good balance of banana slices and wafers.

Overall: 2 stars, only for the banana pudding and understanding employees.
author: Shav S.

description: Awesome place . Danny we love you !! Great to see old friends from probably a decade ago . Your food is delicious and we are still thinking about it now .
author: Ro C.

description:
I don't sparkle in the sun; I drink iced tea.
Brown cornbread was the missile.cissile*.
Ribs a bit like Pete & Pete up the street & street.
Chicken was chicken; mine had a little blood.
Yolocoloslaw wasn't Meowthead's but not bad.
Okra served unfried for a change. I heart okra.
Chicken smoked rice isn't chicken bog. #googlethat
My clothes smelled afterward. A good thing.
4th star for waitress & her Cheetara print tat.

*#youhearditherefirst bomb.com is so tired.
author: Dan B.

description:
I've walked by Baby Blues a million times and never realized it was there. The restaurant was pretty empty on a Monday night, but I made a reservation just in case (Opentable points what what). It's a great place for groups, and they serve a variety of beers and wines at reasonable prices. When I walked in, a very hipster bartender greeted me, and she was super friendly and prompt!

After reading numerous reviews, it seemed that the shrimp and salmon were amazing, but Yelpers didn't agree on most of the meats and sides. I decided to try a sampling of different items to resolve this debate myself. I found that the shrimp was truly delicious and that the meat and sides were pretty average.

* BABY BLUES BAYOU, Grilled BBQ Shrimp ($22.95) - 4 STARS: Very delicious and fresh, but I definitely wouldn't qualify it as a "Tiger Prawn," which is what they advertise under sides. It's a small-medium sized prawn, and overall pretty expensive considering it comes with just 7 shrimp. I would have preferred to order a la carte (@ $2.50 each), since I wasn't a big fan of the sides (2 complimentary sides and corn bread). I'd suggest if you just want shrimp to buy a la carte since I wasn't a huge fan of the sides.

* BONES AND NO BONES, 1/2 Baby Back Ribs and 1/2 lb Pulled Pork or Beef Brisket ($25.95) - 2.5 STARS: I was not impressed by the ribs (not tender), the pulled pork (tasted pretty standard), or the brisket (which was plasticy and just not good). The saving grace was there large variety of BBQ sauces which spiced things up.

Sides:
* Cole Slaw: Standard
* Sauteed Okra: Surprisingly tasty and comes with stewed tomatoes mixed in
* Collard Greens: Standard but good
* Corn Bread: Sweet and chunky, not my cup of tea.
* Mac n Cheese: Just.... bad. I'm sad to report this had too much flour, seemed to be stewed too long, and lacked the necessary seasoning and cheese. I prefer easy mac.

Baby Blues is a cool spot, and I would definitely return with a large group because it has the perfect ambiance for you and friends to catch up over BBQ and beers. I wasn't particularly impressed by the food, but I wouldn't mind coming back and sticking with the seafood even though it is overpriced. If you're looking for BBQ at a lower price, I'd suggest splitting "The Feed Bags" which are priced for groups.
author: Jess C.

description:
Do you smoke? Baby blues does. 

I'm not going to rib you to go here. That is really up to you. Just good BBQ and good sides. Although the BBQ outshone the sides. But, like, it's meat in a pile so it's gonna outshine those vegetables. The ribs are especially great but just get whatever you like at BBQ. And pitchers of beer. They have those too. Frankly, get a mixed plate (my group got The Teaser) so you can try it all.

A great place to come and meat your friends.
author: Maya L.

description:
2.5 Stars

Long overdue review...

I was in the mood for some good BBQ and decided to look for a place to eat on Valentines Day! Yes, what is more romantic that some finger licking BBQ?!!? We had the kids with us, so being that this place was kid friendly, was even better!
I made reservations for 6:15 and once we drove around looking for parking (we got super lucky and found a spot just a few steps away) we were seated right away.  I'd suggest making reservations, when we left all the tables were full. I think if you didn't have reservations, they sat you at the communal table.
I'm a planner in all aspects of life. So much so, that I looked at the menu and decided on my dish. For starters, we had the Suicide King with pork,  I got the Bones, No Bones, hubby got the Memphis Queen and of course the kids got the chicken strips and mac and cheese.

Starter: The cornbread was tasty and crubmbly. It was on the sweeter side, which was ok.  The pork and coleslaw  was fine, nothing exciting about it.
However, the BBQ sauces that they had on the table are to DIE FOR!!! They should sell them!!!  A lot better than what you can get from the grocery store. I was dousing all my meat in it. My combination was the sweet sauce along with their spicy one. 

Main dishes: I was a little disappointed, our meat was room temperature. I'm sure it would have been better if it was hot. Also, I was looking forward to sliced beef brisket and not shredded beef brisket. Insert sad face here!

The mac and cheese tasted strange.... I think it was the cheese they used??. nMy kids didn't even finish theirs! And they can eat mac and cheese for days! Even the stuff out of the box!

Service:  Spotty throughout the night. Our server was busy with sooo many tables, that she was only by our table once to check on us and we had to wait and try to flag her down to get refills on our drinks. 

I don't think I'd come back. I'll definitely want to try out other BBQ joints.
author: Mimie L.

description:
I've only even had their pulled pork, because that's what I order every time I go here. So it's really my fault, but I am not going to change my ways any time soon. 

Awesome servers, good beer and wine and iced tea and old school sodas. A couple tvs if you want a quirky place with delicious food to watch the local sports team. Great menus for huge groups, and toys to keep the kiddos entertained!
author: Tasha D.

description:
Last night, I took 3 friends to dinner at Baby Blues. We were so very disappointed!
We were there when they first opened and it was fabulous. But, this place has gone downhill since.
We called to speak with the manager first before writing a negative review, but he was unresponsive and seemed disinterested in constructive criticism.
So here goes...
The ribs were undercooked and raw in the middle.
The pulled pork sandwich was mostly bread except for a big bone in the middle.
The MacCheese was soupy.
The cornbread was dry, small and boring.
The beans are very odd, being undercooked with large pieces of onion in them.  
The sauce bottles were filty and sticky.
The service was very good, these problems are completely in the kitchen.
They better clean up their act before they go under.
I know we won't be back!
author: Alan P.

description:
After 3 weeks of non stop studying for midterms, eating only bread for 3 meals a day....resulted in the release of the hungry beast. Where else would I release the beast other than Baby Blues BBQ. Thanks to my yelp friend Ben T., for his Zagat book, I was able to discover this gem.

~.::Atmosphere::.~
Upon entering, my party of 4 felt immensely grooved and welcomed into a jazzy classical barbecue restaurant. They seated us on these high stool tables with chairs that only had three legs. *my friend, Kevin S. almost fell back and off his chair....* Interesting choice of chairs... haha. Anyways, I felt like I traveled to Texas for some reason. It gave me that kind of feel. 

~.::Service::.~
Excellent Excellent Service. Our waiter discovered that it was our first time here at the restaurant and he gladly explained how things worked there. He gave us his honest opinions of what was good and popular there. Super caring and tending to our needs. When our food arrived, he thoroughly explained to us about the 4 sauces they had at the table: how each one tasted, which combination of sauce went well together, which one he liked, etc. Really loved the service here.

~.::Food::.~
Texas Style Beef Rib (Half Rack) $13.95: Amazingly juicy ribs.... amazing. Reminds me of Phil's BBQ back in SD ( my #1 go to BBQ place). Their sauce was HEAVENLY with the ribs........ 
Sweet mashed potatoes: I think it was pretty darn good. And I hate mashed potatoes. Ok. maybe not hate. too strong of a word. I dislike/prefer not to eat mashed potatoes. It was thick, creamy, sweet, and rich. 

did not get a picture of my dish.... probably because it didnt look pretty... LOL but here's a picture of my friends'. They got the platter: 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/baby-blues-bbq-san-francisco?select=E_Ju0PjGW4qc2TSjXaVAzw#mPf8hzb86I_su9znvF7vGg


All in all, a definite go back place. 

Amazing BBQ, EXCELLENT service, and great atmosphere.
author: Chena N.

description:
This use to be my go to spot before, but it seems like a lot of things has changed.

1. The Texas style ribs is no longer offer

2. The combo plate that use to come with 3 sides now come with just 1 side.

3. The service is HORRIBLE. The server said that "our order did not go through the system", but I honestly think she forgot. We ordered sweet tea, which she saw when she dropped off our delay food promising to refill it. Again she forgot. Not sure what she was doing, but she kept going to the Backroom. 

Also keep in mind that the place was not busy (go figure) and she still manages to screw up the service. She was only servicing 2 tables!!!!

Overall the food was still good considering that there is not a lot of good BBQ spot in sf, but I will not be coming back to nor will I recommend this place ever.
author: Michael T.

description: Baby Blues ribs lived up to their billing. Slow cooked, Louisiana style...but I don't know the difference between St. Louis style ribs, Memphis Style or any other style; I just know what I like. The potato salad was good, but didn't come close to the potato salad that my mom taught me how to make (but, she was from Mississippi). I ordered online and after a few glitches, successfully placed my order for pick-up. I loved the flavor of the extra b-b-q sauce that was included. The corn muffin, however, looked over baked and I refused to even sample it. I also was disappointed that the bread pudding I ordered turned out to be Banana Pudding, the other dessert choice. The flavor was okay but the texture was not that of a creamy, homemade pudding and, of course, there was not a hint of a real banana (and I know why; bananas have a very short shelf life and turn brown quickly). I would like to have sampled the bread pudding which is my favorite dessert, but was not willing to venture out again to correct their mistake. I re-checked my order- their mistake, not mine.
author: Anita C.

description: Place is filthy. BUT I stuck around with our group to have dinner. Uggg - tasteless BBQ, mushy Mac/Cheese. Terrible service.  Gave it a try but will not be back.
author: David E.

description:
Had an itch for bbq and stopped in with a hungry stomach. The service was awesome and loved talking with the server and the bartender. 

I ordered fries to start which were well cooked snd fresh.

From there, I ordered the three way combo with baby back ribs, chicken and brisket(sliced)that came with mac and cheese. The mac and cheese(soup) was the worst I've ever had, hence previous reviews proved accurate.

The ribs and brisket was tough, however the chicken was well seasoned and juicy. 

Still looking for great bbq in the city, and hopeful baby blues can at least improve its mac and cheese.
author: Rafael R.

description: I ordered a beef rib and was very disapointed, as was my wife and kids. We did not die but they offer nothing I am looking for, I will not go back. At least we found the gorilla bbq in Pacifica palitable. I think I will travel to San Jose next, I hear they have a very good BBQ house, I shall see.
author: Harold F.

description: Great BBQ in the Mission of SF.  Fun place to hang and have some great pulled pork & ribs.  Good slaw and fries as well.  Liked it all plain, want a big fan of the sauces offered, mostly vinegar based which is not my preference, but everything is cooked perfectly and didn't use the sauces, still delicious.  Casual atmosphere, good for a met up with friends.  Good with the kids as well.  Nice friendly attentive staff.
author: Steven B.

description:
we wanted memphis minnie's but postmates rejected our order. we tried this place instead hoping for a substitute and, because we were hungry, we did so without checking the reviews. so so disappointing. the brisket was pulled and tasted like an oily pot roast and looked completely  unappetizing. the pulled pork was bland and watery (it was water, not oil or juices) and the chicken was dry, flavorless and almost chewy. the fries were soggy (although that could have been because of delivery). i assumed these meats would be smoked but they definitely were not. waste of money and time. i don't feel i'm being hyperbolic saying it was inedible. 

maybe it'd be better in the restaurant.
author: Kimberly P.

description:
Nailed it.
I have eaten here meany times with Texas buddy who loved this place. Even after he moved I continued to go there or get take out. 

The last time was, meh. Good mostly but delivery Standard.

Tonight? So good. I think it showed up faster than when we dined in...and it was delivered by the owner himself (sorry. We met once and I don't recall his name).

Ribs: good, only brought one sauce though
Mac &a cheese: outstanding 
Coleslaw: refreshing 

Good bbq.
author: Robert M.

description:
Helluva Yummy! I ordered the Rebel  1/2 chicken and  1/2 ribs (& because of Madonna's new album)
The flavor of the meat was very tasty with a smoky flavor. I believe they smoke them then grill them before serving topped off with mashed potatoes, I was in Heaven after club Rio

5 stars baby!
author: Michael C.

description:
Great BBQ.  Had a pulled pork sandwich and Banana Pudding for dessert.
Nice owners. Parking is a bear!
author: Charles B.

description:
As a recent SF transplant from LA, home of the original Baby Blues in Venice and WeHo, I was so excited when I found out they had another location in SF.  My husband and I ate at the West Hollywood location religiously (even celebrated our engagement there!) but unfortunately, this location was a huge disappointment.  

Menu and recipes differ greatly, so much so that it doesn't even seem plausible they could be the same restaurant (no hush puppies? No suicide kings? No sweet potato fries? No tri-tip?)

I love a divey feel, but this place felt dingey-divey.  They had no soap in the women's restroom?  Hopefully there is another bathroom for the employees to wash their hands!  Fruit flies buzzing around.

If you do end up here skip the cornbread (cold), mac n' cheese (runny), and baked beans, but do get the banana pudding and try all the bbq sauces.
author: Brittany D.

description: Food tasted old.  The ribs definitely didn't taste fresh  - fat wasn't rendered, ribs weren't tender, and tasted of liquid smoke.   Max & cheese was soggy.  Overall though good service just not good food.
author: Goose V.

description:
I came here with my family after a long week. We wanted a place to relax, kick back eat some yummy BBQ, and sneak a beer. The result, perfect evening. 

We snagged a high top next to the walk-in closet which serves as the 'kids corner'. Our two year old and five year old had a blast while we snuck a frosty draft lagunitas. We ordered off of the kids menu for the oldest and split a combo plate of ribs and pulled pork for the rest of us. The pulled pork was excellent, the ribs could have been trimmed a bit more, but the rub was great, the sauces were very good too. Perhaps not the best st BBQ I've ever had, but i felt it was done with care and respect for the grilling arts and more importantly it hit the spot. The sides were fantastic. The greens superb and the mashed potatoes were a home made affair that weren't drowned in cream or butter. We liked it so much we ordered a second combo right then and there. The peeps next to us had a large family plate piled with all sorts of BBQ goodness and some beautiful looking corn on the cob.... we were more than a little motivated to come back to try more of the menu.

In sum, honest BBQ, done by folks that provide a chill unpretentious ambiance. Great for families. Long live baby blues BBQ.
author: Gabriel B.

description:
Second time I've order to go and both times I asked for extra BBQ sauce. Both times they gave me 2 little containers for half a chicken and a memphis queen! Honestly that is way too chincy. Especially when I called in and requested extra both times!!

Disappointed again.
author: Ernest L.

description: We discovered this place yesterday and it was so absolutely delicious that we are back here again today! The beef brisket is amazing melt in your mouth, and the owner is the most friendly guy you'll ever meet. Hopefully more people discover this gem of a place!!
author: SoCal G.

description: Absolutely amazing!  Marie and her boyfriend are amazing! They welcome you like you are a family member, visiting after being gone for years- like parents missing their kids being away at college!! They give advice on the menu, they have amazing  beers- and the food is absolutely fucking amazing! Come here- it's a gem!!! I'm so happy to have this place in SF! Do yourself a favor and visit
author: Christie C.

description:
Four of us went yesterday and tried the ribs both kinds and the brisket. Both of the ribs were very good but everything else seems to be not so great. The macaroni and cheese was probably the worst any of us have ever had very mushy and soupy. 

The brisket was dry and tough. I don't think anyone even ate the brisket because it was so dry and tough. It did not seem like the brisket was fresh maybe it was made a week ago and we were being served it reheated.

Lastly the okra was just kind of bland and on the cold side.


I would pretty much at this point only order ribs to go with no sides. The sauces are good too
author: Jeremy R.

description: Hair on food. Gross corn bread, hot sauce and greens. Mac and cheese was blue cheese...why?! Meat was mediocre at best. Service was great, but I would never go back! Good bye $50. :(
author: Shala M.

description:
The ribs were good, BBQ sauces and selection good, waitstaff nice and efficient, but 
-the brisket was 100% tasteless,
-cornbread was too sweet, no texture, 
- mac n cheese terrible (any actual cheese in there?)
Nilla vanilla wafers on the pudding does not improve it.  
I don't care if it's hipster and comfort food, if it don't taste good, it ain't fer ----.
author: Captaine s.

description:
Went here tonight for a birthday dinner.  We ordered one of the family meal deal! It was a little bit of everything with your selection of four side dishes. The ribs was on the dry side, but the bbq sauce made up for it! On the table you get to pick from two different bbq sauces and hot sauces. I liked the sauce that's on the sweet side. Taste so good! The ambiance was a little to loud for my liking.  However, I see the crowd was enjoying themselves and they didn't seem to mind the loud atmosphere. 
I would have deducted one star for the ambiance, but the customer service was tops from the waitress to the owner! I think he was the owner. He was very friendly and even walked us out and thanked us for coming!  Customer service goes a long way!
author: Eileen R.

description: I have been here several times this is my wife's 1st time here , she is a Hugh fan now. Simple put this place has the best BBQ in the city End of Story !! Their are some great southern cooking spots in the city and great BBQ places,, This Spot ,,, hands down the best ,, the smoke runs deep Into the meat to the bone without over cooking the outside of their ribs ,,, Everyone thinks they can smoke meat , truth is few can on this high of a level. Their hot links are 100% beef real hot links not that polish sausage or smoked brat ,bullshit ,, , it's real ,it's hot ,!!  ,, it's got the snap in the casing when you bite into it ,, sorry other BBQ restaurant s in the city ,, step it up plain and simple if you want my business...
author: Keaven G.

description:
How to have a Laborless Labor Day BBQ:

1) Go to http://eat24hours.com/

2) Type in Baby Blues BBQ.

3) Order the "Memphis Queen" Platter (1/2 Baby Back Ribs, 1/2 Memphis Ribs for $27.95) and the "Bones and No Bones" Platter (1/2 Rack Memphis, 1/2 lb. pulled pork for $24.95).

4) Answer the door just 30 min. later.

5) Douse the slightly dry but flavorful ribs in tangy BBQ sauce and wonder why there is hardly any pulled pork.

6) Make a note to self for next time - yay tomatoe-y collard greens and cornbread; boo soupy overcooked "mac 'n cheese" and underdone "creamed spinach."

7) Next year resolve to be not *quite* as laborless and make the drive to Gorilla Barbeque instead.
author: Amy C.

description:
Came on a Friday around 6:30pm. No wait. Parking wasn't too bad. 

IT was my husband's birthday, so he had the option of getting a free dessert or a free drink. He opted for the dessert and got a banana bread pudding. It was delicious. 

The bbq here is pretty good - everything could be a bit more tender. They leave out a nice selection of sauces to go with your bbq. I enjoyed their sides way more than the meat. The beer go for a pretty reasonable price. 

Staff is friendly and professional. We sat at a high table with stools. BEWARE of the stools. It feels like you can fall over when you lean back. There's also a kids corner with toys and books where children can play in.
author: Katherine C.

description: Greatest bbq in the city. Large portions of food. I'm lactose intolerant however their home mac and cheese is incredibly worth it. They have a variety of flavorful sauces for your already delicious bbq, but just in case you need a little extra punch for your grub.  Their selection of alcohol is also satisfying I'm never one to complain about tasty inebriation.
author: Francois D.

description:
I wish I liked this place more!!

The upside is the coleslaw and the sauces were  pretty good. Everything else was extremely disappointing. I had the shrimp po boy and I could only take a few bits of it, I was completely unhappy with the taste. The collard greens we're alright but definitely needed some BBQ sauce to spice it up. The macaroni and cheese was the worst I've ever had. Very gooey and tasted like slime. The service was great despite everything else. 

This was a spur of the moment choice because we craved some soul food. Needless to say I will never come back here or recommend this place to anyone.
author: Mia P.

description: I was in town for a couple of days and we wanted to try out the bbq in the area. while others had already closed,  we were happy that this place stays opened till' 11pm. the ambience is pretty chill and laid back. the tables are these large logs of wood sliced in half. I thought that was cool. the waiter was very friendly and courteous and walk us through the menu. my friends all tried the bbq ribs,  duh. I was the black sheep and tried their pulled pork and beef brisket. very delicious, good texture,  moist and very well prepared. my fiance couldn't finish her half rack of ribs (very well proportioned) and I gave them a try. very tender and juicy..the two things that you want from your bbq ribs. if you're in town and would like some good bbq, this place will definitely satisfied. check them out!
author: Josue R.

description:
I had a craving for brisket so decided to go to Gorillas BBQ in Pacifica.. Unfortunately they were closed! I remembered baby blues BBQ when I was in the mission so I decided to drive on down and give em a try.

The restaurant is nice. It's clean and has a little San Francisco flare to it. The servers are great. Very attentive and very professional. Service with a smile! 5 stars for them. I came for brisket and brisket is what I ordered. I was disappointed. It was pretty dry. It wasn't juicy and lacked that smokey mouth watering melt in your mouth taste....

I had the Memphis style ribs and the beef rib. Both excellent. Tender and juicy. Especially the beef rib! That had more of a brisket feel to it! The corn bread I wasn't too find of. First off it was a dark brown and looked more like a carrot cake. It had a weird taste to it. Not like your normal corn bread. Mac n cheese was very good. Creamy goodness.

I would come back for the ribs. I like the restaurant, just not the brisket...
author: Roger P.

description: I ordered the chicken and brisket plate with a side through Postmates . The brisket was not very flavorful and was served in a bowl with watery brisket juice?? Too chewy and not tender. The baked beans were not the BBQ beans that I expected. Also pretty bland. The chicken was amazing! Tender and juicy. And the cornbread was the highlight of the meal. I wish they gave you more than one small cup of bbq sauce but i could have requested another sauce. Overall my meal was average. Probably won't eat here again though.
author: Olivia W.

description: I love that I can order a mixed platter of meats here!  One platter of three meats and two sides is more than enough to share between to small girls.  Great homemade sauces.  And dessert!  Whatever the banana cream pudding thing that we ordered was amazing.  Never had anything like it, but it was pretty much super whipped cream with fresh bananas and crushed Nilla wafers in it.
author: Alani R.

description: Just tried the pork belly salad, and it's terrific.  Well seasoned, nice cut of meat, ripe pears, and a tangy gastrique.  Perfect for a sunny day.  I've tried their bbq chicken here before, and it's moist and flavorful.  You also get to choose from a multitude of sauces.  Only downside is the fries are quite soggy.
author: Monica O.

description:
I la la la love baby blues!
-cool selection of bbq sauces to choose from on the table
-pulled pork sandwich w/ mashed potatoes
-texas beef rib w/ cream spinach mashed potatoes n corn bread
-queen of memphis w/ cream spinach mac n cheese n corn bread

Everything was really good, but I have to say my favorite was the texas beef rib just cause I like to feel like a caveman and just grub. This is like the brother of the tomahawk from Alexander's (which is my fave topped w/ foie gras). The sides are delicious, but why fill up on sides? I came here to eat me some meat baby. The staff are very friendly and very helpful. If you have questions they take the time to answer them. I love how the outside of the place has a sign that says DRUGS or was it drugstore, whateves but it caught my eye. I think it's pretty cool how they kept it because it just makes the place even more interesting when you walk in.
author: Mary Ann B.

description: Incredible food in a super location! Went here on a sat afternoon after chilling in DP! Smashed a combo plate of ribs and slices brisket with a side of potato salad! Easily the best corn bread I've ever had.. The sweet bbq sauce is immense
author: Jack O.

description:
Decent and very casual. 

I had the Suicide King which was pretty small but I wasn't hungry so that was fine. The lemonade was more sour than it was sweet. And my boyfriend had the memphis queen with a side of mac and cheese and mashed potatoes. The meat was a bit too blackened for my liking but the meat was good. Not slide off the bone good but good nonetheless. The mac and cheese was good too, but a bit too watery. 

Overall. I would come back again with a group of friends that want to have BBQ food but I wouldn't come back alone.
author: Helen J.

description:
Baby Blue, isn't that the name of Beyonce's new baby she had on Saturday?  But no, the only babys here are baby back ribs.

My first impression walking in was a good one.  There is a nice bar with flat screens. Quite a few seats for dining, each table having four different BBQ sauces to choose from.  And of course every eatery has a community table these days which I personally don't care for.  Nobody wants to hear my conversations and you definitely can't tell any booger jokes or Pootie Tang talk: See, my damie, Pootie Tang don't wa-da-tah to the shama cow... 'cause thats a cama cama leepa-chaiii, dig?

The menu had the normal sides like Mac & Cheese, Collard Greens, corn bread, etc.  The meats are ribs, brisket, blackened catfish, chicken, etc.  We ended up ordering the Blue Devil which is 4 meats with 3 sides.  I would have ordered catfish but they don't fry theirs, so here's what we ordered:

Memphis and baby back ribs:  it's strange cause I didn't taste a difference.  Both are cooked with dry rubs and charred almost too much but I like my ribs burnt a little so it was decent.  

Beef Brisket:  was ok flavor but the brisket here is dried out.  Kind of hard to swallow so take small bites or your company will be doing the heimlich maneuver to get that chunk of brisket out of your throat.

Tiger Prawns:  I really liked the prawns.  But who doesn't like big prawns?

The sides I got were Mac & Cheese, Baked Beans, and Mashed Sweet Potatoes.  I had high hopes but each "fixin" as they call it was disappointing.  

The service was ok except the waitress dropped a jar of BBQ sauce right next to my girl and got sauce all over her.  I would think the waitress would have gave some compensation of some sort, like a free beer or something for her.  As Pootie Tang would say: "Wa Da Tah" (that's for sure). But the waitress didn't.

The food was ok.  But overall as Pootie would say "I gotta say Nay-No (No) my brotha.
author: Michael L.

description:
First I order delivery from EAT24.They gave
me a delivery window 45mins-1hr.It arrived in
50mins.Thumbs up EAT24.Now the food.I order
the Memphis Ribs(1/2 a rack-2 sides)$20.00.
And Smoked Chicken Free-Range(1/2 a chicken)
$10.00.

PROS:

Before I opened the bag I could smell the 
the ribs,and they smelled damn good!The ribs
had a nice char on them.The sauce on them was
ok(not hot or spicy).Decent smoke flavor.
I'll give it 3 stars.The chicken was very
good.Nice rub on the meat.Meat was tender,
not dry.I'll give it 3 stars.The greens
were ok.Nice spice to them.You get a decent
portion on the side orders.

CONS:

The ribs are skinny.There definitely is not
enough meat on the ribs.Not worth $20.00,even
with the 2 side orders.The chicken size is
somewhere between a cornish hen and a real
chicken.I guest thats why they call it free-
range.Not for $10.00.The Mac & Cheese had to
to much chedder in it.You could'nt taste the
pasta.I would have giving the greens a 4 star.
But you can tell,they don't use smoke meat in
the greens.And the 2 sauces that come with it,
are not that great either.1 taste like plain
kecthup.The other one was tangy(ok).

I've order from Baby Blues and Memphis Minnies
in the last two weeks.I like Baby Blues ribs
better than Memphis Minnies.But,Memphis Minnies
St.Louis Style Smoked Pork Ribs(2 sides)$18.95.
Definitely have more meat on their ribs(but I
was'nt to thrilled with the rub they put on the
ribs).I order (1/2 a slab) and only got 4 bones.
(GIP!).Memphis Minnies Smoked Chicken (1/2 a
chicken - 2 sides)$14.75.I did'nt like the rub 
on the chicken and it was dry.But their chicken
is definitely bigger then Baby Blues.Memphis
Minnies greens are way to sweet (uggHa!).Their
Mac & Cheese was ok(nothing special).Minnies
sauces where nice.They have a mustard sauces
that is pretty good.I think you're suppose to
dip the meat in the sauce,and it did make the 
meat taste better.Also their sides are smaller.

All in all you don't get the bang for your buck
from either restaurant.3 stars Baby Blues and
2-1/2 stars for Memphis Minnies.

p.s. I ordered Memphis Minnies delivery from
       GRUBHUB.They also deliverd on time.
       Thumbs up!
author: John S.

description:
Wow, I really loved my Mary's free range chicken from here. 

We ordered a whole chicken with zesty, and a side of sweet potatoes.  I thought the chicken was excellent, I would give it a 4.5, juicy and tender.  BBQ sauce was pretty yummy too, and the spicy sauce was WOAH spicy, but my guy who loves spice ate that up.  I loved the sweet potatoes, I almost didn't get them because most places make them too sweet for me, but these tasted like real food, simply perfect

We did a pick-up order, the food was ready when we arrived and the service was friendly and prompt.  Cute place too.  We'll definitely be back for more BBQ!

You can Zesty for a free meal: send me a message and I will share my code with you... for your first meal FREE !
author: Coco J.

description:
I've spent most (but not all) of my life above the Mason-Dixon line. I enjoy very fine barbecue, spiced and smoked to melting, swabbed with molasses, but don't look to me for experiential cultural knowledge of what constitutes authentic Memphis BBQed thusandsuch. 

We got the Big Blue ($28.95), which is three meats with any two sides, and chose smoked salmon fillet, grilled BBQ tiger shrimp, and baby back ribs for our meats, and pork and beans, and chicken smoked rice for our sides. This came with one piece of dark cornbread, about which I liked the little bits of whole corn that popped in my mouth. It's more like a crusty, rustic corn cake, with a little caramelization inside and out. This is a cornbread that is best reserved for dipping into the dregs of whatever meaty, sweety swill is left on your plate, otherwise known as my favorite part of every bar-b-cue adventure. 

The salmon arrived with a little cup of buttermilk dill dressing, which was in totality the star of the show. I didn't perceive any smokiness to the plain, unseasoned salmon whatsoever, but what I did get was a luscious, tender piece of regular fresh salmon fillet cooked to the perfect humidity and color, and when paired with the addictive buttermilk dill dressing, I felt like a stingy dog growling low over a bowl of something awesome. 

I didn't share the salmon, but I did fork over half of the baby back ribs and sides. The ribs were excellent in the thick molasses sauce. I just wish there had been more of them. I didn't care for the thinner, vinegar-based BBQ sauce, and the chile-based one was predictably too hot for me (see also: the whole hot peppers in vinegar bottle), but these are absolutely personal taste things, and not a reflection on their quality. 

I was simultaneously pleased and grossed out by the tiger shrimp; pleased at how they were butterflied, so the flesh really plumped up with barbecue seasonings on the grill, but disgusted by the bottom inch per shrimp that wasn't de-veined. That's a polite way of saying that the poop-tubes were intact. I had to do BBQ-infused surgery on them, and it wasn't pretty. For $2.50 apiece à la carte, these are too expensive to merit leaving behind any hint of shrimp-crap.

As for the sides, the pork and beans was excellent, topped with huge hunks of tangy, melty, pre-pulled pork. Unfortunately, the chicken-smoked rice was dry, full of multicolored pepper skins, and nothing to write home about.

The smallish meal (Big Blue, a bottle of Perrier, tax, and ~22% tip) ran us $45. It came with unlimited napkins, wet-naps, and toothpicks (I'm not being sarcastic - some places charge you for these things!).

I do think this place is a four-star BBQ place, and a four-star place in general, especially in terms of San Francisco. The staff was friendly, the bar patrons were also very pleasant (everyone on stools looked to be dressed in a neofuturist speakeasy style), they're open past 9PM, they have a whole area of kids' toys, and the walls bore a small collection of tasteful old objects that set a pleasant, quirky (but not hokey) atmosphere. We'll be back (at the very least, for that salmon)!
author: Austin J. A.

description: Such a great spot to catch a brew and football game not to mention some killer BBQ! Everyone is chill and in a good location
author: Joe F.

description: So far my favorite BBQ spot I had chicken, ribs,& brisket. I like how they offer different sauces and explain the sauces to you. The environment is awesome! Really great customer service! The waitress took a starter of fries off of our tab since they forgot about it, she brought it after and let  us know it was on the house. I was not bothered by it, it happens, her customer service was outstanding. I took two plates to go for my family and they loved it ! Nothing like great BBQ and great hospitality!
author: Edgar P.

description:
Every Jew has a lion that lives inside of them. This beast craves bagels, smoked meats, potato pancakes, and good deals. Since moving to the bay from NYC, this Jew has had a very hard time feeding said beast. But Baby's has stepped up to the plate, much like the blessed sound of matzah snapping at the breadless Passover table. 

Five stars for an amazing staff. 

Seriously, everyone that works here are tremendous. As a tattoo'd queer, it's also super refreshing to walk into an establishment that hires folks with body mods, and the space to be exactly who they are. Huge kudos to management for that. 

Food:

Let me lament for a second - do you know how hard it is to find a good caesar salad? (my autocorrect just changed caesar to "career" I feel you autocorrect but this isn't the time nor place). 
For a salad that is basically an American institution, it is actually shocking how few places can deliver a caesar that holds up. 
Actually it's ridiculous. 
Well. Fear not. They won the caesar lotto here. Get one. 

The hot link is damn tasty. 
Take it from someone who grew up eating frankfurters at the finest New York Delicatessens, this ain't the Lower East Side, but the casing is popping. 

Brisket is good. Could be a little more moist. 

Thankfully there is a plethora of sauces that sit right in front of you at your table. This is either your heaven or worst nightmare; if you're the dry rub kind of humans I apologize in advanced for what I'm about to say: I love me a nice coating of BBQ sauce and by coating I actually mean side dish devoted solely to said sauce so that I can drag my meat through it like a tow truck. 

I always get the mac and cheese and the greens. Which are a ok. 

At some point I should note that I've 100% never eaten here 200% sober meaning at least 100% of the time I've been drunk. 

I should also note that I am a writer and not a math teacher. 

Enjoy.
author: Ryley P.

description:
I've been here a few times now and love it! 

The food is amazing - ribs, chicken wings, mac n cheese, burgers are all good 
The homemade sauce is even better
The service is always spot on 
The portion sizes are BIG
It's cheap! 

One of the best places in San Fran!
author: Kelly M.

description:
My parents are quite aware of my Yelping. It seems that whenever we start discussing restaurants, we start debating which place in the neighborhood is good, which is overrated and which we have tried already and have yet to try. Ehhh, it seems we all have our opinion and interests. 

My Dad and I were going out for dinner the other night and couldn't make up our mind of which restaurant to go to. We stopped here because parking was ample. I had been looking forward to Baby Blues BBQ for quite sometime, but wasn't sure about the timing since I had plans later. BBQ takes time.
