My company has an office on the same block, so I figured I would have lunch the next time I was on assignment there.  Today was my day, though I got to that location late.  Since all of my co-workers had already eaten, I walked in by myself for a power lunch.

Since it was already past 1:30 today, the place was about half full.  I sat down at an empty table, and a waiter gave me a glass of water and a menu.  I ordered one of the lunch specials and a soda.

The Cherokee Spike (the special I ordered) consists of a large portion of pulled pork, another large portion of beef brisket (pulled), and one smoked link.  On the table, were a selection of sauces, which the waiter described to me.

The pulled pork was tasty, with just a little bit of juice.  It paired well with the apple cider vinegar.  The brisket was also very good, especially with the mild BBQ sauce.  But, surprisingly, my favorite meat was the smoked link.  It had just enough spice to give it a kick, but not enough to make me gasp for water.  And the skin had a great snap when I bit into it!  

Along with all this, the plate came with a piece of cornbread and one side of my choice, which, in this case, was the Blues on the Cob.  The corn was grilled, sprinkled with Parmasian cheese and served with a lime wedge.  While not my first choice on how to serve corn, it was tasty.

All in all, I enjoyed my meal, even though it was a little rushed.  The next time I come in, I'll enjoy a nice, slow dinner, and probably order a Texas-style beef rib.
author: Jeffrey S.

description: Paul,  the owner brought his Philly roots to San Fran and did his home town proud. Amazing pork ribs. A mix of slowed cooked with spices crisp outside and juicy next to the bone .  Perfection !!  The sides were the best.  A cold draft and these ribs brings you close to haven. Friendly service
author: Paul G.

description: Fun spot. Cool vibe. Just ok food. Meat was good but lacked seasoning. I love BBQ and would go anywhere for it but this fell short. Good prices and fun music but missed the mark on the baby backs and pulled pork.  Our entire table was underwhelmed.
author: Sandy M.

description: First time here. Ordered the beef brisket, but was told that they were out, but had pulled beef. We settled for it and it was ridiculous that they'd even serve something like that at a BBQ restaurant. Im not even sure where the pulled beef is from. It couldn't have been from a brisket because it was not smoked and not tender at all. Very disappointing meal. They alsoput the tiny cornbread on the main plate where the bottom got soggy from the meat juices. Who does that ? We ordered the meatballs and they were too burnt and not even round. The waitress had to go to the kitchen to ask what meat it was made of. Very disappointing. Memphis Minnie's all the way!
author: Jessica W.

description:
Ordered food yesterday. Everything was delicious, but my stomach disagreed with me. I blame myself for eating too fast. Next time, I'll eat something beforehand to better cushion my stomach from overreacting. Cheers!

- July 2013
author: Bianca B.

description:
I've eaten about five different meats at Baby Blues - they ranged from very good to awesome. As much as I love pulled pork, the beef rib was like eating a steak on a dino-rib. Excellent. The Memphis ribs are great too and they alone are worth coming for, too. The 1/4 chicken also is shredded, and yet tender and moist - not easy to do with chicken! 

A bunch of sauces are on every table and more are available on request. A co-worker brought me here and we ordered/ate so much that ended up with seven bottles by the end of the meal.

Holly is fantastic. She works behind the bar and covers the occasional table. Speaking bluntly and yet nicely is a rare quality, but she has it! She also made the surprisingly good suggestion that we try the mashed potatoes, mac and cheese, and a bbq sauce. Collard greens were great too. Heck, I even liked the sweet potatoes. 

Baby Blues has a nice variety of beers that are priced for drinking 3-4, not just 1-2. And yet, they're quick to refill water glasses too. That's a rare combination in my experience.
author: Mike H.

description:
This place is great. Ribs are to die for. All of it is good. I live in the neighborhood; I go all the time and order pick-up. I've even given gift cards from here. 

Highlights are the meat of course, then there are the sauces (you get to pick from four--heaven!), and sides are all so good I'm always changing my mind. 

Baby Blues is my main BBQ when I don't cook it myself. I find myself reminded of Austin here. It's nice.
author: Kevin C.

description:
This place is super yums yums and the girls who work here are awesome!  A little on the pricey side, but is totally worth it.  I don't know the girl's name who served us tonight but she is a total sweetheart, she's got a great tattoo of the heart shakra on her chest.  They were all out of the desert we wanted and she found me the last piece of peanut butter mud pie they were selling earlier in the night.  Unfortunately we didn't have enough cash on us to give her the tip she deserved but we'll hit you back next time girl!
The food is soooooo good and it sucks walking to the bus in the morning and smelling that bbq cooking!
author: Kelly N.

description:
Delicious food. We got the trout salad and it was so yummy. We also got the baby back ribs. Perfectly cooked and not dry. Smokiness was perfect. All the sauces on the side and all delicious. 

Service awesome! Everyone comes by to check on you. Almost can't tell who your wait staff is because everyone is so nice and accommodating. 

Tv with the game on and a play area for the little one. Play area is not the cleanest  looking but my kid didn't notice. Maybe I'm just freakish. Anyways it kept her occupied and let me eat. 


Did I mention every one is so nice.  Love this joint. Definitely will be back again.
author: Janie H.

description:
Baby Blues is by far the best BBQ in the city.  I frequent it and everything I've ordered has hit the spot.  
I usually begin my meal with the grilled tiger shrimp and a side salad.  
The Lasker Burger with bleu cheese/bacon/onion ground into the patty is the best burger I've had.
If you love Mac n cheese, then don't miss that and the banana pudding is a great desert to end the meal with.
Nothing is fried, grill only.
I love this place :-)
author: Keith K.

description: Well the brisket was good and that's the best thing I can say about the place.  The "Baked Beans" were simply an assortment of beans in a barbeque sauce and the "Pork and Beans" were the same beans with the pulled pork from the sandwich board tossed on top. Cornbread?  Corn pucks.  And the greens?  Clearly made by someone who's never had real, good southern greens.  That and nothing was hot when served.  At nearly $50.00 for two there are any number of restaurants within walking distance that better merit my custom.
author: David H.

description:
BBQ. Banana Pudding. Kidz Corner. What more do you need? I dare say this may be my new favorite BBQ spot (sorry Phil's).

While the food & service is stellar - all what impresses me most is how the restaurant is going to deal with my kids.

There's a cozy little cove stocked with toys to keep my rugrats busy while waiting for food or while I'm stuffing my face with BBQ ribs & cole slaw & corn bread.
author: Kelly R.

description:
Solid BBQ joint. Very friendly service, I usually order delivery when I'm craving comfort food, about once a month.

Ribs are ok. 3 stars
Pulled pork platter is the best. 4 stars. Generous portion and love the different hot sauces you can slather on.

Sides:
Mac n Cheese (with bleu cheese, makes it different) is good. A little bit goes a long way, it's pretty rich. Same with the Creamed Spinach
Mashed potatoes are good 
Love their pork n beans, so flavorful.

Louisiana hot link is spicy goodness. Thank you Baby Blues!
author: Jordan Q.

description:
It was a good new year's eve dinner.  They have tiny guitars and lots of side dishes.  The slow cooked chicken, dark meat was tasty.  The white meat was rather dry. The charred skin of the chicken was flavorful.  They have a nice selection of different BBQ sauces if you want to try - my favorite was the one called "molassy", because it was sweet, tangy, and reminded me of good ole faithful collie dogs.

Cornbread was pretty tasty, standard oily chewy mess.  The mashed sweet potato side was heavenly, but the okra was too garlicky for my taste.  The okra was cooked with tomatoes and was also dry, but it's not the season, I suppose.  Still...sigh....

The ribs and the pulled pork looked delicious.  

Oh and I got a kick out of the fact that at night above the door they light up the old Rexall Drugstore neon sign.  Except all it says is "DRUGS".
author: Shinny L.

description:
I came to Baby Blues BBQ for a weekday dinner with a friend and we both ordered a Pulled Pork Platter which came with two sides and cornbread. The restaurant was pretty empty when we came and our food was brought out so fast, it was like the kitchen read our minds and prepped our order before we even placed it with the waitress. 

For my two sides, I went with the mac-n-cheese and cole slaw. The pulled pork was moist and went really well with the sauce out of the round bottle which had a spicy kick that just spreads on your tongue (the round bottle at our table didn't have a tag on it so I'm not sure what it's called). I tried the original sauce which was nothing too special, and the sassy molasses which tastes like your standard bbq sauce. There was one more sauce on the table, ginger tabasco I believe which I opted not to try. I really enjoyed the corn bread which was packed with corn kernels. However the bland cole slaw wasn't my favorite and the mac-n-cheese was nice and soft but I could not stand the bleu cheese flavor in the mac.

Service was good and there's a bunch of interesting decor pieces throughout the restaurant. Although I wasn't very impressed with my first platter at Baby Blues, I'd like to return to try a slab of ribs.
author: Maya S.

description: Definitely a great place to get your BBQ fix. Got the hound dog which was the perfect amount of food! Could have done without the Mac & Cheese, but overall it was a great meal and customer service was friendly :)
author: William N.

description:
Pros: the food was good. A little on the cold side, because it was take-out and because we had to make 2 trips.  Here's why....

Cons: We had to go twice tonight to order for take-out.  We ordered, got our food, and went home.  Once we unpacked the bag, we found our order was wrong.  So we went back, tried again, and added a few things because it looked like it wouldn't be enough food, and then were overcharged. Once we got home again, we found half of our correct order, but the other bag was someone else's order, with their receipt, name, and address in the bag.  So we called to let them know this, but were subsequently blamed for ALL the mistakes, because we "left before our order was finished" both times.

All in all, customer service was severely lacking -- I work retail, and I know you NEVER fault the customer, even if it is their mistake (which in this case, it wasn't), and you don't make them feel guilty for reporting a mistake ("Well, now you have plenty of food...") . The food was good, the Memphis ribs especially, but our okra is probably is still waiting for us (or someone else got it).  Please, if you get take-out, check your order before you leave so no one can fault you for it.
author: Amanda M.

description:
San Francisco may not be known for its barbecue, but this place is off the chain! Finger-lickin good.

We came here for a friend's birthday party and left bursting at the seams. Everything here is good, but I highly recommend the pork spare ribs. The meat is succulent and falls right off the bone. Our friend also loved their chicken wings. As for the 'fixins', you have to go with the cornbread and collard greens. These fixins took our meal from good to great. We will definitely be back!
author: David P.

description:
Great Place, nice ambiance, not pretentious, very comfortable.

Great Service

Nice Bar

Great Ribs

AMYZING Sides!!!

I usually get the Memphis Queen and take 1/2 home. It's a 1/2 Rack of Baby Backs and a 1/2 Rack of Memphis Ribs, with 2 generous sides and corn bread. It is pricey, but every once in awhile you need to treat yourself right?

They have 4 house made sauces to choose from. My favorite is a combo of the sweet with a sprinkle of the hottest just to give a little bite to all that sugar.

I love the creamed spinach, the garlic mashed potatoes, the sweet potatoes, the mac and cheese, the pork and beans (mostly meat), and the stewed tomatoes. I like the corn bread and there is usually pie, I mean how can you go wrong with pie;)

Baby Blues in both SF and in LA is an old favorite, and in my regular rotation. 

The fact that they are MC/Scooter rider friendly is an added plus for me. They get that you have a lot of gear and that you have no trunk to leave things in. They don't judge you when you walk in looking like an alien with all your gear. Which is what I tend to get at a lot of places when I come in for dinner after a day on the bike.
author: E R.

description:
I went here last sunday afternoon for lunch, and I was pleasantly surpised. I was searching for a good barbecue place in the bay area where the meat wasn't drowned in sauce or the sides were less than satisfactory. I really like the potato salad and the mac & cheese. The cornbread was also really good. As someone who enjoys a sweet barbecue sauce I was pleased with the one that they had. it went really well with the pulled pork and brisket. I would like to go back and try their beef ribs though. I was also told that the banana pudding was amazing too.

The only criticism that I have is that when we asked the server for another order of cornbread it didn't come.
author: Tiffany M.

description:
This is my third or fourth time eating their BBQ, and there's been a long lag time between experiences. Tonight, I know why. 

Baby Blue BBQ ranges from very mediocre to not good. I'm annoyed that they do both pulled and sliced brisket and they don't even tell you the difference on the phone and they default to the pulled brisket which is very bland and somewhat tough. Don't get the pulled brisket--it will ruin your concept of brisket and bbq in general. The ribs are always a little bit too dry--all of the styles. Their bbq sauce is a highlight, some spicy, some sweet, not too vinegary. 

The sides here used to be my consolation for so-so meat, but the sides have definitely gone down hill. Not what they were a few years back when they opened. You can read it all in the previous reviews: The mac-n-cheese is soupy, the creamed spinach is very unconventional (in a bad way), the collard greens are standard but very average, the sweet potato mash has lost all flavor over the years and the cornbread is greasy with too much butter and dry pieces of corn. 

Overall, not a good place to eat, and I think I wil never eat from there again by choice. Too many great places to eat, to waste my time and money on this place. Let's face it, San Francisco just isn't a barbecue town and that's okay since I can make my own bbq if I really wanted it, or save my cravings for when I'm in a bbq town. 

Sorry Baby Blues, I'm done. No more!
author: E L.

description: If I wanted beef jerky for ribs I would have gone to the corner store to purchase them. The ribs were overly dry and extremely fatty. The cornbread tasted like something I'd never eat for free nonetheless pay for and the collard greens were very bland to say the least. The only thing decent I had was the banana pudding. I was really looking forward to this meal and tried to enjoy it, unfortunately baby blues just gave me the dinner blues and that is why they are receiving a single star.
author: Jay S.

description: My girlfriend and I came here last night on a date, and I had to say we were both disappointed. I'll start off by saying their two-house appetizer was delicious. It came with two pieces of chicken, meatballs, and shrimp. But how quickly everything changed as we got to our main dish. I ordered a beef brisket sandwich, and she ordered a salmon sandwich. After taking a couple bites, the salmon was just burnt to a crisp with no flavor whatsoever. On two different occasions, my girlfriend had to run to the bathroom twice because of a upset stomach. First impression is a lasting impression, and I won't be returning here for their service anytime soon.
author: Emmanuel A.

description: The meats here are made really well here, but I'm indifferent about the different types of BBQ sauces. and have never had a good experience with delivery. I would only recommend going to the restaurant that has a nice dive feel to it.
author: Lana S.

description: I ordered a sliced brisket with a side of Caesar salad and cole slaw. The latter two were kinda meh, but the brisket was absolutely perfect and the portion was great. The house-made barbecue condiments were a delight. I also loved the cozy neighborhood bar feel of this place. Will definitely come back.
author: Abdel H.

description:
Attended an excellent baby shower that was catered by these folks (I am lucky to know such people).  Really fantastic bbq, a bit on the well done side which is exactly how I like things.  Thinking back I can't believe that I sampled so many things and still didn't get to everything.

The brisket and pulled pork were good, but the ribs (baby back) and chicken quarters were out of control good.  Sides were distinctive and well executed.  The beans seemed like a three (or more) bean blend that was not cooked down to mush, but were still tender and rich.  Potato salad was chunky and light with lovely skin on reds.  I prefer a heavier, sweeter style, though I realize that's probably a little bit trashy of me.

Corn bread!  Pure gooey, buttery, pudding like heaven.

Would love to check this place out at the source, but catering was a great intro.
author: Patrick S.

description:
After reading some reviews I decided to give these guys one last chance to impress me. I went all out and ordered one of their pricey "Platters", the one called Memphis Queen. For $25 I got a half order of baby back ribs and a half of "Memphis" ribs with two sides and corn bread. The sides I chose were the collard greens and the okra but they were out of the okra so I accepted corn on the cob, The server recommended the Mac n cheese but I'd had it before and thought it was mediocre at best.

I don't know a tactful way of putting it but the ribs just aren't good. I realize this is a "Texas style" BBQ place were they dry rub instead of "saucing" the meat but the rub tasted like chemicals. I tried all four of the sauces and didn't like any of them. The XXXX was hot but the strongest taste was vinegar, there was no depth or character to the flavor. The "Tabasco" was about the same except a little less hot and vinegary. Honestly the "sassy" and the "molassy" sauces were so boring that I can't even remember them well enough to complain.

Pros:
Beer on tap
The take cards, most BBQ places are cash only.
Friendly service
God sides
The best corn bread I've ever had

Cons:
Bad tasting ribs
Over priced for BBQ

I've wasted enough time and money here! I wish someone would open a great BBQ joint in The City.
author: Manny F.

description:
I had some leftover pulled pork, brisket and ribs with a few sides that my roommate picked up.I wasn't expecting much but I polished off all the leftover ribs and brisket. It all seemed fall off the bone tender and very tasty. The ribs were well above average for San Francisco!

The sauces were good too. I will probably go back to give it a proper review but thumbs up.
author: Jordan C.

description:
Pros: ribs, chicken, brisket
Cons: Mac and cheese & mashed potatoes (both have blue cheese in them and tasted sour)  wish it was listed on the menu as such or warned about the excess blue cheese
Overall great neighborhood spot with solid BBQ. Fast service, easy to get a table, lighting is a bit dark towards the back, lots of communal seating. Good beer selection. You definitely need to utilize the condiments and BBQ sauce because the ribs are on the dry side and you need to sauce them yourself so to speak. Their BBQ sauce selection is heavenly. I will be back to try their ribs again. Solid spot but not my fave ribs ever- def like Hillstone's ribs better.
author: Kristy H.

description:
When Baby Blues first came to Bernal, there was a lot of anticipation and hype.  Consequently, my first visit was somewhat of a disappointment, as I thought it was just OK; nothing special.

I went back last night and had a more positive impression.  The on-tap beer selection was very good and I got to choose between a rye and a double-rye with generous sample sizes and they were both good.  The chicken wing appetizers were tender and delicious, in a unique way.  I chose the Baby Blues salad as my side, which was excellent.  (Note that the "small plates" are plenty big enough for dinner.)  

The main event:  Pulled pork was good.  Tried all four sauces and didn't care much for the hot ones... I liked the one in tallest dispenser best.  The pork ribs were again, just OK.  I think I expect those to be what a BBQ place is best at, but it's not for them.

I'd go again, but I'm not rushing back.
author: G M.

description: Ordered delivery and was delivered within a good time frame but unfortunately this was the only good thing I can say. The food was nearly un-edible! I ended up getting extremely dry, tasteless, fatty and overcooked ribs with something that was meant to resemble corn bread. For the price... And it wasn't cheap!... I would have expected a lot more. Disappointed to say the least.
author: Dan S.

description: I do not why they are a catering company.  I should have went with my gut feeling and took the Yelp reviews as cautions not to order from this place. We order 48 hours advance online. THEY have plenty of notice. The food came 30 minutes late and when you call the restaurant their respond is we do not deal with delivery coordination. Really? You're a catering company.. Shouldn't you be in charge of your vendor? The best thing about this situation is that we order $600 dollars worth of food to find out that a bike messenger is delivering it from Bernal Height to Fidi. FOOD gets cold~~! Then to add insult to injury they were missing one of the side dishes. Just don't order here. The only positive star is that the food is good even if it's cold when it arrives.
author: Swwtnsour T.

description: Went for dinner 06/01/16 & wasn't very good. Mac & cheese cold & soupy.  Husband found piece of bone in pulled pork sandwich. Ribs were underdone. Lots of fat in my pulled pork platter. Wait person was great. Not as good as when they first opened! What happened? Won't return or recommend.
author: Suzi P.

description:
This place has gone way downhill...

My friends and I use to go to this place ever so often due to the lack of great BBQ rib places in the city, and it was located near our work.  We always enjoyed the beer and atmosphere but that soon changed. 

We went in on a Friday after work to celebrate a friends BDay. We ordered one of their most popular beers - they didn't have it.  We ordered another popular beer - they didn't have it either.  We then started with appetizers, ordered shrimp, and chicken wings.  Guess what?  They didn't have checking wings either, they were out of them. 

I mean, come on, really... you are out of your most popular items at 6pm on a friday? Isn't this supposed to be prime time?? Anyways, after appetizers we decided to cut our loses short and go somewhere else.  

The bbq ribs (from the previous times I had them) are okay for me, but my friend says they are disgusting, badly made and over cooked. Compare to other places, such as the one in the Haight, I would agree that the ribs here are subpar.

Also, I've noticed a new waiter/waitress working here every other week.  Seems like no one likes to stick around this place for too long. Not a good sign.

Anyways, if you have money to burn and want to try a new place out, good luck to you. 

I definitely would not recommend this place for any special occasion. Nothing sucks more than wanting to have a great dining experience, specially when you are spending money, only to get really shitty results from a restaurant. 

We spent a lot of money on this place on previous occasions.  We are taking our money somewhere else.
author: Christiani C.

description: Walked in to order some takeout and the joint smelled divine! Ordered two salads (awful - total rip at $9 each), 1/2 bbq chicken (good but pricey at $10 for a half a la carte), 1/2 rack of each of the two types of pork ribs (yum), and a 1/2 lb of brisket.  Maybe it's because I had real TX BBQ about a month ago but the meat was good and the sides all disappointing.  That said, I did like the casual atmosphere, attentive service and ballgame blaring on the TV so wouldn't mind coming in here to catch a game, have a drink and just order the good stuff.
author: e w.

description:
Great food + Great servioe = A winning combo

What else can one say?!  :)
author: MiniTess D.

description:
I tried this place twice I like it the ribs are great beef ribs are big , juicy , and filling..

The place is a little pricey, the cornbreads gross, and the ribs were a litty fatty, takes a long time to order nd to get a order..

All in all good eat, great bar, and not a bad place to watch nfl ..
author: Abe M.

description:
Time for some BBQ.


Phenom Brisket and amazing house made BBQ sauce - this is the best BBQ place I've been to in the city!
author: Georgina G.

description:
BBQ--can't think of anything better to take the place of the old Rexall Drugstore. And I love how there are signs up still advertising "DRUGS." 

Baby Blues BBQ made such a fantastic first impression on us that we came back twice in one week. I couldn't get my mind off of them. Here are my notes:

Visit #1: Late lunch: we walk into an enormous space with Bob Marley on the speakers & are greeted by our waitress telling us to take a seat anywhere we'd like (the only other patrons were at the bar, enjoying their liquid lunch, i assume.) We pass up the communal table & the bar & opt for a seat on the bench along the wall. 

The lunch specials, served from 12-4pm, are well priced at under $13 for sandwiches & meats combos, but I noticed their "platters" are priced higher than other BBQ joints in the city. We shared "The Blue Devil:" 4 meats & 3 "fixins" for $31.95. (Roadside BBQ on Geary charges $23 & i think Memphis Minnies does 3 meats/2 sides for $20.) 

Their BBQ shrimp, which I've never had at a BBQ joint, gets 5 stars. They were large, a little spicy from the sauce & grilled to perfection. Honestly, they were the reason we came back. I also really enjoyed their sides; blues on the cob (sprinkled w/ cheese) & mac & cheese were both excellent.

I could take or leave: their brisket (pulled & shredded--never seen brisket done this way before) & their beef ribs, which were meaty but also fatty. (Not all beef ribs are fatty--case in point: the ones from Roadside BBQ.) Their corn bread is moist & full of corn, but there is a spice in it (which I can't identify) that gives it a pungent taste I don't particularly care for. 

Did not try: pulled pork & chicken smoked rice. According to the bf, both were so-so.

Their BBQ sauces are watery, but still quite flavorful. I enjoyed the Ginger Tabasco the most. 
_________________________________

Visit #2: Late dinner, right before they were set to close. We walk in & are seated near the ukuleles. The place looks different when dim; definitely very festive w/ Christmas lights & dancehall playing loudly. I'm seeing details & decorations I missed the first time around & dig the eclectic mishmash of items. 

We order "Big Blue" which is 3 meats w/ 2 fixins for $25.95. They ran out of BBQ chicken (which the bf was excited to try) so in addition to baby back ribs, we doubled up on our shrimp order. The shrimp were as succulent as we remembered (altho I think we were a few shrimp shy of a double portion...) Their baby back ribs were wonderful; it had a nice crust & wasn't too smoky. Again, the sides (mashed potatoes w/ some skin left in it & baked beans) were a hit. I liked their banana pudding, but the bf commented it just tasted like banana flavored whipped cream (which means I don't have to share.)

We've been here once when it was pretty empty & once when it was packed & our servers have always been great; they're quick & get our orders right. Love the location, love the atmosphere & most importantly, love (most of the) food. With flavors & quality this good, it's no wonder Baby Blues BBQ's got a serious hold on our attention.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
This is some of the Best BBQ I've ever had in my mouth! And I've been to TX!!!!

The mac and cheese AND corn on the cob was so good, we got another serving! Who gets more corn at a BBQ place?! THATS HOW GOOD IT WAS!

We asked the chef to come out and told him that it was like Little cherub Angles shit in our mouths it was SO GOOD! hahahaha...he loved it! LOL
author: Amanda V.

description:
Beef back ribs: Pretty good
Corn bread: Dry and dark looking (doesn't seem normal)
Mac & cheese,Pulled pork, Beef brisket, chicken wings: Very average

4 kinds of sauces to choose from - The idea was fun but the execution was very average

Service was good.

Will not be back unfortunately.
author: Irene C.

description:
I really wanted to be amazed by their BBQ, but I found it to be good, but not amazing.  I've eaten here a few times and the service is sometimes very good, sometimes OK.  The menu has a lot of variety to its BBQ options, lots of sauces and side options.  The portions are good, but when I got my bill I simply didn't feel my experience was worth the cost.  

Baby Blues BBQ is a good place to go when you want to eat meat, drink, and watch a game with friends.  The atmosphere is laid back, casual, without a lot of pretense - all good things.
author: Tom W.

description:
Good. Not great.
Drinks- I had the bourbon and sweet tea cocktail which was standard, nothing special.
Food- we ordered pork ribs and pulled pork. Nothing really stood out. It was a solid meal,  average. Nothing to special to write about.
Service- friendly and efficient.
I'll try again and hopefully it's gonna be a lot better.
author: Kent T.

description: If you are looking for some BBQ with some BIG portions in SF then look no further! Baby Blues BBQ is the place you are looking for!  I went with a group of 3 and we shared two of their big meals and had food left over from being so full! They have a plethora of sauces to tempt your palate and the MAC & CHEESE is DECENT if you're looking for home made and not that KRAFT stuff! If you have enough room at the end of your meal, try out the banana pudding, ITS WORTH IT! Thanks Baby Blues BBQ!!!!
author: Darrell B.

description:
I have to say, this place has a really nice feel to it. As a guy from Texas, I'm a little weary of SF's take on Texas BBQ but this place does a great job with it. 

Pros: Extremely friendly staff and patrons. Feels very much like southern hospitality. 
The ribs are great and overall the food is pretty spot on. ( I can only speak of the Texas style ribs, (not sure about the Memphis dry rub). Prices are great

Cons: Not really a con but more of an observation. The cornbread is the only thing that isn't very southern style if you ask me. It's still good, just a little different.
author: Robert B.

description: Great food at a reasonable price!!! Wait staff was very efficient and friendly. We will be back and I would definitely recommend this place to others.
author: lewis J.

description: juicy, tender, good stuff. BBq in sF? Say aint so, can never find a good BBQ, until now. If needing bbq and meat go here, you will feel southern.
author: SForiginal T.

description: I would give this place a 4 1/2.  The baby back ribs were great, the hot links were great (but they didn't make that), the brisket was okay.. most of the pieces they gave us were fatty when we ordered it as a meat. When the brisket was on top of the fries, it was fabulous and thankfully missing all the fat we couldn't eat. The mac and cheese was good, but was ice cold, not sure if it was supposed to be that way and so it pretty watery.  Service was okay. We were at the bar and one of 3 people in the restaurant but most of the staff was just gabbing at the bar and didnt look over to see our plates were empty and napkins on top, we had to ask them about 5-10 minutes into being done to ask for a check.  But before that, their service was great. I would go back and next time, if they came back, i could ask if mac and cheese supposed to be cold.
author: Traci H.

description: I have to say - this place just blows it out of the water. Amazing food and the most incredible staff. Delivery is quick and stylish - I swear everyone who works there is gorgeous. I will miss it soooooooo much - moving to Nashville in 3 weeks after 15 years in the Bay Area - can't afford it here anymore. And after my sad teary eyed garage sale today - I put in an order at Baby Blues to soothe my soul. So grateful for your presence in Bernal Heights - and know that you will keep SF real. Love you people!
author: Nathalie P.

description:
This has been my go to BBQ spot since it opened, but I have a new appreciation for the place. We now have a two year old and eating out is rough. Went there tonight for an early dinner (yep, about 5:15) and was seated next to the "Kids Corner," a little hideaway with toys and games. Amazing. My wife and I even had a few moments to talk to EACH OTHER! Who knew? 

On top if that, the food is great, staff is friendly, prices good. Recommend the pulled brisket.
author: Nick L.

description: I have been wanting to try this place for a long time and I think it was the worst BBQ experience I have ever had. The four sauces they had on the table very gross and very watery. So, I didn't use them. The corn bread, corn on the cob, and the potato salad weren't very good. The sliced Brisket was absolutely brutal. I only had one little piece and left it. The Memphis Ribs were actually good. But I ended up eating them without sauce as all four sauces were not to my liking and not traditional at all. Also, parking was difficult. We had to park on a super high hill and walk down. Service was good, but food was just mediocre. Not a place I would crave to come back. I won't return.
author: Aaron D.

description: Great tasting beef rib, but why the heck is it so expensive?  All the items and sauces were delicious, but I can't get over the prices.
author: Aaron W.

description: Just try the Johnny-Lee burger trust me! Check out my full review here: http://thewestcoastexplorer.me/2014/12/16/a-lot-of-rain-a-lot-of-meat/
author: Tamara S.

description:
Siiiiigh. I *LOVE* the original Baby Blues in Venice, CA. So... it's disappointing to come to the one in SF. I've been here several times on different days at different times, but the moral of the story is always lackluster when compared to the original. 

The service is always a little on the slow side. I've only been taken care of promptly once, when I sat a the bar. Every other time the tiny restaurant is only about half-full and I end up waiting and waiting and waiting for everything.

The sweet tea has a funny flavor. 

The mac and cheese is soggy (when it's supposed to be baked and almost crisp). 

The brisket is chewy and the last time I came in, it was served cold, as though someone had refrigerated it and then re-heated it when I ordered it. That's possibly the most infuriating part of my disappointment. The Baby Blues in Venice has an open kitchen and the bar surrounds the *KITCHEN* so you can sit and watch your brisket being slow-cooked, your chicken and ribs get bbqed, and your shrimp get flamed. It's fun to sit at the counter every once in a while and see your order get put together. 

I wouldn't be surprised if the SF location sincerely cooks everything ahead of time and re-heats it, but the customer probably shouldn't be aware of that. In fact, we should live in the fantasy that a guy up to his elbows in barbecue sauce is starting to grill our chicken as soon as we order it.

Because if he isn't starting it when we place our order, why do I have to wait *SO LONG* for my food? It's confusing. 

Anyway, the creamed spinach is excellent here regardless and the meat is still *good* even if it isn't freshly made or whatever. So if you want BBQ, this place is fine but if you ever find yourself in LA, go to the place in Venice and tell them Olga sent you.
author: Olga A.

description:
My boyfriend took me here for a late dinner date around 9pm. We arrived and it was pretty empty since they were closing in an hour so we were able to pick where we sat.  Our server gave us menus and water right away.  

Order:
Chicken wings (extra hot) -Good and my we took the extras home where my bf brother finished them immediately)
Ace in the Sleeve (Ribs for the bf, salmon for me, shrimp to share)
1/3 Rack Memphis Ribs -His exact words "These ribs are cooked to perfection" they were gone quickly
Smoked Salmon -The salmon was also cooked perfectly but a little bland but nothing some hot sauce couldn't fix
3 Shrimp -We both loved the shrimp the seasoning was delicious!
This comes with 2 sides but we ordered an extra side
Baked Beans -Nicely flavored and really delicious
Sweet Mashed Potatoes -I love sweet potatoes and this was good but not great. this was a good complement item for my salmon
Mac N' Cheese -My bf made sure this vanished right away 

The waitress was very friendly and talkative with all the tables but as people started leaving she became less attentive.  We never even had our water refilled.  She was awesome when we first got there but you could tell she was over it towards the end and ready to go.  Just a warning the kitchen closes @9:30pm so don' rush in after that trying to be seated because you will be turned away.Portion wise this is definitely a place to share. I do recommend trying this place for their BBQ but I will warn you the customer service is up & down. The service wasn't amazing but not bad enough to keep us away!
author: Raquel G.

description:
I think that this is the first bad review I've ever written for a restaurant!

I live (house sitting) 
only a few blocks away and was starving for something flavorful, and meaty who could deliver.  I was so excited that Baby Blues BBQ delivered as it was on my to try list.  However, I ordered the baby back ribs with corn bread and cole slaw online with an estimated delivery time of 30 - 45 minutes....I waited almost an hour and a half (for 4 blocks) and when the delivery person came, it was dry, cold, hard ( and that was the baby back ribs), the corn bread was also cold and stale. The cole slaw was bitter. I was so disappointed. It takes alot for me to dislike food, believe me!. Maybe it was because it was a delivery?? I don't know if it's better dining there...but I am not going to waste my money again to find out.
author: Daisy G.

description:
Great Service! Excellent food.

Eaten here at least five times; always delicious, the staff is knowledgeable and super friendly. The crowd is generally very mellow and agreeable. Great afternoon hang-out spot.
author: Kristen M.

description:
In the UK, they used to (maybe still do, its been awhile) have this rule with serving pints - the head can't be below the bottom of the queen's crown on the british pint glass.  a rule put in place to ensure that when you pay for a pint, you get a pint.  or the rule with wine in the US where you can't call it estate unless 50% of the grapes were grown on your property.

well, there needs to be a rule about calling grilled meat barbecue, because this is what this place doles out.  there must be a lot of people who really can't tell the difference, which is really why barbecue is so poor here - anyone seems to be able to fake it and get away with it.

i ordered the memphis pork ribs to go.  i could see from the bar a guy put some meats onto a flame grill and saw the flame go up and down.  i thought maybe a burger because they have that too.

anyway, i don't look again until i get this package home and unwrap the foil around the ribs.  it tasted completely like charcoal and required decent chewing to get the meat off the bone - no WAY i could pull anything off with my fingers.

what kills me is that if you're going to fake it, there's far easier ways - spice rub and sauce, wrap in foil with broth and apple cider in closed package and cook under low heat in the oven for a couple hours.  then transfer to a grill with heavy smoke for 20 minutes.  it's an easy way to get it done in a pinch and would be 10 times better than this.

who wants to start a campaign to eliminate fake barbecue?
author: kevin w.

description: Omgggggggg!!!! Let me tell u about this place... We were here last wkend & the services sux ass !!!! We got our drinks but not our foods... We sat there almost an hour & half not getting our foods@ all finally our server came over & told us that there were some kinda mix up with the cookers & orders, we were not the only table that they forgot about our foods... But anyways our server was really nice & apologize for the mix up & didn't charge us for our foods but by the time we got our foods we were soo hungry we didn't care it was good or not... So this place needs more help in servicing their customer so this won't happen again...
author: Linh H.

description:
Came here twice.  The first time we were seated after a short wait, and given time to review the menu.  I was starving, and smelling that sweet aroma of bbq was only intensifying my hunger.  Alas, we make our order and wait..and wait...and wait.  Next thing you know our server comes back to inform us that, "THEY'VE RUN OUT OF FOOD"! $#%^$^%$^$#%#$%!

Not being able to try the food, but being allowed to sit and smell it only made me want it more.  So we return to Baby Blues a few weeks later. 
I opt for the pulled pork with mac & cheese and baked beans as my sides.  My dining buddy chooses the 1/2 rack of baby backs with baked beans and rice.  The bbq was ok.  Nothing to make me jump out of my seat and exclaim what a glorious meal it was.  They do have this pepper/oil/vinegar concoction that's recommended to pour onto the pulled pork...that was pretty fabulous.  Also they have different bbq sauces at your table with varied degrees of heat.  That was nice to have.  

Overall, the food was ok.  Service could have been better-I had to flag our waitress down twice for refills and once more for our check.  I will not be coming back to Baby Blues.
author: Maybelline C.

description: Cool spot on Mission Street.  On Saturday night, our waitress was incredible.  She was super friendly, always wearing a big smile, and she spent time going over the menu with us, explaining all of the different sauces to us, and making recommendations.  She check on us frequently and made me feel very welcome.  The BBQ was good, and the sides, especially the collards, were delicious.  I will be back!
author: mark f.

description:
Maybe it was an off night when I went but the ribs were dry, the pulled pork and brisket lacked smoke flavor and seemed like it was boiled. Gross. Won't be coming back.

Wait staff is awesome.
author: David D.

description:
SF is plagued with having subpar BBQ and this place is no exception. Service was sloppy, ribs and pulled pork were dry and flavorless chucks of jerky. 

The sides could have saved the day but the beans were cold tex-mex style and the cornbread was hardtack. The only positive was the decent mac and cheese which my girlfriend and I were left to fight over.

I don't expect the world from BBQ not in the south, but its disappointing that I can get better ribs and pork at a pub.
author: Stren P.

description:
My original three-star review was right when they opened three years ago. I've eaten here several times since then. I gave them the benefit of the doubt on the first trip (even though they ran out of food and only had a couple of things left to order) but I've seen enough. This place is simply not good and getting worse. 

*** Caveat: I am from Texas and I grew up eating BBQ ***

Last night we got shrimp, brisket, mac/cheese, okra, cornbread, spinach, rice. The shrimp was the only thing on the place that was OK. They were overcooked slightly but seasoned well. The rice was edible but completely forgettable. It all goes downhill from there...

The brisket is so far removed from "good brisket" that I can't really do it justice. It's dry and stringy beef. They carve it along the bias, rather than against it, which is a major no-no. You will chew this stuff for days. There's no crust and no juiciness. Major fail.

The mac and cheese seemed like it had gone through a food processor or a blender. It was just cheesy mush without any discernable structure of noodle. (How is it possible to mess up mac and cheese?)

The "creamed spinach" is basically raw/blanched spinach with some white sauce slapped on it. Zero flavor. Fail.

The okra had giant, fibrous stalks in it that were basically inedible. Every third or forth bite, I had to reach into my mouth and pull out a 3" long mess of plant stalk that simply refused to break down in my chewing.

Last (and possible least) is the cornbread. I have had much better out of a box. It's either soaked in butter or oil (probably to make it less dry?) but it's a dense brick of a corn-tasting substance and I felt dirty for eating it.

I will gladly drive across town to Memphis Minnies from here on out. It's a shame because Baby Blues is walking distance from my house. But I simply can't ever eat at this place again. Sorry.
author: Jason Y.

description: Found this BBQ place on a whim. Tasty meats and five sauces served table-side that are made in house. Very affordable menu and super friendly staff. We decided to order a bunch of small itms to taste as many options as possible from the menu. I recommend coming with a big group so you can make a dent on the two page menu. Think cornbread topped with meat and cheese, meatballs filled with blue cheese and bacon, BBQ meats galore, sandwiches and sides, sides and more sides! We had such a hard time selecting sides, that we selected an entree that consisted of four sides and a homemade cornbread. Car choose the Mac n' cheese, creamed spinach, sweet potatoes and corn on the cob. The corn was the only disappointment in the group. We has hoped to get the banana bread pudding for dessert, but we're too stuffed. I guess we will have to go back for round two!
author: Victoria O.

description:
I came here for lunch today with the boyfriend.  He ordered the "easy rider" which was pulled pork and beef brisket with a side of mac and cheese fixin.  I had the razorback, which was pulled pork and baby back ribs with mashed potatoes.  Get the ribs, hands down.  That was definitely the best thing on our plates.  I love that they have different bbq sauces for us to try.  I love the sweeter one, the boyfriend liked the honey based one, it was just fun to taste and try.

We'll have to come back for some more ribs.
author: Quynh-An P.

description:
I'll make this short and sweet...

sauces- they are all vinegary. The molasses in the sweet sauce is overpowered by vinegar. The house sauce is the least vinegary and probably the best. The spicy sauce isn't really spicy. The ginger sauce, well, it just doesn't belong. None of the sauces are great.

cornbread- super moist & tasty, but not really traditional corn bread

sweet tea- they should just call it tea cause it sure ain't sweet

ribs- DRY DRY DRY. I had to rip the meat off the bone.

pulled pork- tasteless

pork and beans- beans with pulled pork on top. Fat is part of what makes pork and beans delish. These were super bland.

mac & cheese- the best part of the meal. If I ever go back I will eat a plate of mac & cheese and a side of cornbread.

banana pudding w/vanilla wafers- their "most popular" dessert. The flavor is spot on, the consistency/texture is WAY off. It looks like a bowl of heavy whipped cream.

Overall, I think the portions were really small and overpriced. At the end of our meal everyone at the table felt underwhelmed. 

Unless you live in the area it's probably not worth the hike.
author: Kandace K.

description:
another 5 freakin stars got to say you cant go wrong here invited the cousins out for the beginning of my bday weekend got to say all left happy and full almost all comatose full.. indeed indeed this spot is legit on their BBQ the Texas beef rib is my favorite pic so much so I order 2 slices and buttered shrimp for good measure. 

Let us just say even after cutting some slices off to share with 9 folks i still had more then enough to get my fill

anytime you looking for good BBQ head down to Misson and Precita look for the DRUG sign below is the heavenly smell of some super tender super delicious BBQ.

food ***** texas beef rib to die for
service **** you have to ask for refills but they are busy all day 
price $$
ambiance **** the smell is intoxicating but after you finish eating it gets to be a lil nauseating just try to contain yourself when eating here, most try but fail horribly hahhaa
author: Clarence A.

description:
Been here twice now...its not terrible.   It might be the best BBQ in the city...but since I've recently lived in Texas that really isn't saying much.

Get the mac & cheese with whatever you order...it is excellent.  I'm not a fan of the sauce that comes on everything but they've got several bottles on the table of various flavors so that you can fix what they bring out.  Definitely order a platter and split it with someone.  The meals are sized and priced for two.

Soda comes in cans, that is a major flaw for a restaurant IMO and totally tacky.  Waiters can be impossible to get ahold of...both times I've bene here I had to flag someone down to get the check.  Would probably order delivery instead of going there next time.  They've got some really uncomfortable bar stool tables that you can get stuck at..depending on how crowded the place is that night.

Parking in this area blows...so the place really isn't worth battling that.  I'm not sure why people rave about this place so much.
author: Lauren D.

description:
After many years we decided to try this BBQ joint. Very disappointed. The service was great, but the food one star. What took many stars off is also that while walking to the restroom I glanced on the left to look at the open kitchen and I was horrified to see  this cook flipping the meat over the grill with his bare hands......no comment.
Never again, especially given that the food was not even that good. It's also very very noisy.
author: lucia f.

description:
When the word BBQ is in the name, shouldn't the food come with BBQ SAUCE?? Don't people eat any form of BBQ mostly just for the sauce? Thought I would give this place a try off of Grub Hub for some comfort food on a cold night. Everything went great, ordering on my phone, until I actually had to interact with any human beings...

The bike messenger was not very friendly; when I checked the order and questioned the lack of BBQ sauce he was less than accommodating- to put it nicely. Finally, he told me I could call the restaurant if I wanted (since he clearly wasn't going to lift a finger). After calling the restaurant 8 times- that's right, count it 8 times, someone finally picked up before the answering machine. Although he was nice, he too did not resolve the problem. He said it's the manager's protocol to NOT INCLUDE BBQ sauce unless requested, due to the cost?!?!?! If you are a BBQ restaurant, isn't your BBQ sauce supposed to be your secret sauce that gets people hooked on your food? Apparently not- they would rather save a few dimes than get people hooked. All I wanted was some BBQ sauce but I guess that's a lot to ask for from a BBQ restaurant.

The mac-n-cheese is good, as in the sweet potato mash. The creamed spinach is okay. Corn bread is good but not amazing and would be a whole lot better with some BBQ sauce.... duh! $20 later I have a dinner for one sans BBQ sauce ughhhh....

I'm nice when people are nice to me; probably would have given them 4 or 5 stars if they had been willing to give me some BBQ sauce. They also didn't include a receipt with the food. Just the food in a plastic bag- me thinks perhaps they were trying to save a few more dimes on napkins and receipt paper?
author: Amanda M.

description:
This place rocks. The brisket is incredible, the vibe is cool and sides are great! Definitely better than the hipsterfied BBQ found elsewhere in SF. If you want solid BBQ in a great atmosphere, this place is great! 

One note: parking is a challenge.
author: Smellis S.

description:
definitely winning me over.

tried the pulled pork the last two times as a sandwich (definitely the way to go), and loved the creamed spinach and the cornbread.

parking still tough but they are quick with take out so just call ahead and try not to trash your upholstery

unless you are from Texas or St. Louis and spoiled, you will be very happy with this BBQ joint.
author: Mike V.

description: Great food, friendly staff and cold beer.  The ribs are solid.  My favorite are the baby back.  Pulled pork is solid, Mac and cheese too .  I also like the chicken strips.  Check it out .
author: Zach H.

description:
Came here with a group and ordered The Teaser, along with some extra sides.  

The good:
baby back ribs
Memphis ribs
mashed potatoes (albeit none of the fixins were memorable)
mac n cheese
collard greens 
cornbread (cake like consistency, but I still liked it)

The not-as-good:
chicken
pulled pork
brisket

I would return for the ribs, but it's a higher price point than I'm used to paying for BBQ.  Then again, it's close to the Mission - what do you expect?
author: B. Y.

description: This is as authentic a BBQ place as you'll find this far West.  It's raw and smokey, rough round the edges but oh so real: and the service while not fast is wonderfully friendly and welcoming. We had a nice sampler starter, the meatballs were stand-out. And richly smoker baby backs all round. With five varieties of sauce on the table - you can easily find the perfect complement to suit your tastebuds. And the banana pudding desert was utterly amazeballs (that's a good thing!!).
author: Robin R.

description: All I can say is I love me some barbecue but this place I will never eat at again the baby back ribs worst super dry and crusty the beef brisket with shredded look more like pulled pork and I mean a lot of barbecue in my life as my favorite saying is any rib is my friend these ribs were my friend today!!!!!!
author: Chris H.

description:
Hands up if you've ever seen the film 'Withnail and I'. There's a great line when Withnail craves meat by declaring, "I want something's flesh!". Well, this restaurant would have been perfect for him!
The most amazing bbq, fantastic sides, and great...no...awesome service! The best place to bring out of towners.
Can't wait to go back!
author: Mr E.

description:
My wifie who lives in the mission decided we order here, which I had no problem. =)
I ordered the chicken strips which were overly cooked but the season was great. My friend order the rack of ribs which were to me dry and  over cooked. The Mo platter needed salt plus the mashed potatoes and mac n cheese had blue cheese mixed in it. Different taste but an acquiring one. Least to say it was ok. the place was packed and cozy though. I would give it a 2nd chance but to dine in, instead of take out.
author: Marco R.

description: Pork shoulder was awesome! Side of mash, Cesar salad, and the cornbread were good. I ordered a side of Louisiana Sausage and it also hit the spot. The mash had a hint of blue cheese. Definitely gonna try the ribs and brisket next time. Baby Blues definitely got a new customer!
author: Benjamin G.

description:
I love their BBQ. I think the best deals are available for lunch. I usually get "The Hound Dog" platter which includes their memphis ribs & brisket. I find their memphis ribs to be a lot more tender and juicy than their baby back ribs. 

My friends went here for a birthday dinner party of 23 people and we ordered "The Extravaganza". It satisfied everyone and we're a bunch of heavy eaters! My friend sneaked in a bottle of Makers Mark and our waitress kindly allowed us to drink it in the restaurant. We offered her a shot of the whisky for her hospitality. 

Excellent food and great customer service!
author: Jai A.

description:
I've only ever gotten food to go, so I can't say anything about the dining experience.
As a Texas transplant, I hope I'm a fair judge of good bbq, and Baby Blues was pretty solid. I kind of wish the beer selection was a little better (I ordered to go and had a beer while I waited.) The meat was nice and the sandwich was appropriately large, saucy, and tender.
author: Nik K.

description: I been eating here for years but today they really got under my skin. Today I ordered from Eat24 they came and forgot part of my order I contacted eat24 and they asked if I wanted a refund or to make them I said make them because it was my son's dinner he wanted. I'm at home alone with my 9yr old and 3 day old baby that's why i ordered dilevery. At the end they said they will make them but will not deliver them wtf
author: Cilla G.

description: The BBQ here is wonderful!! We have been here a few times now and have tried the brisket, both pulled and sliced, the pulled pork, Memphis ribs, chicken, hot links and the Connor fries are to die for. Everything has been well seasoned, moist and just delicious. Sides wise, the sweet mash, and potato salad are very good. The baked beans were good but not to my taste. The service is friendly and fast. You are treated as family as you have a home cooked meal. Prices are moderate but definitely worth it.
author: michelle b.

description:
Remember that nice hot weather a few months back? Well none of us felt like cooking and after we rattled off several restaurants in walking distance this was the only one that had consensus.  We have eaten here probably 5 times or so--so we knew what to expect that night: decent BBQ, decent sides, interesting beer choices, and great service from the cool server with the leopard spots. 

First clue that things were off--she wasn't there. A blond from behind the bar showed us to a table. Service was slow, taking forever to actually come around to take our order--but it was only after we ordered and had drained our drinks that we started getting suspicious that things were way off. No offer for refills, in fact we didn't see the server again as she just never came by, and the food was still not in sight. I kid you not--1 hour after walking in was when we finally got served. Temperatures of the food were inconsistent--yes there were 5 of us in the group but you don't leave some of the plates waiting and cooling while you apparently go slaughter the cow for the next meal. 

This review is mostly for this night of horrendous service. Soggy corn bread. Flavorless sweet potatoes (I'm guessing they ran out of molasses or whatever they usually put in), barely warm meat and mashed potatoes, wrong sides for one of the party (but he didn't complain because he knew it would be forever for the correct side to come). 

What went from us thinking this was a one off to something personal was watching the blond server greet some customers she obviously knew. Beers on the table within five minutes of sitting down. No delays in their food. The blond obviously took a dislike to us and ignored us. The cook---I don't know if all the regulars took off that day, but he was obviously out of his league. 

I agonized about writing this review. I wanted to contact management but there was nothing on their website. I want this restaurant to succeed as we all LOVE BBQ.  On the other nights, when service was great (pretty server with the leopard spots) the BBQ was decent (at best) the sides better (not great) and beer plentiful it was the whole package that I would have generously given a 4 star review.  This review would be a one star but I have to balance it out for our previous meals there. I really hope this was a one off night, for the sake of the restaurant.  But we won't be going back to find out.
author: Amy O.

description:
We had Baby Blues BBQ delivered to us via Zerocater. Upon the delivery guy's arrival by bicycle, I asked if he needed help. He said "No, do you?" 

What a tool.

Food was aaight, but not enough to overshadow shitty service.
author: Kat A.

description:
Blues on the cob rocks my world. 
You will love it. 
I had the pulled pork as well not as to die for as the blues on the cob but this is some decent bbq. 
worth the trip for the blues on the cob. 
five stars for the corn
author: Jill F.

description: Baby back ribs and mac n cheese were killer. The pulled pork and banana pudding were pretty good too. Went on a Saturday night- you will want reservations if you're planning on a weekend visit. This place was slammed. The staff rolled with it and served as fast as they could. Will be back on a week night...got to get more of those ribs and mac.
author: Steph P.

description: The owner is a real card. After we were shorted a couple sides and cornbread on a GrubHub delivery, he told us over the phone "not to trust those computer things" and to call next time we had an order. Um, why do you have an online ordering option? And "computer things?" Do you realize you run a restaurant in the world's technology capitol? Then he told us "we ran out of cornbread and I just throw that in gratis anyway" so you won't be getting any. So much for what it says on the menu. Then he didn't have the sides delivered at all. A real class act. The food isn't good enough to compensate for the owner's attitude. Needless to say we won't be eating here again even though its a few blocks away.
author: Nick G.

description:
As far as BBQ goes, it's decent but not the best around.

The brisket's pretty dank ("Dank"? I just morphed into a stoner, apparently), but it's pretty hard to screw that up.

Also, high-top tables are the enemy of short people, and I always end up sitting at one. Dangling legs? What am I, a toddler? 

They do get props, however, for a few things: 1) They deliver. All. Day. I can't count how many times I ordered lunch delivery and was very content. 2) KOOL-AID! Need I say more? That stuff's delicious.
author: Christina S.

description:
The best part of my meal was the cornbread - that says a lot! 

I ordered the Razorback Platter for takeaway, and I enjoyed it but definitely not the best bbq to be had in the city. The cornbread was nommy with its moist, almost carrot-cakey consistency. The baby back ribs were good and had a nice smoky crust on them. The pulled pork looked like a pile of grayish mush - not appetizing. The bbq sauce was just ok. 

The restaurant itself had a great vibe and the service was friendly!
author: Vicente G.

description:
EPIC FAIL. Owner would not honor the Google coupon which clearly states "$7 for $15 of food and drinks." He said that it was $7 off a $30 purchase. Now, you don't have to math genius to figure out ... the owner is a douche. And he just lost a new customer who lives nearby and might have become a regular.

Guess I'll just have to answer the call of the wild burrito coming from El Gran Taco Loco down the block.
author: Emily D.

description:
Ribs-decent
Brisket-decent
Beef rib-huge but not that much meat
Sides-always out of greens and the Mac n cheese is bland
Service-good
Price- expensy
author: Danny L.

description:
We arrived in from Seattle and had literally just got off the plane - our good friend Kona brought us there with the promise of tasty ribs and we were not dissappointed.
We all went with some form of ribs with the promise of family style dining. Worked out really well until became protective of my plate and didn't want to share anymore. I was enjoying mine too much. The ribs were all good great - nothing was overpowered with sauce, ribs we got were good cuts well cooked and fell off the bone. Sauces were a nice range of sweet to hot. Okra as a side was awesome. Mac and cheese I thought could have been better. 
Its a busy spot with lots of noise and chatter. Service was decent. 
I will be back next time I get to the bay.
author: Niall K.

description:
FML for going over and over to BBB when I know it sucks....

The only time I thought it was OK was the night I ended up blacking out after a party across the street at El Rio. I was hella hungry and drunk and of course everything I tried tasted like heaven. 

I went back sober a couple of times and kaboom.... No good! It is just not a real deal BBQ and the sauces are really mediocre. The meat is just dry and flavor-less, same with the sides, nasty mac n cheese and corn bread. Service is OK, but I DEF NOT recommend this place at all.
author: Anaheli D.

description: This is probably one of the best BBQ places in San Francisco. The meat falls off the bone and is delicious. The sides are simple but great tasting. Their stuff is friendly and nice to talk to. The interior design is very rustic and creates a good atmosphere. We will definitely go again!
author: Ina W.

description: Best BBQ I've had in SF to date. Two years and 2,000 miles from home, happy to have found a place to get amazing ribs without the sf kale, golden beets and quinoa touch. Great sides that are flavorful but not too heavy, and their baby back ribs fall off the bone without overbearing sauce.
author: Ingrid K.

description:
I've been to Baby Blues in Venice and W. Hollywood. The former's ok, while the latter was so good. So I was expecting great things of the San Francisco location. I'd purchased a Google Offer for $15 off. 

Shock #1 came when the waitress informed me that to use the coupon, I'd have to spend $30. I asked where it said this in the offer and was told that that was in fact the deal. Being hungry and already there, what was I to do? 

Shock #2 was the sangria: My glass had four apple bits floating in it. 

Shock #3 was the most miserable portion of catfish. Perhaps it was kittenfish? It was smothered in some kind of sauce, as if to mask the lack of taste, too. 

Overall, the service was good (I understand the waitress was doing as instructed by management) as also the fixings and banana pudding. In all, though, an unpleasant experience.
author: noit e.

description:
Have those who have been here ever had BBQ before??! Totally don't get how people are a fan of the food here. I've been spoiled by Memphis Minnie's and Gorilla BBQ and this place will be one that I'm definitely not coming back to. 

The pulled pork was cold upon arrival and didn't have any flavor. The cornbread was a really buttery, dense piece of blah. The creamed spinach was exactly "creamed spinach" as in spinach leaves mixed with cream. (I LOL-ed because I've never seen such a thing..almost like they were playing a joke on us). The mac and cheese was soupy. The baby back ribs were tender with just a HINT of flavor. 

Easy to imagine what their desserts taste like if their main food was so terrible. 

Um no.
author: Joy A.

description:
Went here a couple of weeks ago. Had a craving for some reallll good BBQ. Read the Yelp reviews and they seemed to be a littled mixed so I thought I'd form my own opinion. 

We got these things;

Ribs
Brisket
Mac n Cheese
Baked Beans
Cream Spinach
Cornbread

Out of that whole list, the only thing really edible were the ribs. The ribs were just about cooked to perfection. The brisket although cooked well, lacked flavor. The mac n cheese I wouldn't have served -- if I had a restaurant. Our baked beans were burnt or had a over powering smoke flavor but no one could eat them. It was the same with the cream spinach, which was more like spinach leaves in a soupy white sauce and FINALLY the cornbread. I've never been a fan of corn in the cornbread but some of my aunts/uncles use it in their recipes because it usually helps to moisten the cornbread. This was not the case with Baby Blues, their cornbread was very gritty, dry and flat out hard at the edges. 


I really wanted to like this place but at the end of the meal, all I had was the "I just spent 55 bucks but only could eat one thing" blues.
author: Troy R.

description:
I went for the first time today and was thoroughly impressed. 
Great, tender meats, fantastic sauces and some of the best service I've had. 

Can't wait to go back!
author: Deniz U.

description: The lady who took my order on the phone, is such a bitch, because she was having trouble hearing me, it's raining and I'm in my  car, and took her off my speaker phone and it was better, but she was in a rush to get off the phone, ugh, so don't wanna get the food now, but it's not for me mainly! It better be GOOD! Mac n cheese, and mashed potatoes
author: JV Y.

description: spent $40+ on delivery, weakest food i've ate in a while. very disappointed. i hate throwing food away but the chicken was under cooked and pink, the smoked salmon salad was a pile of dilapidated greens with a single slab of mediocre smoked salmon. $14. fries were mush and pulled pork was not as good as the carnitas i got from costco a week ago.  2 stars is generous.
author: Jess N.

description: Two words: BANANA PUDDING!!!! Get it, it's amazing. Really nice atmosphere, really nice service/staff, really great food. Highly recommend
author: Michon N.

description:
Let me start, I love meat!  I found the food very good my favorite was the grilled shrimp, the memphis ribs, and the mac and cheese.  They had a happy hour special on the weekends mid day of $1 PBR and $2 off tap beer, the service was prompt and friendly and the food came out pretty fast.  

I will admit I love mixing my own sauses provided at the table, that was fun.

the only down side to the whole experiance was the brisket, I was expecting something else. It was shredded and over cooked, I had expected it to be sliced, smoke ring.... Oh well everything else was really good so the one disappointment did not over shadow the event!
author: Loretta M.

description:
Yikes.
I've just ordered a pulled pork sandwich with mac 'n' cheese for delivery, and all I can say is gross...  The Mac seemed super old and possibly nuked(?).  Anyways, the noodles were overcooked, and it was slightly warmed.  The Pulled Pork was dry, slightly warmed as well.  BBQ sauce was good though.  Can't say I'll be going back to this place.    What a shame, I was excited!
author: Josh B.

description:
The ribs are definitely delicious.  They have multiple flavors of BBQ sauce that you can choose from.  I think I like the regular hot one best.  My parents like the sweet one.

This being said, the sides are absolutely ABYSMAL.  I was most unimpressed my the macaroni and cheese- how do you mess that up?  I will give them the benefit of the doubt here and assume that the sides are better when you eat in (I have only gotten meals to go).  The one salvageable side is the corn on the cob (Except that they pack it with butter and a LIME- I'm pretty sure dairy and citrus are not meant to go together.  The flavor combination when I got to that spot was not altogether terrible, but certainly absurd).

I'll be back, but ordering a la carte.
author: Nora S.

description:
below average.

brisket: arrived cold.
pulled pork: arrived cold. once smothered in BBQ sauce it was ok, but definitely forgettable.
BBQ sauces: 5 sauces at each table--but unfortunately none of them really stood out to us. the bottles could use a good wipe-down.
customer service: excellent. very friendly considering they were understaffed and busy for a saturday.
corn bread: dreadful. like a yellow spongy-hockey puck
mashed potatoes: good.
mac-n-cheese: arrived cold. and, again nothing to write home about.

don't plan on returning, but if for some reason I had to, I'd opt for chicken or ribs and insist they arrive while they are still hot.
author: L S.

description: The portions and value are pretty lacking here, but I still love this place even more than Memphis Minnie's. The ambiance is really great, and their sauces are very original.
author: Brandon M.

description:
Not enough people come to the Outer Mish/Bernal Heights neighborhood, but the area is hopping.  Who goes to the Marina anymore?  It's SOMA and beyond now.

Baby Blues was originally a 4 star review but after tasting the real BBQ experience in San Diego, I had to take this review down a star.  Let's face it, we are BBQ deficient in SF; notwithstanding, Baby Blues is a fun restaurant for groups -- big and loud.  And while this might be just an average place for you Kansas City and Memphis peeps, this is a good as it gets these days in SF.
author: Laurence H.

description:
OMG ... Wow Oh Wow ...This place beat out all the BBQ place I've ever been to...
Do Not Judge a Book by its Cover !!! This place is located on Mission St.  First  impression --- scary spot , but once you go in you're greeted so nicely by the staff. The place was kid-friendly and it has a homey relaxed feel to it.  And oh the food...AWESOME BBQ Ribs and Chicken!!! The side dishes --- Mac 'n cheese and the corn on the cob sprinkled with cheese were terrific. The hubby and the kids loved the food.

Enjoyed this place a lot!!! Definitely will come back with the fam...
author: Eva D.

description: Not feeling it. Was in the city and hoped this would be the best BBQ place. Wrong! Ordered the ribs and brisket. Ribs were undercooked and tough. Brisket was tough and sliced with the grain which anyone that knows brisket would tell you that's wrong. I mentioned it to the manager and he brought me some reheated "pulled brisket" saying they were now out of sliced brisket. Who in their right mind serves pulled brisket? It should be sliced or chopped. I peeked back in the kitchen and the cooks looked clueless. If your going to pay rock bottom for labor, you get rock bottom food quality. Ended up getting a meal comp and left very disappointed. I recommend Memphis Minnie's for brisket. Blows this place away.
author: Rob F.

description: I went there waited 6 min to be knowledge... Then I order one of their meat burgers, I waited 30 min and finally my burger arrived, but then the burger looked undercooked I called the waiter over and ask him to cook it a little longer after 15min more to a total of 45 min of wait time my burger wasn't done, I approach the waiter and ask him for the bill and that I could not wait any longer (I only get one hour lunch) he said that the burger was on the house and not to worry about it and that it was almost done, unfortunately I needed to get back to work...
author: Alonso G.

description:
I've been here a few times in the past and the food has always been exceptional.  I no longer have to make a trek back to Everett and Jones.  I never got around to reviewing the good times.  Lately the food has been a hit and miss. What happened to the quality?

Party 4
2 Blue moon and sodas
Side dishes: weren't memorable

Full rack ribs $23:  Always a winner.  Moist, tender, and the various bbq sauces kicked it up a notch.

Whole Chicken $16:  Moist but flavorless.  Disappointing.

1 lb  beef brisket $13:  I don't know why its pulled rather than sliced off the brisket.  My friend said it was a way to recover overcooked meat by shredding and then dousing it with sauce.  I couldn't taste the beef because it was overpowered by the sauce and smoke.

Back to Everett and Jones I go.

Prices are on the high side and I would gladly pay it so long as I dont have to go to the East Bay for decent BBQ.  *sigh*
author: Sun T.

description: Best place on the Appeteaser crawl hands down.  I knew I was going to like this place is the food was good and it was greattttt.  The meat was good and tender (didn't have to fight to get it off the bone) and flavorful and I really dug the mac&cheese.  This is my new SF BBQ spot from now on.  The drink specials were cool and the staff was great.  We all plan to visit this rib shack again and again and again.
author: MyShawn C.

description: Excellent and friendly service. Excellent Ribs..brisket is lean..overall solid.  What makes this BBQ special a slightly different taste versus the others. Only small quip is food presentation. Food taste way better than it looks.
author: Robert M.

description: Fabulous BBQ! Many fun sauces, numerous side options.
author: Vicki L.

description:
OK, so I HAVE to review this place because of the recent bad reviews they've received. You have to take the bitchy people who are not coherent and that can't spell with a grain of salt in reading these reviews. They are unfair and clearly not getting laid.

I moved here recently from Portland, Oregon - which media has been in love with the past few years as THE new culinary city to pay attention to. I feel this is a fair assessment and I feel like I've been spoiled there - so hopefully that counts for something. I understand that one off experiences could have been bad - there is always that chance. However, tonight my boyfriend (who has been here a couple of times and has been suggesting it repeatedly) finally got me to check it out. I am originally from Walla Walla in Washington State, where BBQ is king and my dad is the master of hunting, curing and preparing meats. (I have really awesome deer meat jerky in my fridge right now that he made - yes, really.) What I loved about it:

1. I was able to order a nice mix of veggie-oriented foods (great salad with awesome onion vinaigrette, corn on the cob with some yummy cheesy seasoning, and mac-n-cheese) so I didn't feel like typical BBQ places where you eat a ton of meat and then moan because it takes forever to digest it all.

2. The meat: I had BBQ shrimp and it was awesome - not overcooked, but great with the variety of sauces. My boyfriend had catfish and it was also very tasty.

3. If you like decent wine and totally have gotten used to the crap selection in most places that are not super high end in this city - you will be very pleasantly surprised. My boyfriend is European and I'm a wine snob and they have Sencerre on the menu....at a BBQ place! We found out the owner's partner is French and picked the wines - nice work!

4. For dessert we ate apple pie that had just come out of the oven and it was amazing. Enough said.

5. The service was great. I'm straight, but the young women were super cute and sweet and total eye candy. The owner talked us up when we asked him if it was his place and was really nice too. 

We will definitely be back and will also be ordering from them for 4th of July - as they are doing specials where they marinade and prep the ribs and chicken and make you look really good on your home grill.
author: Rachel K.

description:
I wanted to like this place and like it to succeed, but the BBQ here is pretty awful.  Technically, I don't think this is actually BBQ because everything is braised in a pot or cooked in the oven or flat top stove.  Nothing here is smoked or actually BBQ'ed by Texas, Memphis, Kansas City, or Carolina Standards.

* The cornbread is really bad - dry, mealy, and lacking any flavor
