* The beef brisket was pulled, suggesting it was braised in a pot. Real beef Brisket is slowly smoked and sliced.  It was not only pulled, but incredibly dry.

* The sides, like the beans and Mac/Cheese, are mediocre and flavorless.  However, they are much better than the meat or the cornbread.

* The sauces were good and you need them to mask the terrible BBQ meats.

Overall this is a nice place to eat with a good atmosphere, but this would never pass for real BBQ in any legitimate area.  They have done a nice job replicating the BBQ experience and atmosphere, but not in the quality of the food.

I assume the city of SF or the price of real estate does not allow them to have a real smoker and it really shows in the poor quality of the food.
author: Zk K.

description:
Baby Blue's beef ribs is what Chris Rock was talking about in the FIRST EVER movie he appeared in. "I'm Gonna Git You Sucka!".  Check it out. 
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KNQRqAoT-2c

All you need is one rib because they are literally gigantor. They remind me of the Flintstones cartoon at the ending credits when Fred is driving away in his car carrying that one gigantic piece of meat. That rib is about the size of a forearm, from a gorilla. 

It's not just size that counts, so I've heard, but these ribs are juicy and tasty as well. They have a really good smoked flavor and I like how they have a char to them. That char gives it a real authentic taste that I like. It's kinda like how I grill/bbq some of my food on the Weber grill and forget about the food because I was doing something else that the food ends up getting a little burnt but then it's all good because you can tell it's homemade. 

The cool little bar where they also have a plasma for sports is perfect for selecting BB's as a guy's night out dinner. 

Their ribs shine, while the baby back rib's are tastier than the beef brisket. The brisket was a little grainy and kinda resembled a wet mop on a plate. 

Oh my, the sides. We had a group of 4 hungry guys so I had a chance to taste a whole bunch. 

1. Mac and cheese - baked, cheesiness, nice crust. my favorite one
2. mashed sweet potatoes - delicious, smooth, sweet, warm, hug. 
3. pork and beans - beans with tons of pulled pork, could also be a meal by itself for lunch 
4. corn on the cob - this like the rib is gigantic, grilled. 
5. potato salad - it had a tart zing to it, interesting
6. cream of spinach - not pureed and creamy like HOPR style, whole spinach boiled down with milk sauce. aiight

My new favorite BBQ joint. Not a place that you'll eat once a week, but def a place if you're looking for good Q.

If you want to feel like a man, eat here.
author: Earl G.

description: Mac and cheese is really good for a side , beef brisket for appetizer
author: Kharey R.

description:
We went for my boyfriend's birthday on a Friday evening, party of 10. I had made the reservation for 7 people the day before through their online reservation system (Open Table?), and increased the number of guests that evening and then early the day of, online. I also left a voice message for the restaurant before they opened that day to confirm that my reservation had changed, even though things seemed fine online. They did not call back. When we arrived, they only had the original guest number of 7 :( We had to wait 30-45 for a table. That should not have happened if the staff had checked their online reservations and listened to their phone messages when they opened that day!

I expect meat to be falling off the bone if it's BBQ'd, and I like sauce. This place did not meet either of those expectations. By the waitress's recommendation, we ordered "The Beggar's Banquet" set menu for 10-14 people for $216. I liked the brisket and pulled pork. Ribs and chicken only had dry rub but there's sauce on the table. Cornbread was a lil dry. Mac n Cheese was real good with some funky tasty cheese in it! Pricey meal for being just alright.
author: Kimberly D.

description: I don't know why I even trusted Yelp! This place is horrible. The only thing not messed up was the bread and that was even burnt. Man Horrible! Absolutely horrible. If I was homeless I wouldn't even eat out of there dumpster. We got our order to go when I got back to the office I opened the food and thought wait I didnt't order a brownie.... And I took a bite and I didn't know what it was than I seen a chunk of corn in the bread and realized.... I'm eating a crunchy piece of black and brown cornbread. The sad part is I have to give them a 1 star because if I could give them a zero I would. The waitress was cool she was nice but man DO NOT COME HERE!!!! Worst 16 dollars I've ever spent in my life!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Chris P.

description: Just moved into the area and wanted to give this place a try. Wow! The bartenders are super nice and inviting, and I even was welcomed by the owner. Paul (I believe) engaged in conversation, telling me about the restaurant and their history. Once he knew I was new to the area, he introduced me to his staff. After receiving some suggestions on what to order, I got the beef brisket. Soooo good! That and a pint (nice beer selection) and I was a happy camper. I will certainly be back.
author: Tyler L.

description:
I LOVE the vibe in here. And the beer list. And the crowd and the kids' corner and everything. It really bums me out that the food is just meh.

I'm from the South and I love barbecue, but I'm not a snob either. So I'm reacting from a place of knowledge without being a prick about it I hope. I appreciate that they don't sauce things too much - but then again, a dry thin smear of pulled pork on a bun does not a satisfying pulled pork sandwich make. I've also had the chicken sandwich (yawn), and the wings (good, but room temperature - weird). 

Tonight I got the burger and it was awesome, actually, but not usually what you are thinking of having at a BBQ place.

I'll go back, and try the brisket and the ribs, I'm sure, because, well, it's right there on the corner, but I'm just not impressed really. But I like it still. Okay.
author: sarah l.

description:
How have I not known about this place for soooo long being that my aunt used to live above it when it used to be the Drug store!?! Well we got something better than drugs my friends--BBQ. When i say drugs i mean Flinstones Vitamins..Anywho..Take advantage of all the sauces on your table! Mix! Match! Salivate! 

I ordered the pulled pork with a side of Mac and Cheese and Mashed Potatoes. I die. AND IT WAS SERVED ON A GIANTS PLATE?! Did they look at my Facebook before I came in or something?  And my fellow diner who ordered the Beef Brisket had her food plated on an A's plate!? She's from Berkeley!? BIG BROTHER STATUS?! Lol...the food was great, you really can't go wrong...and the service was top of the line. Great place to bring an out of town friend to show them how SF does good BBQ
author: Adlyn S.

description: You know I want to love this place and I'll go back again because I like the ambiance there's plenty of seating and a good bar but the food is just okay.  It's average. which I didn't really expect.  The first time I had the pork pulled sandwich and if you like a lot of pork then this is a 4+ star sandwich but I thought it lacked flavor.  The next time I ordered the beef ribs, first mistake, it's the beef RIB (singular).  One Flintstone sized somewhat meaty rib for $23.00 plus 2 sides.  Really, $23 for one rib!  I love beef ribs and this one while tasty was entirely unmanageable.  I won't order it again.  I've also had the mac n' cheese, Cesar salad, and corn bread sides - all okay.  The portions are large, surprising in any SF restaurant so that's nice.  All in all, a good place when I want a beer and a bite in the Mission but not on my list for favs.
author: Virginia T.

description:
Three  words : Happy Food Coma !

Its hard to find GOOD bbq nowadays!

Got this delivered with a friend.
1. beef brisket and pulled pork sammies were delicious!
2. mac and cheese ADDICTING!
3. blue cheese corn on the cob ..ARE you effing serious!?! YUM
4. baked beans were sooo flavorful.

Overall I was impressed, I haven't tasted bbq that good in years. Things are usually different when you eat at a place, to when you do take out, a lot of places aren't consistant, but for what I was expecting as far as DELIVERY.... A+ 

I plan to go back this week ;)
author: Dani J.

description:
There are only a handful of things I'm unabashedly proud of as an American.  As a point of reference I'll tell you something I'm abashedly proud of as an American; wanting to be #1.  Eat, drink, score, blow up, kick ass... the most.  I love it but in this wincing sort of way where I can only embrace it with one foot on the floor.

With BBQ, I've got every part of me in bed.  BBQ, Jazz and I'm coming up short on anything else I can get in bed with that's 100% American.  

With that being said, all things intrinsically American are intrinsically individual.  BBQ embodies this.  So, folks could argue, it's difficult to pass judgement on BBQ.  And they would be wrong.  There are good books and bad books, movies, corn dogs, blow jobs, and BBQ.  Yes, there's room for personal preference, taste etc. but there are certain key basics that cannot be dodged and then, all other things being equal, the accoutrement makes up the difference.

Baby Blues you are trying like a motherfucker to get the job done and you are failing.  You're talking the talk with only a half-ass stumble of a walk to go with it.

brisket - subpar, not tender, no bark to speak of, wondering if it was even smoked at all
pulled pork - perhaps the easiest bbq to do decently was just that.  Stringy, not richly flavored
Ribs - sauce covered.  people like this so I can't really ding them for it but, really?  Serving me BBQ'ed (that means smoked) meats slathered in sauce has the same effect on me as walking up to someone at a club and being overpowered by a cloud of perfume/cologne.
Sides - uber forgettable
cornbread - borderline inedible
service - sucked badly enough the manager had to take over our table and comp our dessert

I wanted this place to be good, it was right in my hood, it had a nice setup/deco but it just fell down in every way that really counted.  There's some effort there but without a solid foundation of food to start from you don't stand a chance.
author: Milk N.

description:
Pulled pork sandwich & a blue moon.

Word.
author: Athena S.

description: Lively restaurants. Staff was friendly. Self seated. Have live band playing. Excellent BBQ Ribs its tender, finger licking good. Quality meat and tasty. Mac cheese was creamy and tasty. Price was worth the food amount you get. If you love Bbq  I would recommend you to come here. I would come back here and eat here again.
author: Gruber T.

description: Took my dad visiting me here from Los Angeles not too long ago and was not impressed. I ordered a pulled pork sandwich and kid you not I make better tasting pulled pork sandwich. The customer service was BLAH. and the overall atmosphere was boring. Prices are expensive for the quality food and experience they provide for you. Went there once and I can say I won't be going back.
author: Joshua P.

description:
Admittedly my partner and I are a tough sell for BBQ - one Kansan, and one southerner. My Mom mixed BBQ sauce in my baby formula, and when I outgrew that, they practically raised me at Shorty's in South Florida. We have never found BBQ in the Bay Area we thought was worth eating other than my homemade BBQ chicken (with my homemade BBQ sauce). See my review of Boss Hawg's in Topeka if you want to get idea of what we like in the way of 'cue. 

A friend told us about Baby Blues a few months ago and tonight we gave it a try. Not great, but not too bad either - the best BBQ we've had in the Bay Area. But as my partner said, that's not saying much.

We ordered a half rack of ribs, a beef brisket platter, and mac and cheese and baked beans sides. The good news - the ribs were quite good 0 a little on the dry side, but tasty and meaty. I'd definitely have 'em again.The brisket was pretty tasty too. We both liked the sauces - I preferred the regular sauce, while partner preferred the sweet. 

The bad news - the sides. The beans - tasteless. Ditto the mac and cheese. The cornbread was downright bad, not identifiable as cornbread. Zero corn flavors in that overly moist glop. Probably the worst I've ever had of all three of those dishes. 

My impression is that Baby Blues is trying to do too much, and it doesn't do anything all that well. Texas, Memphis, and Carolina BBQ are all on the menu. The place might be better served by just concentrating on one style, and doing it well. 

We'll probably go back just 'cause there's nothing much else around, and hope we can find some better sides.
author: David G.

description: 5 for food, atmosphere, and server. But 3 for lack of servers. Owners should reconsider adding additional staff seeing as there's usually only 1 poor server running around. Highly recommend the pulled pork!
author: Gaja S.

description:
I'm a native of the south, so I think I can judge good BBQ better than most in SF.  I've tried a few other places in town, but somebody recently told me about Baby Blues and I had to give it a try.  Since it's only about 3 miles from my house, I've tried it 2x now, with good results both times.

The sauce is just OK.  The Ribs are excellent... probably an 8 on a scale of 1-10.  I'm not thrilled with the pulled pork.  It's tasty, but just not compared to other pulled pork I've had.  Personally I won't get it again.  The baked beans are outstanding, since it's more of a hot three-bean salad than baked beans.  Completely different and excellent!  The mac and cheese is quite outstanding too.  Not the best I've ever had, but pretty darn good.  I've tried the collard greens as well and they're a 5 on that scale mentioned above.

The best part of the meal is the cornbread.  They should win an award for cornbread.  It's outstanding!

Oh, and the hot waitresses they have there are great too. One girl has tats all over... man is she hot, and a great personality!

Overall, I like this place and intend to try other things on their menu.  Next up, I'll try the brisket!
author: Todd M.

description:
The prices on eat24 are 10% higher than the regular menu.  I know eat24 takes a cut, but I suspect differential pricing is a policy violation.  Anyways...

Baby blues' website says they deliver within a '15 minute drive'.  In reality, that's a 15 minute bike ride, so my hood's not covered.

I lament; why is SF utterly devoid of proper bbq???
author: dark l.

description:
This place is really great. I have dined in the restaurant as well as ordered in with their delivery numerous times. It's consistent, the food is great and the service is attentive... especially by the owner, who seems lovely. 
I usually get the beef brisket, the hot links (which I'm SO thrilled they decided to bring back!) and the ribs. All are served with the most delicious sauce... and really, when it come to bbq- it's all about the sauce, right? 
For the sides, I love the okra... it's always cooked just right (which means not over done!). My husband likes the cole slaw (me- not a fan of any cole slaw). 
I also love the banana pudding dessert- so yummy!
I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a meaty bbq experience.
author: Terry M.

description:
This is a perfect neighborhood spot! The staff here is so on point that it wouldn't matter if they switched to a soup kitchen...people go where the service is great! Paul's staff knows how to treat people and that is more than half of why I continue to eat there and recommend to my friends.
Now for the BBQ...awesome..pulled pork sandwich tops my list however the catfish, Memphis ribs and brisket are all killer, and that's just the meat. 
Let me get this out of the way about the mac n cheese everyone loves....it's not possible to make quality mac n cheese in a place where people are waiting to eat..it takes time to bake PERIOD! and until I see how it's made I don't have any desire. However the rest of the sides GO. Collard greens, chicken rice, baked beans are official. I go here even when I don't really want BBQ because it feels like I am wanted there besides when the check comes. Doesn't hurt that Paul has Philly gear hanging:)
author: Wild Style G.

description:
This place is pretty good actually; I lived in SF for about three years and had always intended on going to this place and had never gotten around to coming here until I was here this week for a visit. 

They have a decent lunch special with a sandwich and one side for about an average $12-$15. I got the pulled pork sammich, and so you know, its a dry rub and they've got four sauces. Make sure they tell you the different ones so you know the levels of spiciness ;)The mac and cheese is super ono.  But I still wish the sauces were more saucey...and less tabasco-like.  

Service was good, and she was really friendly and accommodating with an additional to go order. 

Overall pretty decent place.
author: Lauren S.

description: Awesome. Awesome. Awesome.  The food is fantastic, everything we have had there is great and they have a great selection of meats and sides.  The service is amazing...shout out to the girl with all the tats (from West Virginia).  She was super friendly.  So was the bartender.  And you can watch the game while eating great food.  Anyway, go there.
author: S. T.

description:
MMM bbq.  After becoming a meat eater again after 6 years of being a vegetarian, I really wanted some BBQ.

I was a little hesitant before coming in due to the highly mixed reviews of this place, but have to say, I was not let down.

We were able to get a seat right away.  I was amazed at how many sauces they had at the table (although it took up a lot of space) to help customize how you want your ribs or change the sauces in the middle of the meal.

I got the Mason Dixon with mashed potatoes and caesar salad.  Salad was standard, felt like I needed some veggies to balance out all the meat.  The mashed potatoes were good but a little dry and lumpy.

Corn bread was good.  Chicken was meh, I felt I was eating more charred skin/bones than the actual meat.

I have to say the star of the dish was the ribs.  They were pretty good, especially with the house sauce or the sassy molassy sauce.  My boyfriend ended up getting the bones/no bones.  The beef was really good.  His baked beans were alright, but the cole slaw was bland.

In the end, Baby Blues BBQ wasn't that bad.  There were some up's and downs but I'd still like to try them again.
author: Kameron K.

description:
OMG!

I have never reviewed anything on yelp but this place is the SH**!!

I grew up in texas so I'm a big snob about bbq & this is the first place in cali I've been impressed by.

Go here. Have the brisket.

My new favorite place.
author: Miss Lady S.

description: We adore this place for brunch on the weekends! They serve brunch from 10-3 on Sat & Sun, and Honey and I rarely miss a weekend. My favorite is the cream-cheese filled French toast, which is tangy, crisp, and not-too-sweet. The FT is served with a side of fresh fruit salad. Honey always orders it with a hot link on the side; great combination! The country farm scramble has spinach, cotija cheese, bacon ends  (you can also get it w/o meat), and the yummiest roasted tomatoes. We also enjoy the shrimp and grits, the fresh fruit and Straus yogurt parfait with housemade ginger granola, and Baby Blues' take on Eggs Benedict, featuring a choice of pulled pork, portobello, pork belly. You can also get a portion of their killer Banana Pudding to go.
author: Susan S.

description:
I'll admit, I went to this place once over a year ago and was so underwhelmed that I had to be dragged back in. That first meal, I don't recall anything particular offensive about the meats but it wasn't great, either. The thing about that first time was the corn on the cob. I'm from another place. A place where corn is fresh and sweet. That yellow stuff that isn't juicy and kind of molds to your teeth? Where I come from, that's what we feed to the cows. So in summation, the first time I ate there, I was very offended by the corn and the meat was not amazing enough to outweigh that.

Had lunch there yesterday and the meat was really good. Brisket, pulled pork, and ribs. Good smoke, the right rubs and sauces. The sides were ok - the okra was very garlicky (which I liked) but also had a LOT of stewed tomatoes (hence, less okra, which I did not like). The sweet mashed was good and the collard greens were OK. I prefer the sweet variety but they weren't so tart that they were bad. The corn bread was good but there were a couple of kernels of that "cow corn" in it so I'm glad I didn't order the corn on the cob again. Lesson learned.
author: Will R.

description:
I'll be the first to admit Baby Blues doesn't serve up strictly authentic bbq--it's definitely got a California twist to it--but it's damn good. 

I dined with another southern lady and we were both smitten. (but then we do both have a California twist to us).

We split the bbq shrimp, which was great, crispy on the outside and still tender, but the sides really won me over.  The okra was amazing, roasted and then stewed with tomatoes and bursting with okra flavor (but minimal okra sliminess).  The creamed spinach, mashed sweet potatoes and blues on the cob were so good that all conversation at the table ceased until they were gone.  

The mac and cheese was good, but I wasn't blown away--it's baked and not gooey enough for me.   

I'd skip dessert next time; the pecan pie and the banana pudding just weren't that impressive.  But there will definitely be a next time.
author: Dana S.

description:
My favorite BBQ joint, Johnson's, happened to be closed when I got there at 8:00 pm (even though they should have been open til 9:00), so now what?  I promised my bf I'd be back with BBQ!  I find Baby Blues on yelp and decide to give it a try.  

YUCK!  Since when is beef brisket pulled?  I think they may have given me the pork instead.  Regardless, it was dry and flavorless.  The ribs, at first sight, were charred so black you can hardly see any rib.  Turns out they were pretty okay and tender, but I definitely prefer saucy, drippy bbq over the dry rubbed.  The mac and cheese was cold and hard and not cheesy at all.  Who fucks up mac and cheese? The okra and the greens were probably the best out of the entire meal, but still didn't blow my socks off. And, last but not least, they forgot to give me my damn corn bread, and I was not about to drive my back ass over there again to look for another parking spot for 20 minutes.  

The prices, for what you get, are not cheap.
author: ThirtyTwo P.

description:
At long last we have good barbeque in San Francisco!  And it's in a perfect location - the cool but not trendy food corridor that is lower Bernal Heights, home to Blue Plate and the Front Porch.  

Some people judge their barbeque by the ribs.  Some, the sides.  Me, the deal maker or breaker is always the chicken.  And let me tell you, the chicken is finger licking, no, entire hand and chin licking good.  One thing that tells you a lot about good barbeque is the meat.  This meat does not have to be slathered in sauce to have a lot of flavor - it falls off of the bone and has just the right amount of smoke.

I tried the "Suicide King" to start - pulled pork on top of cornbread with slaw and cheese - delicious.  Huge and filling (4 portions) so you will want to share otherwise you will definitely kill your appetite - hence, the Suicide.

For my main, I had the "Mason Dixon", half Memphis Ribs and a quarter chicken.  The chicken was as described above, and the pork ribs were tender, juicy, not at all greasy, and with just the right amount of char.  There are 3 sauces to try at the table - regular, XXX, and a peppered vinegar - all good, but honesty the meat doesn't need them.

Sides.  Important and hard to get right.  You get 2 with your entree and I had the Collard Greens and "blues on the cob", grilled corn with Chipotle butter and cheese.  The collards were excellent - highly recommend.  Not too mushy and spiced just right.  The corn was good, well cooked, but surprisingly more bland than I expected.  The cornbread - now that was a treat.  So dense and moist, it was like a little brick of happiness.

Portions are huge - see pics.

This food goes best with beer, and I washed mine down with a tall Blue Moon.  Delicious!

Pecan pie for dessert - sweet and sticky good.

Service was great, and I loved the casual atmosphere.  I will be here again and again - and I am more than a little tempted to try one of their "Feed Bag" catered meals for my next party.

Go celebrate the new year with some good, well-made, REAL barbeque.    Don't wear your finest, because you may end up spotted and stained, but you will definitely be wearing a smile on your way out.  Best way to beat the blues, baby!
author: Liz S.

description:
I've eaten here many times and also had food delivered a bunch as well. Food is consistently good and the price is very reasonable for what you get. I'm not going to argue about BBQ, since it's kinda like arguing about your favorite burrito - someone will ALWAYS tell you about the one place they know that's better. Fuck those people - Baby Blues gets it done. 

That said, the real reason I'm giving this place 5 stars and not just 4 is their service, which has been consistently good, both in terms of delivery and in-house. My last visit was with Holly, the mohawked, tatted-up, cute front-of-the-house person. Great service while dining, but when I left my card there after a drunken dinner and when I called to see if it was there, she recognized me via the phone and had it set up for me to pick up. Table stakes service sure, but delivered with a smile that made me what to come back. 

Funny thing is, she claims to be a nihilist. I tried to get a decent picture so I could create the "Nice Nihilist" Internet meme, but failed to get a decent one. I'm envisioning something like "Believes in nothing...except fantastic customer service" or "Thinks life has no meaning...tells you to have a great day!" Anyhoo, she rocks.
author: Jay N.

description:
I've been told to give them a 4 star review because of the apology. 

So here's what happened:
They forgot my order. Everyone else got theirs, and there I was sitting...then they forgot my corn. Then they brought my corn, but it was cold, room temperature cold. Then they forgot the cornbread for me and one other person. Then we realized they forgot my boyfriends corn but brought out one too many macaronis.

I have to admit though, once I received it, the chicken was good. Nom nom good. And the mac and cheese almost met with my approval, if the mac hadn't of been so squishy. 

So what's up with the four stars? Well, the chef came out, explained it was only their third day of being open, and knocked 50% off our entire meal and gave us this tiger-shirmp appitizer that was pretty decent. The fact that he did that personally after the comedy of errors at our table is pretty sweet of him and shows a lot of potential for this place.

Do I consider it all bbq? Not traditional bbq, no. Do I consider the food good and worth another try for the service? You betcha.
author: Danielle L.

description: I have been wanting to try this place for a long time and I think it was the worst BBQ experience I have ever had. The (4) sauces they had on the table very gross and very watery. So I didn't use them. The corn bread, corn on the cob, potato salad were not very good. The sliced Brisket was absolutely brutal. I only had one little piece and left it. The Memphis Ribs were actually good. But I ended up eating them without sauce as all (4) sauces were not to my liking and not traditional at all. I won't return.
author: Joe M M.

description: Stumbled upon this place and it is awesome!! Love the food...meatball, pork sliders and chicken wings are the best! They make their own hot sauces...from sweet to habanero! If you don't mind getting messy...this is the place! We were greeted right away and they are pet friendly too! :P
author: Amanda K.

description: This was quite possibly the worst bbq I've had since I moved to San Francisco. I ordered the brisket platter and for my sides I had mac and cheese and creamed spinach and it came with cornbread. The brisket was average and the sauces did nothing for me, a little too watery for my taste. The mac and cheese was runny and was basic. I was expecting creamed spinach on the level of a steakhouse style. Nope, it was chopped spinach in a watery creamy consistency. The cornbread had a ton of corn kernels in it, if you're into that. The servers were very nice, but that didn't make up for the fact that I'll never return.
author: Greg J.

description:
What can I say...THIS place is real BBQ. From the atmosphere to the kool aid its all good.

I've always passed this place and wanted to check it out...well a few weeks back I got my chance.
Walking in felt like I walked into a BBQ joint in Memphis...it had that old, worn old school look to it that you would see from a place that was built in the 20' or 30's and the rest of the town was built around it. Lots of crap on the walls and huge tables where groups of 20 or so can sit. 

The staff was attentive even though it was busy and the food was brought out under 15 min.
Oh the food....ribs so tender they fell off the bone when i picked them up, brisket the melted in my mouth with just enough fatty content to make it like butter...and the sauces...HOLY MAN they have some great BBQ sauces.

I've seen some bad reviews on here and I think maybe it was just a matter of difference in taste or opinion. I'm a big BBQ guy, its a family thing and I can say that this is as close to real southern BBQ as i've had out here in a while ...give it a go...best days to go oddly enough are on the weekends.
author: Dean M.

description:
Whats up with this place? 

I wanted to love it soooo much but it would not allow me to.

First of all service is UNBELIEVABLY SLOW. It took our waitress 10 mins before she took our order. Then another 10 to15 mins for our drinks.. Which we had to ask for even though she passed us a dozen times. It was not even that busy of a night. 
Although the 2 servers were really nice girls the service was pretty bad.
We spent soooo much time waiting...waiting...waiting.

All the food was just mediocre. The Beef Brisket was just OK. Chicken & Wings just OK. The "fixins" were a huge letdown. I love cornbread.. its one of my favorite comfort foods. The cornbread had this taste to it that I could not figure out what it was (not a good taste). It was dense and greasy as all get out. The baked beans were not sweet like I like them. It was basically- just beans. The mashed potatoes were good. I could taste that they were mixed with sour cream. Those I liked.. that was about it. I didn't like any of the BBQ sauces they had on the table either.

At least I was able to make a sweet beef brisket hash the next morning with the leftovers.
author: S. M.

description:
Granted my experience was a to-go ceasar salad.  But it was $15 with BBQ shrimp $5+ (of which I got 4).  I live in the hood and thought hey, let's get something different for take out.  I have heard great things about the BBQ, so perhaps I'll try it one more time.  

But right now....feeling ripped off.  I'm unimpressed.
author: Brent R.

description:
Revisited and better food when you eat in. 

*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*

Major disappointment!!! 

I was excited to see this restaurant  added to GrubHub.com and even though there was a $3 charge for delivery I thought it was worth it.  I placed the order and the confirmation stated the delivery time was in one hour.  Not bad considering it was a Sunday night and I expected that would be the length of time.

I ordered the "Blue Devil" - choice of four meats and three sides (Slow Smoked Chicken, Shrimp, Pork Ribs, Texas Ribs, Corn Bread, Potato Salad, Baby Blue Salad) and one piece of pie.  This sounded like a lot of food but I was sharing with my roommate and we thought it sounded right for two people.  We were wrong.  

I received a call 10 minutes after placing the order and was told that they had run out of corn bread (my favorite item) and I needed to make another selection.  Not very apologetic but I thought "this stuff happens".  

The delivery arrived earlier then they stated but was missing the Texas Ribs.  I did receive 1 burnt chicken wing with some breast meat, 5 dry grilled shrimp and 1 Beef Rib.  (I thought when you put an "s" at the end of a word it meant "MORE THAN ONE").  The side dishes were all in tiny deli containers and hardly more than a few bites.

I called the restaurant and it took them 20 minutes to find the original order.  They  determined that a mistake was made when they placed the order into the kitchen and offered to send the missing item(s) in 45 minutes.  Dinner was over.  They weren't apologetic or even concerned that they had ruined my dinner and the items that did arrive were overcooked and uneatable.  I asked to speak to the manager and was told "he was working the grill and couldn't come to the phone".  I think this restaurant should take a hard look at how they take To-Go orders and if they can't handle it then they shouldn't do it!  Also, keep the manager managing and not cooking - I hope he is better at that.

The poor food quality, slew of errors and poor customer service had firmly determined that I will never patronize this place again.
author: Jon S.

description: Since when does 1/3 rack of baby back ribs equal 3 ribs? 18 bucks for 3 ribs?!? Ordered delivery 3 times and was robbed 3 times. The end.
author: Patrick H.

description:
If my diet consisted of only BBQ beef, chicken and pork I would frequent this place more often.

Food:
They serve their beef/pork/ribs right. It had enough spices and flavor that I feel you can eat it as is, without any BBQ sauces, if you want. Last night's side dishes of mac and cheese was on the thin side. The greens were meh but the beans were good. I wonder if they hired new kitchen staff?

Service:
It was so-so the night I was there. The host was moonlighting as a waitress and that didn't go well with our waiter. Hell, I was getting confused as to who to place my order with.

Overall, I think it's always a good idea to train new staff. That said, I'd return and give them another chance.
author: Angela S.

description: Smelled this place from off the bus and had to try it. Got the memphis ribs and they were bomb. Dry rub, with just enough spice to be sip my lemonade but still enjoy them. The memphis sauce was on the money and to top it off jenn hooked me up with a raider plate to eat off of instead of a 9er one. Def gotta go back
author: Papp J.

description: Not sure if it's me or if the food is getting better.  WOW best ribs in the city!!!
author: Ken M.

description: This was my 3rd time here. I used a Groupon this time. This is where you get good old American food. There are several vegetarian sides, though my friend had the portobello sandwich which was good. We also had the mac n cheese which was good but liquidy - that is their style here, creamed spinach, okra, corned bread & mashed sweet potatoes, along with their homemade sweetened iced tea. Service is fast. The seating is informal. Easy street parking. A good change from Italian, Indian, Thai and eclectic San Francisco food.
author: Mihir M.

description:
Soooo....

I feel this is a cool spot when you're out late, need a place to hang out with a group of friends, eat and throw back a couple of beers or drinks. In terms of the actual food though....

I had the baby back ribs. They weren't bad but not good enough for me to get them again. The bbq sauce is. But crazy expensive for the entree. $19.95 for about 6 ribs, 2 sides and corn bread. The real story is with the sides which were below average ranging to horrible. See below:

Mashed sweet potatoes - There was some weird tangy taste in them. I have no idea what that was about. But they pretty much sucked.

Greens - I don't know if they are trying to be creative or what. But was there some sort of stewed tomato in this or something. Just random.

Cornbread - ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE. Some crazy concoction of raisin, light brown colored oatmeal cornmeal mess. I had a small taste as just the sight of this paperweight was enough to turn one off. 

Maybe I should have stuck with burger and fries...that's what one friend did and suggested. I'll probably be back just because I have friends that live a block away and when it's 10pm and you need something to eat...yeah well...you know how it goes.
author: Kim W.

description: Baby Blues has decent barbecue, and I love that they deliver via bicycle.  It is too bad that they cannot get my delivery orders correct, and never provide ANY BBQ sauce at all.  I enter "extra sauce" in every possible field on Eat 24, have tried calling and telling them verbally, but every time my order arrives sauce-less.  Boo!  If you plan to eat at Baby Blues, I suggest eating there, and NEVER ordering delivery.  Bummer.
author: Jack D.

description:
Went there for the first time yesterday for lunch.  I think working with fellas is going to expand my belt.  

Seriously? BBQ for lunch?  But OK. 

Got the 'Hound Dog' which consisted of brisket and baby back ribs.  I opted for mac n'cheese as a side.  Because really - who turns down mac n'cheese?  NO ONE!!    

The brisket and ribs were well cooked brisket and ribs.  The ribs were dry ribs and the brisket was tossed with some of the mild bbq sauce.  The sauces though - thoroughly rounded out the plate.  They offer four different kinds on the table and it's up to you find your 'mix.'  They have a really hot one that I found, when mixed with their mildest one, was bomb!  I'm not a super spicy food type of gal - but this was really good.  Mouth was burning and nose was running but what a small sacrifice for yummy food?  

And really the pièce de résistance was the mac n'cheese.  You MUST have a side of the mac n'cheese (i'm pretty sure the apostrophe is in the wrong position but whatevs).   That was scrum-didly-ump-shussss!   It's also a whole lotta grease but it's cheese.  What do you expect?  It's also totally worth it.   

The guys didn't like their food at ALL.  You could tell by the empty plates left in their wake.  lol  

Def. going again and trying ALL of their sides.  Not all at the same time of course.
author: Judy T.

description:
If you are from North Carolina,  Kansas City,  Nashville or Texas, you are going to be very disappointed.  There is no evidence of smoke in the room or the food.  Lots of food but almost no flavor.  Sides were pretty average.  Pulled pork was excellent but the brisket was awful.   Think it was all baked,  then finished on a gas grill.  Might be improved if over real wood coals.  

Also,  pretty pricey.  I would suggest you don't go
author: Guy B.

description:
I was looking forward to checking this place out since it is close to home. The decor and overall layout is cute and very "ride 'em cowboy". 

The food was mediocre at best. I had the Pulled Pork Platter and the meat was pretty dry. This place has about four different sauces at the table so I drenched my pork with that. My plate came with two sides, which I chose baked beans (not your typical baked beans and I do not mean this in a good way) and mashed sweet potatoes (pretty good). The plate also came with a piece of corn bread with a look, texture, and taste I had never experienced before. Once again, I'm not sure if this was a good thing. 

Service was pretty good. Oh, and I also tried the stewed tomatoes (SO GOOD) and the collard greens (also great). I think I'd go back for drinks and maybe to have just some side orders.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
I got the "The Rebel": 1/4 Memphis Ribs, 1/3 Free Range Chicken, with a side of Pork and Beans (see before and after pics) for $14.

There's a bunch of BBQ sauces to choose from, and it's good comfort food. I've had better BBQ, but it ain't bad.

It's under the heading of "Small Plates," but I had leftovers, also ain't bad. (see before and after pics)
author: Epicurean _.

description:
It's all about the Big Blue or if I am hungry - the Blue Devil !!
I can eat a fair amount of food, so these are the only things I order from the menu.
The big blue comes with 3 meats and two sides.
The blue devil comes with 4 meats and two sides.

I always go with pulled pork, beef brisket, and memphis ribs. My go to sides are sweet mashed potatoes and collard greens.

The pulled pork is always moist and never dry.
The beef brisket is served in a way similar to the pulled pork in the way that it is shredded and not sliced.

Try the hot sauce it goes good on everything!

The family that runs the place is always there and they are very friendly and nice.
author: Antony H.

description:
Just got back from Austin where Franklin's in the new king of the cue.

Baby Blues BBQ should be called Baby Blues Baked Meats.

Cause you can't taste any smoke.  Folks, if you can't taste any smoke seasoning, it's like why bother calling in BBQ.  Just called it baked meat.

Would not recommend at all.
author: Sam P.

description:
Had the Cherokee Spike lunch special and for the second time it hasn't disappointed. 

What else is awesome about this place is that they have the best beers on tap and my personal fav: Trumer. And in it's custom glass. 

Being from Texas I've got a bias towards West Coast BBQ not being all that but Baby Blues is on the short list of exceptional BBQ.

The way they serve the brisket is a little non traditional but it's probably the best meat I've tried here.
author: James G.

description:
I've been knowing about this place for a while and thought I'd give it a try one hungry day after work. Looked at the platters on the menu and saw that everything was quite pricey ($13 - $30 (for 4 different kinds of meat in your patter, expensive O_O)), first bad thing I noticed. So being as pricy as it is, I thought it better be pretty damn good. I ordered the beef brisket platter with mac n cheese and sweet potato sides from the nice bartender, and it came out in about 8 minutes. Took it home and popped it open to find that the beef brisket portion was quite small, but the sides were nice sized. 

Looking at the brisket it looked kinda over cooked and stiff. Took a bite and found out my theory was correct. It was not tender at all. Good thing I asked for a lot of BBQ sauce because I had to use it with every bite I took. Sad to say I ate it all because I was very hungry, otherwise I might have fed it to my dog, who might have been skeptical as well about eating it. 

Next the mac n cheese, it did not taste bad I have to say, but it did not taste like mac n cheese. It tasted more like a bland white sauce pasta dish with some spices in it. The macaroni was cooked perfectly though, soft and tender.

The sweet potato was alright, very plain and tasted healthy. There was nothing much to it besides sweet potato in it, not like the fancy kinds with cinnamon or marshmallows in it. 

Last the cornbread, it was okay, kinda crispy on the outside and gooey soft on the inside, but nothing special. 

Was not very satisfied with this spot and probably would never come back.
author: Patrick L.

description:
I have been here about 5 times and each time its consistently great! The ribs, catfish and pulled pork are the best!!!! They give you 4 different sauces and my fav is the ginger vinegary kind. The sides are hard to decide. I usually go with:
Pork and Beans- They use the pulled pork and its best with the chili water they give you at the table. 
stewed tomatoes- There's something extra special they do with the canned tomatoes that make you forgive the fact that there canned. 
Greens- are a must-have. There meaty and have a nice savory broth. 

Today I tried the pecan pie and you could tell it was not made in-house, and was a bit old. I don't think I would order it again. 

I will always consider this great BBQ joint when trying to figure out where to eat. 

side note- I'm not a fan with chain joints.. But this one does the whole "chain" vibe really well.
author: Ryann C.

description:
So I went by on what was supposedly opening day, they gave us a take out menu and sent us on our way telling us that we should come back after 5.

I called that night to see if they would deliver (the menu says they wil) and no answer.  I've also called back every night since then and it's always the default voicemail message.  I just want some confirmation that they ever plan on serving food to the general populace.  I really want to have a good (or really let's be honest, even a halfway to decent ) BBQ place in SF that delivers ( i loved Big Nates until that little food poisoning incident...).  Bonus points for being in my hood.

I plead with you Baby Blues, let us love you!  Please open your delicious meat filled doors, pick up your phone or at least record a message letting me know that you are for real!

---

Update (2008/12/21):

Ok, bumping to 3 stars, i'd say 3.5 if I could.

The cool folks at Baby Blues emailed apologizing and saying that they'd be open on Saturday as well as answering the phone.  I verified by calling and asking if they were open, an actual human answered and said yup, and so headed down the hill.

We walked right in and sat down, even with a stroller it was easy to find a place, I think there were maybe 4 other tables occupied.  

It's still very rough.  There was some welding and grinding going on for the first 10-15 minutes we were there but once that was done things settled down to a nice quiet level of noise.  The wait staff were obviously still trying to get the hang of things but were very friendly.  I think the guy that took our order is one of the owners (?) and told us that once they get more smokers in the place should be running a bit smother.  He also told us that he wasn't happy with the current potato salad recipe so they weren't currently serving it.

Ok, enough about the place, let's talk food!

Cornbread that comes with every plate, awesome!  It's almost corn pudding, really good stuff with corn kernels right in it.

Mashed sweet potatoes, wow!  these could be a dessert and a damn fine one at that.

The cole slaw was tasty, no mayo ( as god intended! ).

The pecan pie as suggested by another poster was awesome, make sure to save room for it.

Now with all this goodness there was only 1 thing that wasn't great.  We split a "Memphis Queen", 1/2 rack of Baby Back ribs and 1/2 of Memphis style.  They were ok.  The meat was nice and moist in the middle but pretty dry and kinda tough toward the ends.  I used a fair amount of the "XXX" BBQ sauce and was generally happy with it.

Like Baby B. said, they're still a work in progress and it shows.  All the sides we tried were right on, the meat could still use a little work and since this is a BBQ place that's what we're all after, right?  I'm planning on going back and could see placing the occasional phone order for delivery ( should be starting shortly ).  It's not beating out my current SF BBQ ave Memphis Minnies but it'll do in a pinch.  Next time I'll be sure to try something other than ribs.  I'm excited to try a pulled pork sandwich with cole slaw.

My wife also suggested adding a kid changing table in the bathroom.

Added pics of the inside and some of the food, check it out for yourself.
author: steve a.

description:
Went here while my car was being services across the street a while ago.

The mashed sweet potatoes are killer. Needed a little salt but that's a good thing.

Had the swordfish. Well spiced. Oh, and good beers too!
author: Marina L.

description:
My boyfriend wanted to go here, he swore it was really good. He had been here before... there's just one problem... I really don't like to eat meat off the bone. It's 2011. I am not a barbarian. I don't need to rip meat off of the bone with my mouth.

All of that changed while I was at Baby Blues BBQ. It was so tasty. They have like 5 different kinds of bbq sauce- are you frickin' kidding me?? I LOVE BARBACUE SAUCE. It's so tasty. I want to put it on everything. But to have 5 different kinds to taste. I was in food amazement.

We ate at the bar. The bartender was very attentative and super sweet. I'm definitely going back.
author: Russell Allen E.

description: After a couple of visits, this is hands down my favorite SF BBQ joint. I haven't had the ribs yet (BBQ sacrilege!), but I've had the beef brisket and the pork, and they were both great. Nice selection of sauces, and mostly excellent sides. The corn on the cob is amazing (not sure what they season it with), the mashed potatoes are good (as mashed potatoes always are), and the sweet potatoes and cream spinach are also solid. Mac and cheese is just meh, and the cornbread has been a bit hit or miss (but never bad). Bonus points for the great music that's been playing everytime I've been in here.
author: Pat M.

description: Fast delivery (add $3) to nearby in Bernal Heights through the Yelp feature using Eat24.   I was impressed the delivery arrived in about 25 minutes since I had only tried it one before maybe a year or more ago, when I walked in,  and the to go order took a long time.  It seems they've improved their service.  Also it was a green delivery, the guy was on a bike, which was nice.  The barbque chicken, baked beans, potato salad and toasty ciabatta were very good.  Lots of barbq sauce for dipping, and very tasty and fresh.  I especially liked their cornbread.  I'll be back.
author: Catherine A.

description:
I called for delivery and it took Baby Blues four minutes to tell me that they only deliver to Bernal Heights and part of the Mission. 

Uh... BB could have told me that on their website OR told me that on the phone before asking for my address three times. 

On the BB website, it states that delivery is made within a 15 minute drive of the restaurant. Per google maps, I'm 9 minutes from the restaurant.
author: Jacquee P.

description:
Easily my favorite BBQ place in the SF/Bay Area.  Maybe a tad pricey, but the food is quality.  
Located in an old drugstore with mismatched furniture, there is a casual laidback vibe.  
The sides are decent if not spectacular.  The one exception is the Blues/Corn on the cob, which is very good.  
Chicken Wings are great (ask for the Sweet Kick) & the Shrimp are flat out brilliant.  
Of the meats, my favorites are the Baby Back's & Memphis Dry Rub.  Chuck on some of various sauces or eat plain, the meat is (95% of the time) cooked to perfection.
author: Brett L.

description: The briskets are good and the macaroni and cheese as well.  I really only eat brisket and macaroni at BBQ places
author: Gwendolyn H.

description:
5 different, unique sauces at the table... family-friendly environment... stewed tomato-side that's addictive, and killer pulled pork - NEED I SAY MORE? The staff seem to really like working here. They're friendly and "happy." Paul, the owner, sat down and chatted with our family as we mowed down the pear cobbler and fresh strawberry shortcake.  I lived in Texas so I don't take BBQ lightly. Yummy!
The smoked salmon, pork, and beef brisket sandwich that we ordered were delicious.. Now I'd love to see Paul's take on Korean bbq!
author: Suki K.

description: Unfortunately, I have to agree with Chris C. 100%.  We tried a variety of the meats and sides and NOTHING was good.  What a huge let down.. I really had a craving for BBQ too and this is just pathetic, not to mention expensive :(
author: J P.

description:
After a few failed trips, and calls that resulted in many rings with no answer I was thrilled when this place was *finally* open. I think they caught a lot of flack since their opening was prematurely broadcast all over the place (Daily Candy for sure, and I think the Chronicle as well) before it was REALLY actually open, whether that is their fault or not I cannot say. 

What I can say is that we got delivery. Ribs delivery... and it tasted good. For a large group of gals, Sharon M ordered the "Feed Bag" Teaser option which came with a rack of baby backs and a rack of memphis style ribs, pulled pork and a ton of sides. This was the smaller of the party options and it was plenty of food. Everyone (10 or so people) was able to have a few things and feel full, so I would recommend this as a casual catering option for your next party.

 I've certainly had better pulled pork, but as sauces go I enjoyed it. The baby back ribs were by far my fav. I would go back, but i've been warned by friends who've dined in to give them some time to settle in a bit more.

All in all I am happy to have this as a delivery option!
author: Nikki M.

description:
Great selection of side dishes, but that is where the complimentary portion of this review has to end, as they were all pretty (subjectively) nasty.

The corn bread tops the list as the number one offender to our assaulted palates, comprising a bitter and mushy pate of ick that half of our party wouldn't even touch after the first bite, but the mashed sweet potatos were almost as bad (and maybe even a little more disturbing as I'm not quite sure what you have to do to mess up mashed sweet potatos. The potato salad and collard greens were _okay_.

The ribs were somewhat subpar as well, although the sauces for them were pretty damn good... I'll have to add another star for that.

Disclaimer: We ordered this as delivery from grubhub.com, so maybe something was lost in translation along the way, or maybe they were just having an off day at Baby Blues, but I have to call them like I see them!
author: Rio R.

description: mmmm....being from VA I had my doubts walking in. But I have to say this bbq was delish! The pulled pork was great as was the brisket and ribs. I loved the selection of sauces at the range as well. The NC bbq sauce was as good as any I've ever tasted!
author: WaltzingMatilda T.

description: I'm giving this 5 stars. Cool staff, pulled pork was heavenly, and they have 5 home made BBQ sauces you can try at the table. I toured Charleston simply to try all their BBQ and amazing Southern food and this was on par, maybe with a California twist.
author: Elaine C.

description:
I've been here 3-4 times, and the place is OK. 

Maybe it's because I'm from the Midwest, but it seems to me a BBQ place ought to have fall-off-the-bone fantastic ribs, if nothing else. And the ribs here are just OK. And the cornbread: it's just OK. It's not horrible, mind you, but... meh.

I will say that in BBQ options in SF are scarse, so it's to their credit that they offer this cuisine. So if you have that hankerin' this grub will hit the spot.

If nothing else, the creamed spinach is some of the best I've ever had. They don't kill the spinach, and its not drenched in butter and cream. But why do they nail creamed spinach but fall short on slaw, cornbread, and ribs?

But again,  if you have that hankerin'... you're not gonna complain.

PS: For delivery in the area: LIGHTNING fast. I think faster than if we ordered it at the restaurant! Grubhub it... Crazy.
author: Ches W.

description: If you haven't tried this place yet, you are missing out! Great tasting BBQ, awesome service and the Banana Pudding was over the top. I'm coming back for more!!!!
author: Larry R.

description:
Upon further review, went back away, and it wasn't nearly as good.  Everything was just "pretty good."

------

Best BBQ restaurant I've been to in San Fran.

Had the half rack Memphis with 1/4 white meat chicken, collared greens, and mac'n'cheese.  

Ribs were very good, not incredible.  Like the dry rub style.  While the meat was tender, the outside was a bit over cooked.  I'm into the contrast, but I think the outside should have been less tough.  Still, very good, and great with the sauces.  

I used the "Original Sauce" and then mixed it with one of their hotter sauces, which I think was Tabasco-based.  That's not my thing because Tabasco, if it actually was that, has such a unique flavor it almost dominates the hot.  Rather they use a lesser known sauce; something I'm not familiar with.  However, I mixed the two, and again, damn good.

Chicken was cooked to PERFECTION.  The Moms made a legendary chicken, and my friends back in Jersey have won AWARDS (www.localsmokebbq.com) for their chicken.  This was damn good chicken.

Collared greens used a tomato based sauce, and I love that.  Might have been my favorite thing, which is rare for me.  Could have eaten a bucket of the greens.

Mac and Cheese was fluffy, tasty, and perfectly cooked.  LOVE it.

Had a Marzen beer by Gordon Biersch, which is a brew I really like a lot.

All told, cost me around $29, which is about $4-5 too pricey, but still worth it.

Plus the Giants lose to the Phillies, AGAIN, which was nice.

For San Fran BBQ, as good as it gets, yes.
author: David W.

description:
Major plus for B.B.B. is that you can order delivery through Grubhub.com. 

Everything is just OK. Nothing has that wow factor that you want to have when you eat bbq. 
The cornbread wasnt bad. I think that may have been my favorite part of the whole meal,  was dipping my cornbread in my baked beans sauce. 
They have mashed potatoes  but dont have gravy. You CANT do that! It's just wrong. 

Wasnt too pricey, they have great portions and lots of sides to choose from.

FOLLOW UP: ~20 minutes after eating, I started feeling that dreadful grumbling in my tummy that one really hates. Luckily, I'm at home-alone. Otherwise I'd be embarrassed having my roomie hear me while  writing this follow up in the loo. 

BOO! I guess I'll go back to N.O. for some bbq 'cause SF is not cutting it.
author: Tasha A.

description: I found myself needing a large group dining space, on relatively short notice on a Saturday night. And as is often the case with large groups, you don't know exactly how many people are going to show up. The day before the event (!) I was able to make a reservation for 20 people around a massive table with lots of stools, so we were easily able to handle fluctuations in headcount. The food was solid, the ambience was great, the service was good, and the prices were reasonable. They offer big family-style set-price selections of sides, meats, etc. Their suggested serving sizes are huge -- we ordered the platter designated for 16, and our group of ~22 couldn't finish everything -- so unless everyone is ravenous you can go down a size or two on the platter choices. Great choice for a last-minute large group dinner.
author: David C.

description:
Came in for a friend's birthday.  Enjoyed all of the cute boys licking sauce off their fingers.
BBQ was good, service was pretty decent if I recall, but really all I recall is making an ass out of myself in front of our dining companions so that kind of overshadows the evening for me.
author: Jennifer D.

description: The best BBQ in San Francisco without a doubt. I grew up in Texas, and this is the BBQ place I head to when I've got a craving for meat!
author: Daniel P.

description:
I always get the Memphis Queen platter to share with someone else. It's a heaping pile of baby back ribs and Memphis-style ribs, where all the meat falls cleanly off the bone and absolutely melts in your mouth like butter. It's so good it's getting hard for me to branch out into other menu items. I really want to try the shrimp and the pulled pork. NEXT TIME, I swear!

Try the kansas-style BBQ sauce (it's vinegar based) for a sweet-tangy splash of flavor. I could eat a whole mountain of their mac n' cheese, which I think has blue cheese or swiss in it or something....there's definitely some that makes you go "What IS that on my tongue?!" in a good way, of course! Also be sure to check out their mashed sweet potato (vitamin A, guys) and creamed spinach. Oh, and wash it all down with some ice cold Shiner Bock for extra street cred. It's a hard beer to find in SF.

Another thing that really sticks out in my mind is how friendly EVERYONE who works there is. From the moment you walk in, they'll greet you with smiles, and the service is fast efficient, non-intrusive, and the waitresses have really cute senses of humor. So glad this joint is near my house.
author: Laura M.

description:
This is my first time here.  I lived in Texas for 7 years and ate a LOT of barbecue.  This place did not disappoint.  It was like being in Texas again except for the pierced and tattooed black-clad wait staff.  These guys and gals were all friendly and into the food that is served there.  Our waitress helped us to pair the cue to the beer (or visa versa).  She also explained all of the meat types.

The smell of wood barbecue walking up to the place is fantastic.  Leave all pretense at home.  This is a neighborhood joint.  Close in tables.  basic benches.  no frills.  The menu is (of course) meat heavy but, believe it or not, there are vegetarian options in the form of classic sides.  I asked jokingly about vegan options...I think that many of the sides are vegan!

You order your meat selection and then the sides.  The sauteed okra was phenomenal.  NONE of the drooly slime that is associated with okra and mercifully, not breaded and fried.  The seasoning was spot on and the okra was actually crunchy (but cooked) not mushy.  It was in fresh tomato sauce.  The cole slaw was also delicious.  Crunchy and not too sweet or creamy. Perfect.  The mashed sweet potatoes were also very good.

The bar is beer and wine.  The beer selection is pretty good (including Shiner Bock a Texas classic).   The ribs were really good.  Juicy, smokey, tasty and not drenched in barbecue sauce.  The chicken similarly, was moist and not over cooked to dust.

There are many options for bbq sauces from classic tomato base, tabasco base, molasses base, and habanero based.  Sweet to heat.  Choose your poison.  It is right on the table for you to enjoy.

Rhubarb-strawberry and -apple pie and classic banana pudding were on the menu for dessert.  Tragically, they were out of S-R pie and we had to have the apple. Tasty. not too sweet.  Crunchy apples.  LOVED it.
author: Carlos R.

description: Except for the ribs, the food was not good. The Mac and cheese tasted like cardboard. The collard greens had very little flavor and full of stems. The rice was bland as well. In town from Pittsburgh,PA and leaving disappointed from this place.
author: Reginald H.

description:
Solid food.  I had the brisket.  The sauces were awesome!  Cornbread good.  Collard greens perfect.  The Cesar salad SUCKED.  How can you mess up a Cesar salad?    

I was craving two things: creamy dressing like ranch or blue cheese and fried goodness.  They didn't have either!!!  No french fries or sweet potato fries. 

For $15 the meal was not quite worth my coming back.  And I live super close.  The atmosphere is cool.  I took my order to go.  Perhaps dining in would make everything better?
author: Austin C.

description:
Okay, I've never posted anything on YELP! This place is  the WORST! place ever. I hope u guys at Baby Blues reads this! Yes I walked in with my Husband big tall black guy and my son wearing the blue jacket and me short Latina. I usually get my BBQ from my mother in law who's from New Orleans-REAL SOUL FOOD! 

1. The Price, a fucken Square inch piece of some nasty ass cornbread! for $3.50!

2. The Coleslaw-Fast food joints got better coleslaw than this place

3. The Ribs were Burnt from the outside- I mean Charred- I was sooo pissed my husband stopped me at the door cause I was ready to take it back.

4. the Chicken-My 7 yr old son could of got sick-It was Bleeding from the inside! What kind of BBQ joint does this!

5. The waitress had the nerve to say " this wont be the last time you see us" Yea right. She said that because I let her know it was the first time trying their place out. We got out food in about 15 minutes like she promised. Anyone who likes this placed does not know what real BBQ is.

$60 bucks down the fucken compost Bin! THe worms wouldn't even like it.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Awesome down home casual atmosphere, Shiner Bock on tap, killer BBQ meat dishes, 4 kinds of sauce both Texas and Tennessee style.  The end.  I'd say veggies aren't their strong point, but why would you eat veggies in a BBQ place anyway?

Also, great happy hour: $2 off starters and drinks and some other deals I can't remember.  :)
author: Melanie C.

description:
Just got home with a pulled pork sandwich. Got 3 bites in and had to abandon it, as every bite contained a huge piece of bone or ligament or some sort of inedible anatomy of the pig. Seriously, I'm talking inch long chunks of something you can't chew. 

Just poor preparation, through and through.

One star is for the potato salad, which so far has proven to be edible.
author: tyler w.

description:
I came here because of my google offers coupon. I have walked by the place plenty of times since I've been to El Rio a lot. Anyway, I had the BBQ chicken sandwich. It was pretty good. My lunch came with sweet potatoes and that was excellent to.

I really love this place. Not only is the good great (order the catfish to take home) but the service is even better. As soon as you walk in, you are greeted. If the waitress or waiter is not close to the door, they briskly walk towards the new customers to greet you and show you to a table. 

Once I placed my order, they made sure to come back to me to let me know that my order was on its way. When my order was delivered, I was asked and explained to the different sauces they had.

There is also a bar with a TV so you can even watch a game or just watch the news.

The service was prompt, accurate, and very friendly. I cannot wait to try the other things they have on the menu. Oh yah, I still have to the catfish in my frig to try. Yay!!!
author: arleen r.

description:
referring to my previous review, I'm on the fatty train. Shrimp Po Boy doused in XXX sauce + mac and cheese with the vinegar jalapeno concoction=SEXUAL EXPLOSIONS IN YO MOUTH BIIIIIIITCH

fatty out.
author: Lauren V.

description:
As a steadfast loyalist of Big Nate's Barbeque, I have to cop to the fact that I think there is pretty much just one way to make ribs.  But having said that, Baby Blues is definitely worth a visit.  

As a converted drugstore/converted retro curio store, it's not the most inviting space, and at our table it was dark enough so that I had to go stand under a light at the other end of the restaurant to read my menu.  Plus, I didn't like the Led Zep they played over the sound system -- not the best for mood or for digestion.  But the food was by and large very good.  If you don't like eating large quantities of cheese, don't get the mac and cheese, but it was rich beyond belief.  Many of their side dishes are also great, like the potato salad -- I could have eaten that for several hours.

The beef brisket was, by the reports, really good.  That came in a very healthy-sized portion -- as did the "Texas BBQ Special," which we had no idea what it was when we ordered it except that they were beef, and most of the other ribs they had were pork.  Indeed, when they arrived, the Texas Specials literally dwarfed the plates they came on.  I had no idea that ribs came in such giant, Fred Flintstone sizes - I mean, the rib bones were close to 13" x 2", so large that the ends of the bones poked out of the clamshells we took their remains home in.  And they were so massive that it took several minutes of sawing away to separate the ribs from each other so that they could be successfully maneuvered into the mouth.  A little chewy, but tasty as well as memorable.

Plus, you gotta love a place that not only has Pabst on tap, but serves Kool-Aid on top of that.
author: moosedog i.

description:
I've had the pleasure of experiencing both Baby Blues BBQ through delivery and in house dining.  Both experiences get 5 stars.  

What spurred me to write this review was my recent delivery order.  Me and my roommates ordered the Blue Devil Plate, which consists of 4 meats of your choice and 3 sides.  The order was delivered in less than 20 minutes, but we soon realized that we were missing the Baby Back Ribs.  I called in to confirm that I had ordered the right plate, and the server who took my order originally apologized for the mistake.  Within 10 minutes the delivery guy came back with our Ribs and 2 pieces of pecan pie + banana mousse tart thingie as a sweet way of saying sorry.  Amazing.  Thumbs up for these guys.
author: kina a.

description: I love this place! The service is always fast and friendly. The food is sooooo good! I get the the Razorback, the Hound Dog, or Cherokee Spike off the small plates menu and get the sweet potato side. Also, I usually order one of the Grilled Tiger Shrimp as a starter. It's all great! I love all the hot sauces on the table, too!
author: Casey P.

description:
I knew I was in for a surprise when the two people behind the bar were too busy sex ting each other instead of taking my order. Luckily I was on an extended lunch break that didn't require speedy service. 

When the employees finally got away from their social media and served my sandwich, I then proceeded to pour BBQ sauce on it to prevent the severe dryness the meat exhibited. This was only able to occur after I pestered the socialites behind the bar for some extra BBQ sauce because all the others were empty. 

Maybe next time will be better.
author: Josh D.

description:
I had the BBQ chicken sandwich and the mac and cheese about two months ago.  Since then I have been there about 5-6 times.  Being a creature of habit, I ordered the same thing every time, so I cannot speak to everything on the menu.

The price is decent--not cheap, but definitely not overpriced.

The service is good--they come to your table the right amount of times and are definitely friendly and make good recommendations--i'm sticking with the chicken though.

The chicken is cooked just right and the sauces there are really good.  I mixed and matched and overloaded the sandwich with a bunch of different sauces.  The Mac and Cheese is good, but it becomes great when you add the ginger tabasco sauce.

I recommend a visit, but maybe you should be more adventurous than me and try more than just the BBQ chicken and mac and cheese.
author: David C.

description:
Mmmmm I love BBQ. This place is alright. Not the best I've had by any means. I'd go back, and I like that they deliver so I may take advantage of that sometime. There were good points and not-so-good points.

Good:
The Texas style rib(s) - it's one huge beef rib. And it was soo delicious and tender. Do NOT skip this! Really good stuff. I could have just eaten this and been happy. 
Fresh brewed sweet tea.
All of the sauces were great.
Potato salad and the cole slaw was pretty damn good.

Not-so-good:
The service - it seemed really off  to me. Almost like it was an afterthought. Both of the people who waited on us were sort of aloof and didn't really have it together skillfully or socially. I just know I didn't like it.
The Memphis ribs - They were okay. I wouldn't get them again. I love smokey, but these were TOO smokey for me. Almost like I could taste liquid smoke. I could barely taste the pork actually.
The mac n cheese - It's one of my favorite foods, and apparently they are "known for it" here. It WAS yummy, but unfortunately room temperature to almost cold, which almost killed it for me. Come to think of it, so was everything else that was supposed to be warm. I like my food hot, but was starving and nursing a hangover so I didn't have the patience to wait any longer to feed my face.
author: Betsy W.

description: Brisket corn bread Mac and cheese were awesome the ribs and the pulled pork nothing to write home about. I would defiantly go back for the wings brisket and the Mac and cheese
author: Jeremy R.

description:
When first approaching, I knew this place was a bit pricey. Let me tell you, with the portions of the food, its WELL WORTH YOUR MONEY. It was delicious!! although the baby back ribs were a little on tough side the with the taste of only brown sugar, their four sauces made it worth while! The memphis ribs were BEYOND tender and flavorful. and OMG THE SIDES WERE HEAVEN!! To no surprise, my bill racked up to a ,worth while, 65$ for two ppl. Thank god, it was payday for my boyfriend (:

Update: I've went there recently and it wasn't as good as it was when I first had it. The ribs were slightly dry, but still delicious. It might've been picky just cus I didn't have a big appetite.
author: Sandra L.

description: Best BBQ in SF.  Pricey but delicious.  Great for a night out with friends, but also if you bring in your kids - they even have a kids play area.  The hipster waitstaff are really friendly and attentive.  My only complaint is that they only serve beer and wine - bourbon would be a nice touch.
author: Dan C.

description:
I was really excited to try this place as my rents currently reside in the south and I needed to find a good place to bring my dad when he comes to town.  

Went with a group of friends after happy hour at El Rio and they sat us at the bar, which is great by the way.  Wood and stone mix that was super stylish and cozy.  The bartender was pretty hot french, surfer looking guy.  Great beer.  It was Friday and busy so the clearing of plates was a little slow but the food and service made up for it.    The owner came to greet and serve us...double plus.




-Mags and I shared the Texas style baby back ribs: I felt they were a little fatty for what I was used to but Maggie was in pure heaven...see the photo
-mashed sweet potatoes - these were perfect in all ways but slightly cold:(
- mac n' cheese - great!...cheesey, tasty but a little bland
- corn bread - Yuuummm!!  this was awesome and will make me return
-Chris had the baby back ribs Memphis and Shannon had the pulled pork and both were in my opinion better than the Texas Style Baby back ribs we ordered

If I can say I will bring my dad here when he comes to town than I can say that I am a fan.
author: J J.

description: I thought it was really pretty darn good. We shared the baby back ribs and the sauces were tasty, the meats were good, the portions were generous. The baked beans tasted more like a vegan chili soup, but the corn bread thingie totally made up for it. And the place was cute, trendy, fun! Did I mention the sauces, especially the molasses one? No? Great!
author: Andrew K.

description:
Bad food makes me angry, and Baby Blues BBQ made me want to fling my plate against the wall and scream "Noooo!! Yuckies!!!" like a two-year-old.

We ordered delivery on Friday night. Granted, I know that delivery food is often sub-par to the dine-in counterpart, so I tried to keep that in mind. The restaurant said that our food would arrive in about 30 minutes. By the time it actually arrived almost 2 hours later, I was a starving, raving food beast. I would have eaten anything you put in front of me. 

And yet, I couldn't choke down our food. The blackened catfish was inedible - overspiced and so dry that it was chewy. Beef brisket was stringy and flavorless. Even the famed mac and cheese was gross. I only had two or three noodles - the rest was bread crumbs, soaked in a watery cheese sauce. The only saving grace was the side of okra. And when okra is your saving grace, you know you're eating a shitty meal.

So. Angry. 

Never again, Baby Blues.
author: Sara A.

description:
This is by far the most Californified-BBQ I've ever had - not in a good way at all. The ribs smelled good but did not fall off the bone. The sauce comes in stingy tiny little cups and while kind of tasty, is more like yummy salsa than BBQ sauce (was there cumin in that? and chipotle peppers for heaven's sake?). The cornbread was "re-imagined" in some dark-molasses or whole wheat (?) kind of way that was NOT tasty - it was kind of spongy and dense and didn't taste much of, say, corn. The sweet potato was just a mashed sweet potato - no seasoning whatsoever and mushy. The greens were still tough and cooked entirely without meat - and they weren't even the right kind of greens. Oh my god and the mac&cheese. No. Just No. The noodles had a weird mushy texture, like gluten-free pasta does sometimes. and the sauce was watery, like I had to get a spoon just so there'd be any cheese in my mouth when I ate the noodles. And it was so bland - it was mostly milk. Cheese didn't really factor into it. Really awful Mac & cheese.

OK - an aside - but Greens (by which I mean soul food greens served typically with BBQ) are made from a cabbage relative (kale, collards, mustard greens, etc.) and they should be cooked for a LONG time and flavored with ham/bacon and other delicious things to make them good, and make the broth they soak in so good you eat it too. They are the food of people without a lot of options, made miraculously delicious by great effort and addition of whatever could possibly help them. It is NOT the same thing to take some greens (was it kale? or was it mustard greens?) and cut it with swiss chard (a spinach relative, made for people with weak palates who don't like flavor) and cook it for a little while (too long for chard, not long enough for greens) with no meat to flavor it (the ham is needed because these greens do not taste naturally delicious) and no delicious broth and as far as I can tell no seasoning at all.  Now I've eaten delicious swiss chard and enjoyed it, when it was cooked the way swiss chard should be - sauteed with onions and lots of butter, for example. But swiss chard should not be cooked like greens and greens need a lot of help that swiss chard can't provide. I mean, come on.

Well, so I give it more than 1 star only because it was not disgusting, but it was extremely disappointing when I was so looking forward to BBQ that night and my regular place was closed already Baby Blues was open late and still serving and it smelled smoky and good inside the restaurant (but I knew from the decor it was going to be some white white white BBQ in this bag) and well, that's exactly what I got when I got home and settled in for some long-awaited ribs.
author: Rebecca C.

description: This may sound ironic, but few years ago I went to this place and the food was awesome and I wrote a great review of this restaurant. I came back to check to see if it was still around and it was. I ordered some chicken tenders and mashed potatoes. I sat and waited for my food, the owner was there, the reason why I give two stars is because of his service and outstanding great attitude. He came to me twice to ask me what I was waiting for and told me that chicken tenders usually take longer because they are fried. I didn't really mind the wait, sometimes we don't care about the wait because we know the food is so good. Maybe about 20-30 minutes I received my food. I was so excited to go eat my food, unfortunately the food was horrible. The chicken tenders were not so good as before and the mashed potatoes were hard and little cold. I wasn't impressed, I was upset about how sometimes restaurant do change. It wasn't the best and now I am questioning to refer any of my friends anymore to this restaurant. I'm sorry but sometimes it's good to be honest then just tell people it's awesome. Maybe next time I will try something else.
author: Jose R.

description:
Great Barbecue. Sauces are excellent. Favorites: Pulled Pork and Baby Back Ribs. Only thing I didn't like was the Mac n' Cheese. I keep coming back.
