I saw a review on this new BBQ in the 2/12/2009 S.F. Chronicle/sfgate. It was a good review and well worth checking out. So I did yesterday.

I couldn't find the place, at first, because the outside sign wasn't up yet. It's located where an old corner Rexall Drug Store used to be. Spacious and airy inside. The manager was extremely nice and friendly.

Great lunch specials. Some of the prices were medium to high. I had the Razorback Platter (Memphis-style  pork ribs combo with beef brisket. The beef brisket was pulled meat, like done with pork, rather than sliced. Both were tasty.  I do wish the specials had 2 Fixins (sides) instead of one. Good selection of Fixins though. The potato salad I had was okay. I wish I would have tried one of the others. I love the cornbread. It was different, like it was baked in a grill pan. And moist with kernels of corn. I went for the dessert too. Only 3 of the 5 were available. The pecan pie I had was fine. I wish they had the Peach Betty.

Besides not all desserts being available, some meal items were also not available. They are new, only opened for a month, and hope they iron out the kinks. They do have a full service bar with LCD TV too. Am sure it's popular with the El Rio and Roccapulco crowds from across the street.

I would eat at Baby Blues again. But I do have a couple of other of my favorite S.F. BBQ's that I rate better. But Baby Blues was much needed in the Mission/Bernal neighborhoods where BBQ places are very, very few. It's in my neighborhood and convenient. During weekdays, not a prob to find metered parking along Mission Street.
author: Roger S.

description: Had Memphis Ribs and Brisket,   Ribs were way overcooked and tasteless even with added sauce, Brisket was pulled and overcooked also.  Cornbread tasted like it was 3 days old and was almost rancid tasting, only things good was spinach and slaw which was good but not cold ?  I would not go back there at all.
author: Sharon. L.

description: I super duper love this place. We had a long flight on Sunday that included a too-short layover in the Dallas-Fort Worth airport. While we were wheeling our bags over to the next gate at a full clip we passed a BBQ place with a line of Army cadets out the door and round the corner. There was no time to stop but the BBQ craving was planted. As soon as we landed in SFO I called in an order to Baby Blues. God it's delicious. I love my corn-on-the-cob grilled with blue cheese on top. Mac-n-Cheese - so rich and good. The Beef Brisket was just as good as I remembered it. Craving satisfied!
author: Kelly S.

description:
i said i'd give this place a second chance since the bf has heard great raves about the food, and he had not tried BB BBQ.  we came here on a saturday night, and had no problem getting a seat.  we shared the blue devil (4 meats and 3 fixings), and opted for shrimp, catfish, brisket and beef ribs.  the shrimp was a show stopper, so good we ordered 4 additional pieces.  it's grilled to perfection drizzled with a delicious light sauce.  the brisket and ribs were both tender and flavorful, but the catfish was rotten.  i'm not sure if it had perished, or if it was the way they grilled it, but either way it was minging.  we tossed the fish to the side, to say the least.  had it not been for the fish, i'd rate the place  4 stars.  for our sides we had the okra and mac n' cheese which were both great, as was the coleslaw.

i thought i would not give this place another shot due to my previous take-away experience, but i'm glad that i did.  i definitely had a different and pleasant experience dining in house.
author: Sheri N.

description:
A late friday meal, so we just got a taste of this place (beef briskets and catfish).  The service was attentive and friendly.  I do appreciate a place that looks after your drink levels (definitely a plus).  They were able to accommodate 6 peeps pretty easily, but by 9pm (closes at 10pm), the place was at the tail end of the night.  That said, we're going back to try the messier things on the menu.  And, while they cater and do huge bags of meat, I would recommend trying the sit down before ordering a hefty side of beef or pig.  Although when you need that for a party, why not right?
btw: nice flat screens for the sports peeps, a few regular on-taps. Also, great photo opt in front with neon signs shouting 'DRUGS BBQ"!!!
More to come on this review later.
Eat here!
author: felix c.

description:
What's a girl gotta do to get some decent BBQ in this city? 

Baby Blues was just ok. I got a lunch special called "The Razorback", which had 1/2 rack baby back ribs, a pile of pulled pork, cornbread and a choice of a side. The pulled pork was definitely the star of the show in that it was very tender and juicy, but it was bland (close, but no cigar). The ribs were tough, chewy and under seasoned. I'm very particular about my ribs. I like them to fall off the bone. These were far from that. They could also have used some more flavor. The coleslaw I got as my side could have used something... I can't quite put my finger on. Perhaps a little onion, or a dab of horseradish, just something to give it a little oomph. 

Did I mention the steep prices?

So, all in all, Baby Blues missed the mark.
author: Liz R.

description:
Their meat is nothing to write home about, I'm afraid... tends to be a little dry and over-cooked... but, and this is their redeeming quality, their sides?  A-Mazing.  The collareds and the creamed spinach are my two favorites, and their cornbread is moist and delicious.  

It seems like their dessert offerings change pretty often, but when it is available, I highly recommend the Banana Pudding.  Light and creamy, tt's a slice of heaven, complete with Nilla Wafers on the bottom!
author: Tod G.

description:
BBQ DELIVERED to your DOOR. There are maybe only a few things more conducive to being a happy, lazy fatty.

Had the Memphis Queen (1/2 baby back ribs, 1/2 memphis ribs), both styles were smoky, flavorful, and moist. Also tried a 1/2 pound of the pulled pork (eh, weird flavor?), and 1/2 pound of the brisket (delicious, vinegary taste). The beans and cornbread were great too.

The food is pretty darn good, you can pay by credit card on the phone....and you can eat it wearing sweat pants at home!
author: Carolyn F.

description:
Baby Blues BBQ was mediocre. We ordered Memphis and Baby Back Ribs. Both were charred to the extent that each bite tasted of char and not meat. Beneath the layers of char was some tender meat but getting at it meant losing a key component of the ribs - the skin and crust. We ordered Mac n Cheese, Creamed Spinach, and the Cornbread for our sides. All were okay but again, mediocre.

On the other hand, the service was spectacular and my friend and I both remarked how genuinely (i.e. not forced) friendly, good-natured and outgoing our hostess was. We enjoyed our evening there and by the time we left the place was packed full of people waiting to find somewhere to sit.
author: Shimone S.

description:
Food was great! The portions were just right- everything from the side dishes to your entree. The portions left you more than satisfied without leaving anything extra to have to take home. Meat pieces were awesome, I had the brisket, link, and pulled pork plate- there were no fatty pieces (I'm a stickler about those), no cartilage, just all tender meat - and at a great price! The mac and cheese was to die for, so was the mashed sweet potatoes and pork and beans. The corn bread was pretty goood; not the best I've tried but up there. Had a little bit of crisp to it and wasn't toooo sweet.

All in all, the food was awesome. The reason for the 3 stars? Mediocre service (I'm a stickler about that too). Our waiter wasn't very warm; he made me scared to ask for anything in fear that I might make him do tooo much. He only checked on my table once; we waited a while to get drink refills; only one-word answers (despite my politeness) maybe a last minute fill-in for someone?
author: kassandra t.

description:
The place had some real potential, but they have some real issues to work out and they are a little expensive for what you get.

First the pluses
1) Cool funky neighbourhood
2) Converted drugstore (even kept the sign)
3) Sides were pretty good (okra was a bit salty but yummy. Chicken smoked rice was good and you got a full cob of corn, not a half).

Now the minuses
1) Place was pretty expensive for what you got. The Beef Rib with 2 sides is 22 bucks and that's for one rib! It's a big rib, but still just one.
2) Brisket was shredded, smothered in sauce and looked like pulled pork (brisket should be solid and done in a dry rub)
3) As there was no cornbread, we were told we were going to be given a free dessert. After ordering said dessert and getting the check, I noticed it was added to the check. They did take it off after I mentioned it.

The problem is they are trying to skirt the fine line between hole in the wall and destination diner. You are better off going to a true hole in the wall BBQ place like The Rib Shack in San Bruno.
author: Anthony B.

description:
A good BBQ place needs time to break in, like a new pair of shoes.  Baby Blues BBQ is shiny and new on the one hand, full of excitement and anticipation when you enter, but on the other, it has kinks that need to be worked out still. There's a big common table, a counter, and a bunch of tables. Great for families and larger groups (if you don't mind the wait). The decor was a bit spartan, with a few art pieces over freshly painted walls. The staff was top-notch (very friendly, helpful, and working as fast as they can), though with the big crowd, it was noticeable that they haven't gotten into a rhythm yet. That being said, they are off to an impressive start, and I expect as things settle in, the place will only get better.

I had the baby back ribs, beef brisket, and blackened catfish. Sides included okra and mac and cheese. The highlight was the ribs. If you go, just get the ribs. The catfish didn't taste that fresh, and was a bit over-blackened, but again the ribs were great (did I mention the ribs?). The sides, were decent as well. Okra was cooked the right way (non-slimy), a bit on the over-salted-side, but the roasted tomato helped offset that. The mac and cheese wasn't that goopy stuff that some other restaurants have, but it was nicely baked. For dessert, we had the banana pudding. Now, that doesn't sound like the most fascinating of desserts, but it was damn good. Corn bread was superb as well.

Good beer and wine selection, as well as beverages such as sweet tea. If you enjoy spicy foods, ask for the XXX BBQ sauce (if it isn't at your table already). It's the bomb.

If I were to judge purely on food, decor, and price, I'd give 3 stars, but given that the ribs were great, that they put their heart into things, and that they've just opened, I think they deserve a solid 4 stars. 

I look forward to coming back, and trying out their other offerings. They certainly have the right idea, and with persistence, I'm hoping that I've witnessed the beginnings of a new San Francisco institution.
author: Boris C.

description: I had the Guinness Braised Brisket Platter and holy cow was it delicious!  They have an assortment of sauces on the table, and as yummy as those are, you just don't need them!  The cornbread was more than delicious and the corn on the cob with cheese and lime was a welcome surprise!  I would definitely eat here again and I'll take as many newbies with me as I can!
author: Tina B.

description:
Usually, eating "soul food" in San Francisco is like learning culture by riding It's A Small World-- it's got the right idea, but never the right execution.

I was pleasantly surprised by Baby Blues. Maybe it was because my expectations were so low, but the food had genuine flavor, good seasoning and a fairly large menu. Mind you, I only had one dish (the catfish plate), but I did enjoy it immensely.

They could work on the Peach Cobbler. It was soggy, and too sweet. But other than that, I would go back again....

 I'd just order the takeout, though. The bleached blonde waitresses offering me koolaid was really creepy.
author: Kay H.

description:
OK so I'm giving this place an initial four stars after my first visit.

I think they have great food, smells incredible, absolutely delicious. 

I had the Mason Dixon....half rack of ribs and a quarter chicken, with mac n cheese and creamed spinach.  I have to say the creamed spinach was WAY too salty, and it was more watery than creamy. It did taste good, just too much salt. 

The meat was excellent. The pork was just starting to fall off the bone and the chicken wasn't dried out like most BBQ places. 

Good atmosphere, though the tables are a bit small for BBQ eating, especially if you get sides and drinks. Doesn't leave much room. 


*update* I would have liked to have had some true BBQ grill smokey-ness and char lines on the meat. Just doesn't seem quite like BBQ without that....you know? 

Definitely have go go back here more often
author: Leo V.

description: Mediocre BBQ, but more importantly they have a very poor live music policy. I have seen some great musicians playing there and people were very appreciative. Unfortunately, the management, which pays very modestly for these groups, feel that they can cancel a performance at the last minute. Stand up for live music and support businesses that appreciate and respect professional musicians.
author: David P.

description:
Deeeelish! I had the pulled pork sandwich (terrific) with a side of beans (unspectacular) and my companion had the brisket (wish I'd ordered it, it was great) and cornbread. The lunch portions were more than generous. 

We came on the late-ish side (after 1) during the week for lunch and had no trouble getting a table, even though it was busy. Service was friendly. 

Did I mention we drank the Kool-aid? How can you not love a place that serves Kool-aid? Can't wait to go back and try the Suicide King!
author: Carole M.

description: This place is amazing!  I'm from the south, but I don't know that I would necessarily compare it to Memphis or Kansas City-style.  It's kinda in a class by it'self.  Is there a such thing as "San Francisco-style" BBQ?  Either way, it's pretty darn good food.  My hubby and I had the pulled pork sandwiches.  The bread was amazing and the meat was so tender, juicy and flavorful!  There's four different bottles of sauce on each table, each sauce made in house and it shows!  The salad was super fresh with a yummy shallot vinagerette, also tried their homeade lemonade, Free Refills.  We'll be back...
author: Erin R.

description:
This place was great. I ordered a full slab of baby back ribs ($20) a la carte and they were phenomenal. They were cooked and smoked in a thick dry rub seasoning and bbq sauce was provided at the table in squirt bottles, after a hefty dousing of spicy bbq sauce and ginger and garlic tabasco sauce it was on! If you're into very saucy ribs this might not be for you, but even in a dry rub the ribs were very moist and fall off the bone. Definitely recommended. I ordered a side corn bread, but I wasn't a huge fan of it, it was a little moist and lacking in flavor. Also, the sweet tea i ordered was way too sweet, a little heavy handed with the sugar, it resembled corn syrup more than iced tea. 

But, all in all a rib joint should be rated on its ribs.. and if that's the case this place is definitely a winner.
author: Juan P.

description: congratulations! your food kept you with a descent star rating. Because your service sucked. In the two times ive been there i have not been treated as friendly as i would have liked. maybe they didn't like the color of my skin. i hope not because it is in the Mission district. Anyways the person who i assume was the owner sat us down but i had to get our menus because the lady, whom i assume was the owners wife forgot about us. Then the white couple next to us got served first.  maybe it was an over site. i hate to think that stuff exists. anyways so we finally got our order in and the beef brisket sandwich was one of the best ive had. my wife also loved her bbq chicken. the sides are bomb also. so as good as the food was i guess i will be returning for more. maybe with friendlier service next time. well just have to see!
author: Daniel C.

description:
We ordered a mix of pretty much everything. The ribs were a little dry and tough. The pulled pork and brisket were good and amazing when doused with the "XXX" sauce! Mac n' Cheese, rich and delicious. Baked beans, good. Mashed potatoes, nothing to brag about. Cornbread, thick and hearty. Service, attentive and attractive.

As picky as I'd like to be about my BBQ, I'm not sure any restaurant can capture that backyard, smoky, grilled taste. Nevertheless, Baby Blues is a good BBQ joint. I will be back.
author: S G.

description:
The food here was delicious! The ribs fell off the bone and the pulled pork was one of the best I have tried - juicy and flavorful. The bbq sauce sweet if you like that and the be careful of the hot sauce because it is hot hot hot!

The venue itself is nice and bright, and when we went they had a blue grass band playing. The only drawback is place is very busy and though we called to pick up our food, they didn't have it ready. But it's worth the wait.
author: Vanessa C.

description:
Nomnomnomnom!
I died and went to BBQ heaven. 

Really, No really...

I have tried nearly ALL BBQ joints in SF and I'm in love with this place. Best BBQ in Sf. (I live in Oakland now, & Phat Matt's BBQ is def the best BBQ in Oak. Diff recipe, diff vibe so you can't compare the two. Just love em both equally, like your children.)

Anyhow- eeEverything's delicious. Altho, I have yet to try everything.

What a great place, great vibe, decor, friendly/prompt service! So great. I came here twice in one week. First time w/a gang of co-workers. About 20 of us? More or less. Either way, there was TONS of food and TONS of leftovers. 2nd time, I HAD to take my 12 & 8 yr old. They grubbed hard. `Lil girl had BBQ sauce and mac n cheese all over her mouf & some made it's way onto her shirt, but she didn't care. In fact she just licked it off her shirt. No sauce goes to waste! My son was so quiet when he was chowin down on em ribs, you know he was gettin down to business.  

I love the fact that ALL the BEERS on tap are ALL my FAVOURITE! But it kinda sucks because I kind of stopped drinking beer! haha.

Thank you Gramma and Grampa- I feel you have something to do with this place. Took me here as a little girl when you watched over me. Pickin' up your prescriptions & buying me candy from this place that was once a drugstore, in the area of SF where I was born and raised. And now it's a BBQ joint that I love! How freakin-frackin cool is that!? :))
author: Sheila S.

description: Definitely the place to be. If you are around the Mission by Precita you definitely have to check this place out. The food is great, the flavor and you definitely know the food was made by a great cook who enjoys and has a passion of cooking. The customer service was great and I love how it's a family owned business and workers are family oriented. If you like sandwiches just like I do then try the Tommy Johns burger it's well done and good. I highly recommend this to anybody who's around or even visiting San Francisco.
author: Jose R.

description: Good ribs (they could be more tender and juicier), and great cornbread (corny and buttery). Wonderful fresh lemonade (it's the real thing...) and yummy banana pudding. The food here is comforting, and the the sassy molassy barbeque sauce rocks my socks. Also, try the shrimp po'boy. Great atmosphere, relaxed dining, and solid food. Try the fantastic macaroni and cheese, creamed spinach, and definitely the cornbread. Pulled pork is REALLY great, as are both the pork and beef ribs.
author: Y K.

description: We chose Baby Blues to cater our wedding in Novato after trying several different BBQ places in the Bay Area. Paul was great to work with: he just exudes positive energy and had such enthusiasm for our event. The food is delicious - so many guests have just raved to us about how memorable our BBQ picnic lunch was. Just to mention a few specifics, the potato salad is amazing (we ran out!), I love how the baked beans have a kick to them that make it almost like a chili (great for our vegetarian guests), the ciabatta buns for the sandwiches are one of those little things that are easy to overlook, but they are so tasty and stand up to BBQ meat (soaked through buns and weddings do not mix!). We've stopped by since and we love the laid-back feel of the restaurant. I love that we can relive a part of our wedding so easily!
author: Greenballoon X.

description:
So as many other birthed Southern folk, Texas, I had yet to find BBQ worthy in SF since I moved here in 2006.  I stumbled across this place while waiting to meet someone at the bar El Rio, strategically seated across the street.

I was eager to try their brisket or ribs as those are the main things to screw up if you're doing legitimate BBQ to go in my mouth.  They were out, as they order so much fresh meat per day...  so I had the BBQ Chicken Sandwich on what seemed like a freshly homemade toasted Kaiser-esque BUN with grilled onions & the best West Coast BBQ sauce that I've ever tasted to date --- the XXX Hot BBQ sauce is of the owner's, Scott, homemade recipes and is tastetastical!! 

The sauce is thick and made with 4 different peppers: Jabenero, Jalepeno, Pablano, and another unknown chili to make those super nice "on fire" lip tingles.

I'm moving to N.Berkeley, but I'll be coming back to SF proper for this place for sure.  I'm eager to find this places rival ----
author: Jake B.

description:
By far the BEST BBQ place in SF. No doubt. 

The meat was tender, almost falling off the bone & tasty. 

Sides- I had mac n cheese it was the BOMB. just enough cheese not too sweet and the serving size was plenty. 
I also had sweet potato mash...really fantastic. Not as sweet as other places but seasoned just enough. 

To drink I had a slammmin half lemonade/iced tea and it was also just delightful!!! 
Our service was on point, everyone was smiling. 

So if you like BBQ that is not over the top sweet and smothered in sauces, this is the place to go. 

If you mix the XXX spicy sauce and the plain BBQ sauce it's really good too!
author: Syd v.

description: Went here tonight for a CCSF playoffs win with my BF :)..... we usually go to Memphis Minis but I wanted something new. The place was cute on the inside and we got seated right away. However, we were not impressed with the food. I ordered the Texas Beef Rib with Chicken Smoked Rice and Mac n Cheese and my bf ordered the Pork Ribs and Shrimp with the same sides....sooooooooooooo lets start. The beef rib was huge and quite tasty but the sides were very very bad :( . The mac n cheese had a strange cheese after taste and the rice was very dry and not flavorful. Moreover, the corn bread was definitely reheated and luke warm boooo. the pork ribs were ok but needed more spices to them and the shrimp was grilled great and was flavorful. I also must add that they DO NOT HAVE FRIES, which made my man very sad and disappointed lol....it was ok, but i wouldn't come back. sorry.
author: marina g.

description:
I've had 2 experiences with Baby Blues and do not recommend it. Mainly for its lack of good service.

First time was takeout. We ordered the catfish with 2 sides and the pulled pork with 2 sides. The service was very slow even though the restaurant was only about 25% full. We finally did get our order and took it home to find that one of orders was missing cornbread. Disappointing because the cornbread is tasty! The rest of the food was good but darn, we missed that cornbread!

Second time we ordered delivery.  My boyfriend clearly gave our phone number, address and credit card number. The clerk said the food would arrive in 45 minutes. Almost 90 minutes later and no food. We never got a phone call or a doorbell ring.  No food!

So the boyfriend called Baby Blues and asked about our order. The clerk told him, "Oh, the driver went to your address and called your number but nobody picked up. The delivery guy came back with the food." The boyfriend says, "We have a doorbell and it was never rung." The clerk reads back our phone number - it is off by 1 digit. He cannot explain why the delivery clerk never rang the doorbell though.

The clerk offers to have the cooks refire the food for another delivery, but we don't want to eat an hour later, we wanted to eat at the latest 30 minutes earlier.

So the boyfriend tells the clerk, please cancel the order and cancel the charges on the credit card. I call back to confirm that the credit card charge will be canceled and the clerk says, "Yeah, I'm just about to do that."

Well, now it is FIVE days later and still no credit on the charge card. The boyfriend calls Baby Blues and they say, "It's going to take another day to figure out."

Funny how the clerk got the credit card number correct and not the phone number... sigh.

Conclusion: The food may be adequate, but the service is awful. If you dare call for delivery, please pay by cash. Better yet, find somewhere else to eat.
author: priya t.

description:
Baby back ribs were great. 
Chicken smoked rice was tasty.
Everything else we tried was meh to nope.

The food was really overpriced.
The service was WAY too slow. (this pissed me off)
eating there ended up being a painfully long drawn out affair
and the food was not worth the wait or the price tag.

They are trying to charge the prices of "Blue Plate" but fall far short with respect to food flavor, serving sizes, decor, and service.

Our server Paul (the owner?) and the ribs were the only thing that saved this place from a 1 star rating. I know they just opened but they need to hire some more staff and trim some of the BS from their prices.

I'd recommend George's at 24th if you are after some good BBQ.
Try Georges brisket it is the best.
author: Dave Y.

description: I see a lot of mixed reviews for here, but I can tell you my experience was the BEST and it is on my rader to visit Baby Blues every month when I am in town.   I ordered the Gator Bait,  and to tell you the truth it went totally against  what I would normally do at a BBQ spot.  The fillet of salmon was generous and the best salmon I have had in ages, extremely fresh.  The grilled shrimp was delicious!  I had the mac and cheese with the coleslaw and both did not miss the taste buds.  My boyfriend went with the Big Blue, choose 3,  Chicken, ribs, and brisket, beans and mac and cheese.  He took Michael our waiters advise and mixed a couple of the BBQ sauces,  not bad but not as much rave as about the food on his plate.  We topped off our gluttony off with the banana pudding , piled high with whip cream an vanilla cookies.  We could not eat another bite! I also want to add, Paul the owner came over and introduced himself, very pleasant and  Michael ( our waiter) took great care of us. We even gave Michael free rein to pick our wine and beer, no disappoint there.    Can't wait to go back and try something else on the menu!
author: Cindy B.

description: I love this place! Friendly staff, delicious food, great location. What else can a girl ask for?!?!
author: Seanna V.

description:
Really good Bar-Bee-Q !!

Memphis style ribs and Texas ribs are great.  Brisket is decent.  The barbecue shrimp are awesome.

Okra well cooked and not slimy at all.  The Greens are a bit more tomatoey than I like but still very good.  Corn bread is nice .. would be better with some jalapenos in it.

When we were there, they were still working on the place ... so the ambiance could be better.  But the service is good.  Friendly people and good food
author: J B.

description:
I was hesitant to try BBQ in SF because I regularly eat it when I visit my brother in Kansas City. It was a great tasting meal, but the sauces still don't compare to KC. I got the pulled pork plate with Okra, and Blues on the Cob. The corn was delicious with the cheese powder, but I have had it served this way at a few other restaurants around town. The pork was perfectly tender and wonderful. The highlight was, surprisingly, the okra. It was cooked to perfection, with stewed tomatoes, and a touch of garlic. My date was scared of okra, but I talked him into trying it, and he ended up eating most of it.
The corn bread was crumbly with bits of corn, different than many other places, but tasted more natural. No sweet butter or honey to go with it if that's your thing. 
We tried all the sauces. The tangy tabasco was my favorite. The sauce that was supposed to be very hot, wasn't to my palate, and it tasted a little bland. Then there was a sauce that was a little sweeter, also a little bland. I mixed the tabasco and the hot sauce, and that was my favorite combo for the pork. 
When my brother comes to visit me from KC, I won't take him here.
author: Merrilee T.

description:
it's finals time which means delivery for dinner!  my boyfriend and I ordered the burger, pulled pork, texas ribs, baked beans and chicken rice.

holy moly.  it was all soooo amazing. the flavor on the texas ribs is incredibly rich.  the pulled pork is juicy and so flavorful.  baked beans have a nice deep, spicy flavor.  the chicken rice is awesomeee. finally the burger - wow.  the bacon and blue cheese is cooked in the patty with some green onions and other flavors.  it was so juicy and had a great char flavor.  

I have nothing but amazing things to say about our meal tonight!! also, it seemed pricey at first, but we're going to have leftovers for a couple days!

the only reason I dock a star is bc we ate there once a few months back with a friend and it was just ok.  the ribs we had weren't anything nearly as amazing as the texas and I didn't love the mac n cheese.  

I will definitely be ordering some more - hopefully in the near future!!
author: Niki B.

description: I love the BBQ ribs and the spicy BBQ sauce.  The mash potatoes are awesome as are the corn and the biscuits.  The best part is they deliver!
author: Dana R.

description:
Went here last night for the first time and had the baby back ribs platter, with sides of okra and creamed spinach (and a corn muffin).

The ribs were amazing. Smoky and falling off the bone, crisp and juicy. There are three sauces to choose from: mild, hot, and a tabasco-ginger sauce. All of the sauces were great. The sides I chose were good, but I should have gotten the macaroni and cheese (really!) which my friend let me taste.

The only disappointment was the cornbread, which was not sweet enough and a little stale-tasting.

They also have a great beer selection, including my current fave Fat Tire, and Guinness on tap.
author: PF D.

description: Yum!!! Love the pitchers of beer with great bbq, great service and a kids play area. Wasn't so hot on the corn bread, but everything else was terrific.
author: Cl a.

description: Being from North Carolina I was skeptical for sure. When you grow up in the BBQ belt it's a pride thing.  But I must say there is "Real BBQ" in SF this place is off the hook!
author: b e.

description: I called in a take out order as a first time customer to Baby Blues. I ordered a simple pulled pork dish and a pulled pork sandwich. I was told 20 minutes to pickup. Twenty minutes later I arrived at the restaurant and received the worst service I ever experienced in the service industry. Needless to say, after being pretty much ignored for 30 minutes and my food not anywhere in sight, I left without ever receiving my dinner and wasting an hour of my life. I wasn't the only one disappointed. The restaurant was severely understaffed and most of the patrons looks pissed off.
author: deborah p.

description:
After two visits to Baby Blue, it's time to write a review. Usually I prefer to visit a place several times to draw conclusions, but hey here I am at the laptop with nothin to do...

Our first visit had mixed results.  Our party gave high praise to the 'fixins', which is what they call their $3.75 ea. sides, while the guys working the grill were obviously novices having burned two of four plates of ribs.

Two weeks later we found  what was probably their franchise broiler cook schooling the fellas on the grill. Both Memphis style pork ribs and baby backs came to us perfecto. They provide two types of bbq sauce at the table in squeeze bottles, regular and XXX. We all gave them good marks. 

Not being from the south or anything close to being a bbq officionado, just a boy with an appetite, I was well pleased with the ribs.

Our second visit found changes in the fixins, some good some bad. The potato salad which I absolutely adored, had gone south. My first bite was raw onion, bitter, sharp, unpleasant. Lots of skins in there  as well from the red potatoes. I remembered the sweetness of the first visit. The onion definitely overpowered the flavor profile.

The cornbread was different this time too. It was not as dense as our first visit, which I happened to like. The mac 'n cheese was different, this time very wet, the flavor needed some punch. Our first visit it really popped with a nice crust on the top which was missing.

Purist will not like the collard greens in a tomato sauce, but I loved it! Great flavor. Sweet Potato salad was excellent as well. I didn't reorder baked beans this time, however on the first visit I thought they didn't resemble anything like baked beans I had ever come across, which in and of its self is okay, however flavor was lacking in my opinion.

Don't miss desserts! Especially if you love banana pudding like I do! I savored every bite! The pecan pie was very tasty as well.

I was very happy to see Trumer ale on tap, which they serve in these cool, slender glasses, as well as Guiness. Guiness and BBQ...I like it!

Overall our party was very satisfied with our meals. The kitchen will work out the kinks I do believe and this place will continue to improve. Just please rinse those onions fellas before you put them in the potato salad!

I would be remise if I didn't mention the very good servers we have had. Very friendly and accomodating...all family members of the owner. We will definitely be going back when it's time for bbq.
author: Don H.

description:
So I never order BBQ chicken, ever.  It's always way too dry.  I winced a bit when my friend went for half a chicken.  To my great surprise, it was moist and delicious.  I'm impressed.  

My ribs were quite good, but the real highlight wasn't the meat; it was the sauces and the sides.  There were four available sauces; all good and all quite differently styled.  I'm sure there's something there for everyone (me, I would be very happy with three of them and perfectly OK with the fourth were it the only one there.)  The sides were also great.  Not huge portions (and not cheap), but the baked beans were smoky and perfectly cooked, and collards were equally good.
author: Andrew H.

description: Thought I try this place again and brought my hubbie. He ordered pull pork plate w/ cole slaw and baked beans. I ordered the brisket w/ collards and mac n cheese. We both thought the sides were better than the bbq meat itself. Brisket was dry and the pork was kinda bland. Service and decor was good, but other than that it was a mediocre dinner. Memphis Minnie's and Gorilla BBQ are a lot better.
author: Mauling W.

description: love it - hard to find good bbq in SF and this is definitely great. We go with kids and have a great time.
author: Fred A.

description:
A completely nondescript entrance - outside of the neon BBQ sign above the double glass doors, who would have thought?  but once you enter, the smell of bbq wafts wonderfully toward you.  We sat by the kitchen and my only complaint is that there must have been a back door open, because I was freezing.  But back to the food.  AMAZING.  the baby back ribs were so tender, they fell off the bone.  the taste of the dry rub permeated the meat.  SO good.  We had a full rack of baby back ribs and a pulled pork platter to share.  The fixins' we chose were cornbread, mac n cheese and baked beans.  All home made and all so tasty.  We finished our meal, again, homemade, peach cobbler.  the sweet tea (southern style) was not as sweet as they warn...delish!  
But even better than the food???  the service - absolutely thoughtful and genuine.  Can't get better than that!  Great food and GREAT service!
author: Sonia C.

description: We celebrated my husband's birthday at Baby Blues SF with 25+ of our friends. Excellent service, the food was very good and affordable, and the overall experience was great.
author: Lauren W.

description: I hail from the Eastern New Mexico / West Texas area.  I was just walking down the street, minding my own business when a waft of smoked beef kicked me into a nostalgic frenzy.  It was very easy to make a decision on what to eat that night.  I am very, very picky about my potato salad (one of my few family traditions) but the potato salad here quickly won my affection.  The house-concocted sauces also earn an A+.  Portions here are also very southern-sized, so couples with sane appetites should only order one plate of food to share.
author: Jesse M.

description:
This is a great solid BBQ restaurant, with great service and a great vibe.  The sides, ribs, and pulled pork are fantastic.  I've arrived there before with 14 people and they were able to accommodate us at their fantastic high table in the front window.  Those same 14 people split one of their smaller group feasts which ended up being a great value and even more food than we could eat.

But most importantly, a great story about their service:  a couple weeks ago I ordered some delivery which ended up being a bit late, as I learned, because the delivery guy's car broke down.  So instead, the guy who showed up with the order turned out to be the OWNER who hired a taxi to make deliveries.  He personally apologized for being so late (which wasn't really necessary) and handed over the grub free of charge (definitely not necessary).

That sort of service and classy behavior deserves to be reported on Yelp.  Done.
author: C G.

description: I love great BBQ and it seriously good here.  From the different hot and tangy sauces to smother on, or just eat the smokiness plain.  Since I first ate here, I've made a point to come back weekly for my BBQ cravings!
author: Medwin M.

description: A working class meal in a working class neighborhood. I am all for it. The Okra, ribs, and chicken were perfect. The catfish was a bit on the overdone side but the seasoning helped it out. Colorful staff with a great window view of the bustle of The Mission. Definitely a  place to start out before conducting a mission in The Mission.
author: Frank B.

description:
Amazing BBQ and Im sure they will get even better. Every single item is tasty and delcious and the corn bread is moist and so great and not dry at all. I LOVE the food and will go back very soon.

The only bad thing (right now-a week after they opened) is that they have a ton of junk on tables and chairs sitting in front of the window in site of diners:  It looks so ugly. Employee crap, jackets, bike helmuts, just an unsightly pile of crap that should be moved NOW.
author: N M.

description: Wow. This is becoming our new fav date place. The brisket is awesome, the sauces all great, the fixins are fantastic! Collard greens, spicy okra, chipotle buttered corn on the cob, beans, draft beers all served up by friendly Holly in a great venue with ample parking on a Sunday for sure.
author: Kit M.

description:
I made the mistake of buying two much. I was only able to eat 1/2 of what i ordered. I had 1/2 bbq, that was great. 

Not a fan of the collard greens, Im used to more vinegar with mine. 

Mac and cheese was ok. Not bad, but not great.  I definately will be back for lunch.
author: Michael T.

description:
Delicious local bbq place if you live in the mission or bernal (or anywhere in the city for that matter!)

The owner, Paul was super friendly and welcoming and the waitstaff was great. I had a 1/2 rack of ribs with blues on the cob and mac and cheese on the side. The portions were super generous that I had enough leftover for another meal. The sides i tasted were delicious - the two I ordered plus tasted my friends' mashed potatoes and beans. Although I'm not a huge meat eater, I thought the ribs were delicious and I loved the triple X hot sauce.

Not sure what all the negative reviews commenting on the wait are for - our food came out in a normal amount of time and was well worth it! Will definitely be coming back here whenever I'm craving a huge delicious plate of meat =)
author: Maggie K.

description:
Yes, I'm from the south. And yes, this BBQ is the real thing. 

I love this place- we've been there 4 times in the last 2 weeks.... 

Usually BBQ that you find on the west coast is honey/molasses based- which creates a sugary experience whether it's ribs or chicken. BB's has a nice vinegar based sauce (actually 3 types-) that complements the meats perfectly. 

And the sides... cornbread is good. Potato salad is better. Creamed spinach is delicious. The only side I wasn't crazy about was the collared greens. 

And on top of all that, this is a family run place with a good crew and a good guy running the joint. 

Check it out.
author: Will W.

description: The BBQ is pretty good. Plenty meat, however the sides are horrible. Mac in cheese, not very good, cornbread has a corncake/tomalito influence and it isn't good. Collard greens were just ok. go strictly for the BBQ. Bartender is amazing.
author: Bobby D G.

description: Finger licking goood!  That pretty much describes the ribs, brisket, chicken, and pulled pork at this joint.  I've been here several times for some real BBQ and have yet to be disappointed.  The ribs are juicy, flavorful, and come off the bone easily, while the brisket is very tasty and tender.  If you prefer white meat, opt for the moist chicken and delicious pulled pork.  For a kick, select from 4 satisfying sauces that will leave your taste buds jumping for joy (or screaming for water if you can't handle the XXX).  The sides are also good and have a very homemade appeal to them, especially the mac 'n cheese.  Wash everything down with unlimited ice tea and Kool Aid!  This spot is great for large parties and even has group menus.  You won't get the blues at Baby Blues!
author: Linda P.

description: This is complete crap. We were quoted 45 minutes and it has been over 2 hours. Barely even an apology when we called, just the excuse that they're running behind tonight. Shame on us because it's the second time this has happened. It would be faster to smoke your own meat or slow cook your own pulled pork than to order from this place. Not to mention the delivery guys are super sloppy and typically the food is falling out of the containers and leaking through the bag, if not cold, when it arrives. Save your time and your money (and grumbling bellies). This place is a hot mess. If it weren't for the lack of delivery options in this town we never would have re-ordered a second time. Definitely taking the number out of my phone so I don't make the mistake again.
author: Chelsea G.

description: I love coming here when I have a hankering for some good BBQ!  I like that it is in my neighborhood too!  I took a girlfriend of mine there who is originally from North Carolina to try their Carolina pulled pork.  She was impressed!  I had their sausage sandwich with hot pepper, mmmmmm.  It was good with just  the cole slaw, no room for additional sides or dessert!  May I suggest the ginger habenero sauce on the side to dip your food.  My mouth is watering just writing about this!
author: gayle w.

description: If the food wasn't so good I probably wouldn't come back because the service is just ... what's a good word for horrible? Actually, it was much better the first time I ate here when there were a few White men working rather than whoever was working earlier. (No comment)
author: Jonas T.

description:
I finally went inside!!! Aren't we excited? Yes? Okay, let's move on then, shall we?
I also, if you hadn't already noticed, added another star. The Man Candy and I took a cousin, and my almost 4 year old son, in for lunch a couple of weeks ago. I had already tasted the tastiness, so knew what I would be ordering. My son had already eaten and was expected to play quietly, which he actually did(pen in your purse ladies, there's aaaalways a napkin just waiting to be doodled on) Man Candy told cousin he should try the Jack Sandwich(Smoked Link and much, much more) which he did, and loved. Man Candy himself chose the Shrimp Po Boy.He says it "was okay"  and that "the Jack Sandwich is better"... I got my usual Brisket Platter with Mac &  Rice.Yes, TWO starches! It was yummy and actually quite a bit of food for one person.The restaurant was cute, it was a slow Monday early afternoon so it wasn't too busy.We got friendly and pretty quick service. I'm thinking.....yeah!
author: Ellice D.

description:
As far as BBQ goes. This is the best place in the Bay Area. I consider myself a "meat" man. I do a pretty good job of cooking meat, including BBQ. I've eaten at many places" Fynt's, Doug's, Everette and Jones. But, this is the best prepared and uses quality meats. Now I like rubs better than sauce but they specialize in multiple styles and seems to marry the two schools (rub and sauce). 

This ain't no fancy joint but the staff and preprietor are friendly and knowledgable. 

Not the cheapest
author: Spyral D.

description: Decided to give them another try, because, unfortunately, it is the only place near my work for that comfort food craving.  I ordered delivery.  I must say, awful.  Bland, dry pulled pork and cornbread,  undercooked cream of spinach.  I think the only thing I can eat there is the coleslaw!
author: Avi S.

description:
I was immediately turned off upon entry after some tall drunk douchebag who was out with "his boyz" made some patronizing remark to my girlfriend. I spent the rest of the evening conjuring up ways to stab him to death in the bathroom without anyone noticing, or at least punch him in the face and leave unscathed.

Unfortunately, Mr. Frat Boy left unharmed.

The ribs I had were rather tasty, but half of what my girlfriend ordered was cold (as in, not even luke warm). The warm food did taste pretty good, for what it's worth.

Not hating, but after everything that went on here and the douchebag clientele, I think I might just stick with the McRib.
author: Alexis C.

description:
3.5 stars (rounded up because I am at least happy to see a BBQ joint in my hood).

This place is decent - not great - but decent.

Atmosphere: Feels mostly like a BBQ joint should (no frills), but hedges it's bets with a flat screen TV that screams "Sports Bar", and the "Drugs" signs out front feel like a concession to all the Mission hipsters (despite having nothing to do with Baby Blues).  Played blues on the stereo, which was fitting - I would love to see them book some live blues on nights or weekends.

Food:  Let it be known that I can smoke a mean rack of ribs.  Naturally, I had the baby back ribs here with beans and slaw.  The ribs were tender, but not as juicy or smokey as they should ideally be.  There was no sign of the meat being pink (which occurs as the meat absorbs smoke during the que'ing process).  Also the sauce on the outside was chared.  This leads me to wonder if they just boiled or cooked the ribs in an oven (opposed to actually smoking them) and then slapped some sauce on it and warmed them up on a grill.  The beans and slaw were unique and pretty tastey.  Props for offering sweet tea and kool aid on the menu.

Overall not a bad place to get your BBQ fix.  I will go back.
author: M R.

description: We just happened to see this place while driving to another BBQ place in the Mission District. on Memorial Day.  Glad we ate there.  Service was good, good variety on the menu and the baby back ribs were outstanding.  They were falling-off-the-bone tender and were delicious even without adding one of four sauces on the table.  Good quality of meat, too----not very fatty. The baked beans were just average--- watery and lacked flavor. My husband had the sausage, pulled pork and rice.  I tasted the sausage and it was very, very good. We'll definitely go back.  It's replaced Everett and Jones as our favorite BBQ place in the area.
author: Andrea P.

description:
I'm not from the south, but I lived in North Carolina for a few years in which time I became a huge fan of Carolina BBQ and all the trimmings... Baby Blues doesn't really have Carolina Q, and you can tell they are still getting up on their feet over there, but this is a quick summary of my first impressions: 

Food = 3 stars. The pulled pork was super tender and juicy and a generous portion, but no real seasoning that I could taste, just straight up pork. There was a good sauce on the table, but I'm still in search of the vinegar-based sauce; I think it would be a great addition to this dish. The slaw was just right, not too mayo-y. They were out of mashed sweet potato, so i tried the mac and cheese- no slouch! Frankly, I don't expect gourmet mac and cheese from a BBQ joint (go to Blue Plate for that), this was just fine. The cornbread needs work - I recommend go simple and traditional, stick to salty and light (this slice was neither). My beau's side of mashed potatoes was quite good, and the okra was fabulous. I mean it - really, really good okra. Finished with banana pudding - really mostly whipped creamy, very few bananas. I'd beef up the banana next time around. and the nilla wafers. 

Atmosphere = 3 stars. Good music, good lighting. I like the open kitchen/grill area and the large wooden tables (are any family-style seating?) I think Baby Blues could probably go even more simple with the presentation - I don't need a candle on the table of my BBQ joint, and it's not that dark in there anyway. I do, however, need room on the small tables for all that food! 

Service = 4 stars. Baby Blues is still trying to figure out how to balance in-house orders with large delivery and take out orders, so we experienced a long (long) delay getting our food, similar to what some others have written about. But you know what? They recognized the problem, acknowledged it honestly, brought us our sides ahead of time upon request, and also gave us complimentary drinks and a dessert to thank us for our patience. More than one waitress came to apologize and see that we had what we needed. Very cool. 

We will definitely be back to check it out again in a few weeks after things have settled down and the service and kitchen get some more practice on their routine.
author: Melissa M.

description:
Best BBQ in SF.

UPDATE: Havent been there in a long time... don't know about this rating anymore. LOL
author: Kissandtel L.

description:
so ive been to the venice location and didnt even know there was one up here, randomly walked by it. 

a few pros and cons........pro: same mac and cheese as venice, con: it looked like there was one server for the entire packed restaurant, pro:baby backs were real good, con: the service was really annoying and slow.
author: J A.

description: Shrimp Po Boy is addictive!  I always get this with a side of the mashed sweet potatoes.  Yummy!  I saw someone order the corn after i finished my meal and I could barely keep myself from grabbing it from their hands.  Gotta try the corn next time.  Can't really tell you about the bbq items, but my husband seems to like them.
author: Ana V.

description:
Interactions with owners of restaurants usually always win me over.  Paul, the owner of the restaurant and the man behind the BBQ (didn't catch his name) made a point to come over and greet our party of 7 after we dined.  It was a very genuine greeting and he said that he felt satisfied seeing us all having a good time.

The atmosphere at Baby Blues BBQ was great--lots of thought went into planning the decor...down to the little blue candle holders (typically red at most places).  

My friend and I shared the "Blue Devil"--4 types of meats and 3 sides:

-Brisket: Tender but not as melt-in-your-mouth as other places I've had.
-Baby back ribs: It really is tough to compare to my Mom's baby back ribs--these were average.
-Beef rib: A little charred for my liking--found this more fatty than I'm used to.  But it was huge!
-Tiger prawns:  These were the highlight of the platter--shrimp were firm and large--really tasty and seasoned just right.
-Mac and Cheese: Nothing too amazing--probably because I was  comparing it to the mac n cheese I had the other night that a co-worker made for a holiday party.
-Sauteed okra:  This was surprisingly good!  I'm usually not a fan of okra in gumbo so didn't really know what to expect having it on it's own.  I would order this one again. :-)
-Beans:  A little too many other ingredients mixed in with this.  Just straight beans are how I like it.
-Cornbread: Hmm...a little too moist and almost pasty rather than bread-like.
-Sweet tea: Perfectly sweet but also still able to taste the tea.

Overall a good experience.  I expect a tad more out of the food next time.  They definitely know how to have a good party though--the live music was a nice touch.
author: Christopher W.

description:
Two Words - Yum Mee

I had the Texas beef rib and it was a decent size piece of meat that didn't weigh me down. Since it was my first time and I wanted both beef and pork, the owner placed a nice tasting of baby back pork ribs on my plate as well.  I don't get much okra here in SF so i love the sauteed okra. I didn't care much for the collard greens though.  The Chocolate kahlua cake was also moist and yummy, but if you like creamy pudding you will love the banana pudding.
author: Kyle T.

description:
their baby back ribs or their other ribs...um memphis?  i forget the actual name.  take the other ribs.  the baby back are meatier which was a surprise to me but the other ribs were done perfect.

why not ranked higher?  price and the sides were just okay.

they're nice people and if you like bbq go here...is it better than big nate's?  or armadillo willy's?  or roadside bbq?

well, bbq is all about the same at that point.  it comes down to price and how much you get.

they're all about the same.
author: Bing D.

description: 2.5 stars. Corner "drugs" bbq place in Bernal Heights. We tried the pulled pork, baby back ribs, beef brisket, mac n cheese, sweet potato, and corn bread. The pulled pork was super tender and juicy but i thought it lacked smokiness like Guerrilla and the ribs were smoky but dry and tough. The mac n cheese was heated too much since it curdled. The sweet potatoes had good flavor but a bit stringy. It was like my tongue had a condom and there wasnt any flavor...hardly touched my food :/. Next time we hope sneakys doesnt sell out!
author: Cammy H.

description: Great bbq place. We need more of these in the Bay Area!
author: Brian S.

description:
Food is decent.  Service and delivery is atrocious.

They routinely "forget" our delivery orders and when they do finally arrive -  sometimes more than an hour and half after ordering - the food is cold, or the order is partially filled. 

we live less than five minutes from the restaurant.  not sure why we keep giving them the benefit of the doubt.

it's not worth it any more. we'll drive 20 minutes and enjoy Nate's BBQ.
author: diggity d.

description:
I was really looking forward to dee-lish BBQ after planning for weeks for an afternoon outing of food and wine with coworkers, one of which kept bragging about this place. I'm sorry but I was sorely disappointed. I had read reviews by my fellow Yelpers and my gut told me to go there with caution. 

My coworkers and I each ordered a glass of wine as a treat after a long arduous week at work. One coworker got an extra treat when a fly landed in her wine. We had to flag down the waiter since he was too busy playing a board game at the bar to notice us. At least he gave her a full replacement glass of wine. I ordered the "Three Kings" platter hoping a sampling of 3 types of meat - the Memphis ribs, beef brisket, and chicken - would show me how good their BBQ was and have enough to bring home to my husband. Fortunately the chicken was juicy and tasty and the beef brisket was moist but needed sauce for some flavor. My biggest disappointment was the Memphis ribs. I know Memphis BBQ uses a dry rub, but that doesn't mean the BBQ is dry too! Not only was there little to no meat on my rib bones but the meat was as dry as a bone. It was completely inedible. One of my sides, the creamed spinach, was bland. The saving grace of the meal was the mashed potatoes, which were tasty. 

We also ordered banana pudding to round out the meal. Another big disappointment. I don't know why they called it "pudding" since it was merely a bowl of very thick and somewhat tasteless whipped cream with a few slices of banana. I tasted no pudding whatsoever. 

The biggest disappointment of the meal was how much I had to shell over for a mediocre/bad meal. I'm sorry but the meal wasn't worth the $44 I paid. I think next time I have a bad week at work and my coworkers need a reward I'll suggest we go to El Rio across the street for good drinks, free oysters and for a fraction of the cost!
author: Teresa Y.

description: Pretty good BBQ, and really great sides. The staff here is very friendly and very helpful. Got the pulled pork with roasted tomatoes, mac and cheese, and cornbread on the side. Wasn't the best pulled pork I've ever had, but still really good.
author: Peter J.

description: This place was pretty cool.  You wouldn't think you were looking at a BBQ place because it's a converted pharmacy or something but it adds to the charm.  The service was prompt and pretty good.  We got waaay too much food but luckily it was delicious so we had no problem taking it home.  The collard greens and the mac n cheese were chronic!  The pulled pork brisket and chicken were pretty dang good too!  Loved that they had wet naps at each table so it was there when we needed them.  I also liked their packaging....they give you containers for your sides, a box for your entree and a nice brown handled bag.  I will definitely come back for some more BBQ
author: Kirsten M.

description:
They get 5 stars from me, hands down. Guess I went on a good night.

We tried a bit of everything and nothing disappointed. The ribs, pulled pork, brisket, chicken, sides - everything was very good or excellent.

Service was with a smile too

Look folks, good BBQ does not require sauce and I did not use a drop. That's how good it was. Can't wait to go again
author: Robert v.

description:
Ok I read a write up on Daily candy about this place so i drove over to check it out.  I got there about 3ish ,but they were still setting up for business at 5. 
First of, the guys who own and run the place are F-ing great. They prepare some ribs and shrimp for me before they were ready to open. While I was waiting, they offered me a beer and great convo about the place and their backgrounds.
I was very impressed with the guys and what they want to do with the business. 

So when I got my food home, OMG!! The ribs were great, and the rice was awesome as well. 
Alot of the food on the menu was not ready yet , b/c of my early arrival, but I'm going back next weekend and I plan on trying everything I can. 

Please If you want good BBQ in San Francisco, GO TO BABY BLUES BBQ!  You will not be sorry.
author: Clarence S.

description:
We had this BBQ delivered a while back and it was really good. This time, however, it was just so so. 
After we were told that they no longer deliver to our area (we drove there in 10 min during rush hour) we sat down to what we thought would be delicious BBQ.  Sadly, it was not really worth the drive.  The ribs were dry, the corn bread  was greasy and tasted like vinegar, and the "baked beans" were a mixed kidney and white bean side dish that did not taste anything like what I have always called baked beans. The sides would have not have been such a big deal if the ribs had been scrumptious but they were not. I am not sure if there has been a switch in management but something has changed. 
I am sad to write this since we loved it the 1st time we ordered from here and were really looking forward to a saucy BBQ dinner!  It could be that they were having a bad night so I don't want to say they are not worth trying. This was just a bad experience for us.
author: susan h.

description:
The search for good BBQ in the Bay Area continues.  I've been craving ribs and hit this place up with a few friends recently.  We all agreed to order something different so we could share.  
I got the ribs, which were ok, overall.  They appear to be made with a dry rub and I'm a sauce girl.  The sauce options were good--sweet and tangy to hot.
My friend ordered the Texas rib, which was cooked perfectly and was absolutely delicious.
The memphis style ribs were just ok, as we found them to be a bit tough.
I am always excited for the sides in a BBQ joint.  Too bad this place really let me down.  The mac and cheese was mushy, as the pasta was waaaayyy overcooked.  It was also quite bland. The blues on the cob was 'blah' and I'm not sure the cob was cooked enough, as it was very hard to bite into.  But, the creamed spinach was absolutely delicious.
Good beer selection and cool ambiance.  Service was friendly and attentive, overall.
author: Jessica L.

description: Stopped in late afternoon with a great friend of mine from the neighborhood. A bit pricey, but as I told him, the best ribs I've ever had. Oh, and the sides, the sides! Couldn't be more pleased with my corn bread and mac-n-cheese. Both super fresh with their own character. The corn bread was sweet and solid like a muffin, but with well, corn in it. And the mac-n-cheese had thick rigatoni noodles with a mix of strong, crumbly, white and orange cheeses. So bomb! And the ribs, they were great. Great, great. Very personal service, and an awesome selection of brews.
author: Darryl W.

description: Pretty awesome food indeed. Good service. The only downside is that you leave the restaurant wreaking of the BBQ smell. It's like being at a camp fire. Depending on your agenda for the rest of the day/night this could be a good/bad thing. I had to go home and shower and ditch the clothes.
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
UGH!!! Their food is an insult to the art of BBQ!!! We wanted authentic BBQ, so we ordered a rack of baby back ribs, the pulled pork sandwich, greens, chicken smoked rice, cornbread, and the "pecan pie" to go. I don't know where to begin describing how disappointed I was with everything!  

The meat on both the ribs and the sandwich was not even cooked thoroughly! I mean I know its smoked and all so its supposed to be a little pink, but come on! This meat was sooo pink on the inside Rib meat is supposed to be fall-off-the-bone tender, but this meat was clingin on to the bone for dear life! We could not even finish our meal. 
The "chicken smoked rice" was undercooked, and TASTED EXACTLY LIKE ZATARANS BOXED RICE !!! It was waaay too salty and there was no chicken taste!! 
the greens were ruined with some nasty tomato sauce, and the corn bread tasted like cake. ewwww. the "pecan pie" was actually a nasty pecan bar with what tasted like WALNUTS on it. really? really? 5 dollars is a lot for some nasty pecan bar. 
We ended up throwing most of the food out.  Don't give this place your money. Big Nate's is better!!!
author: S M.

description:
Not enough BBQ sauce and small portion sides

If you don't mind to not have enough BBQ sauce, this is the place for you.  They use quality meat.  But that is not enough to give more than 3 starts for BBQ pit.  $3.50 coleslaw was tiny.   This place seems to run on the stingy side.  If you eat in, 40% of the money you spent is going to "ambiance".  I did take out.  So, I felt like I was cheated.
author: Miyako U.

description: I'm not a "BBQ God", but this is the best BBQ I've had in the city so far.  They make their own sauces, the meat is always great, and they're in a super-cool part of town.  Right across the street is El Rio, a nice hole-in-the-wall bar, and not too far away is 24th street with all its craziness.  This place is a consistent crowd-pleaser.
author: Mike R.

description:
The best barbecue I've had yet in SF, with the exception of the occasional good meal at Nate's.  This place is much, much better than Memphis M's in the lower Haight.  The chicken is about as meaty and moist as you can get in a bbq place.

Don't order on a Monday!  Well, we did once, and everything was overcooked and dry.  Maybe these were leftovers from the weekend?  

Also, what's with their delivery statement on their website that they deliver to locations within a 15 minute drive?  I work 5 minutes away, but somehow I'm out of the delivery range.  Don't believe everything you read (including yelp reviews!!!)!
author: Eddie K.

description: Ok...well I really tried to have some positive things to say about this place but I just can't bring myself to do it. First of all, we called and placed our order at 11:30 am...we are in the neighborhood and we did not get our food until 12:50pm...Needless to say, it was cold and the drinks were warm..Let's not forget to mention, THEY FORGOT THE BBQ SAUCE!!!! When we called to inform them of the situation, the young lady (didn't get her name) was very apologetic and resent a new order which wasn't any better, but they remembered the BBQ sauce.I have to applaud their effort in trying to "make it right",  but BABY BLUE BBQ just falls short in doing so......This is our first and last time experiencing this so-called "BBQ"...
author: Noree B.

description:
!!!!!!!
Yes yes yes yes yes!
This place keeps getting better and better.
I was here with my friends post B2B.  
Friend #1 ordered the beef brisket with a side of mac and cheese and potato salad.
Friend #2 ordered some variet of rib with a side of pork and beans and okra.
I ordered the Sidecar and a side order of the smoked hot link.
My sides were the mashed potatoes, the mac and cheese, the pork and beans, and the chicken smoked rice.
The mashed potatoes were delicious but could have used a sauce or gravy on top.
The mac and cheese = always delicious!
The pork and beans were pretty much the baked beans with a GENEROUS heaping pile of pulled pork on top.  This was soooo good!
The chicken smoked rice was damn tasty, especially when forked up with the pork and beans.
However, dammit, the smoked hot link was my favorite.  It was sweet and spicy!  I loved it.
We were waiting maybe 4-5 minutes, and the head chef guy sent over a plate of the grilled shrimp with some hot sauce and the catfish sauce and some limes.
THE SHRIMP IS SO GOOD!
It was juicy and tasted delicious.  I am definitely going to order the half catfish and shrimp platter next time I come here.
The head chef sent out the food because he said we would have to wait a little bit longer for our food, but then it came out directly after the shrimp!
And as usual, the staff here rocks.  Our waitress lady was very friendly and attentive.  Whoever hired these people did a fabulous job.
I shall return!
author: Meh M.

description:
When it comes to BBQ I think everyone has high expectations, because why open a BBQ joint if you won't do it right. So with that said, I start with 0 stars and they get earned from there.
Service: though it took the server a few minutes to come over to us, he promptly took our beer orders, got them too us quick and answered many questions about the menu. and got us more beers fast. worth a star.
Entrees: We had tiger prawns, memphis ribs, baby back ribs and beef brisket. The prawns were great, worth a star alone. the brisket was shredded, very moist. good taste, I can give it a star. And then there is the ribs. Both were very dry and burnt! and neither was anything near fall off the bone. I'm sorry, but you don't open a BBQ place where the ribs don't fall off the bone. Minus 3 stars, 2 for the ribs sucking and 1 for the lack of effort. Brings them back to 0 stars total.
Sides: we had the mac and cheese, okra, collards greens, corn bread and pork and beans. the mac and cheese was ok, nothing to write home about. the beans weren't thick enough to be baked beans, but the inclusion of pulled pork was a good touch. the okra was ok, and the collard greens were quite tasty. the corn bread had the texture of corn bread, but lacked the corn somehow. I give them 1 star for the sides. 
So for 1 star, I got the worst ribs i've ever had at a BBQ joint, good prawns, decent brisket and passable sides. and it all cost way too much, over $20 per platter. Honestly, they need to take a trip to Kansas City, Texas, Memphis and the Carolinas and try all over again.
author: Rich B.

description: The interior is really fun. The people are very friendly. I had dinner their with my daughter's and one was having a birthday. The owner and his daughters I think, brought us a BIG banana cream pie desert that was heavenly. Really nice touch. Delivery is really hard as the system they have is limited and the person can't hear you and your address. The beef brisket sandwich is really filling.
author: Mike F.

description: I had the pulled pork sandwich and tasted the bbq chicken.  Both were pretty good.  The bbq sauce is very chipotle, but pretty good.  This would be 4 stars, but it was a little pricey.  When you first open the menu there is a little sticker shock, but then i found the sandwiches were only about 8 bucks.  The lunch special was between 10-14 dollars i think.  I will try some different menu items next time i am in the area.
author: Aric W.

description: I've had the mac 'n cheese twice since my review and must give another star.  2nd time was the exactly the same.  Good consistency.  Not salty.  Crispy/Crunchy pieces from the baked crust on top.  The third time was amazing!   I still recommend adding a dash of salt and a pinch of pepper.  I'll admit that it's my favorite in the city.  I call it "black folks" mac 'n cheese and I'm quite sure there isn't a brotha or sister back there puttin' their foot in it(It's a saying, calmate!  A compliment.).  So amen and bless your heart whomever is throwin' down back there!  I'll definitely be going back.
author: Perry D.

description: My experience here was ok.  Nothing to write home about though.  I couldn't quite place what was wrong with my BBQ but now that I read the other reviews I realize that they are right, the meat tasted like it was grilled, not smoked....  Not sure what the deal is.  In my opinion the bbq sauce was really bad...and tasted like a steak sauce or Heinz 57, really sour, lots of vinegar.  Guess ill have to stick to the east bay if I want good BBQ!
author: Greg D.

description: Terrific!  I was there for the second time two weeks ago - and all three people I brought there raved - even one who is a trained chef and quite discriminating.  The service was very friendly without being over the top.  Food quality and price were very good. Loved the sauces!   We are looking forward to coming back.  Maybe tonight for take out!
author: Shelley J.

description: We like BBQ and have to depend on restaurants to get our fix b/c we can't properly make our own at home.  Bummer, but that motivates us to find good eats in the city!  Baby Blues BBQ is quite good-- meat is tender and tasty, and the beer on tap are some of my favorites (Fat Tire, Blue Moon).  I think what really makes this place good is their BBQ sauces; in my opinion, it's the best sauce I've tasted in the city so far.  If we're around the area again, we will definitely come back!
author: Tina C.

description:
came here with the fam bam (there was 6 of us) and as soon as we entered we were welcomed right away.

my girl and i shared the beef brisket with the yummy corn with parmesan cheese and lime! mac and cheese was soo creamy and moist...goodness all the way. and we even had left overs!

my cousins got ribs and chicken which they seemed to have enjoyed. i tried their oakra and beans with pork...all very good and comforting. 

the waitress was really nice and accommodating!
author: Kathleen J.

description:
Ok, let's get right into it.
The good, the bad and the ugly.

The good:  I had the BBQ Chicken sandwich and it was just great.  I loved the slaw on it. It wasn't a gross mayo puddle and it wasn't just chopped cabbage - it was just right.  The bread, um - yum.  The chicken was perfectly done with just the right amount of spice and zing.  I wanted to try the table top sauces but I didn't need them.  I also ordered a side of baked beans (there is no one on the planet that has had more than me).  They were so good!  Three different kinds of beans and so flavorful!

The bad:  Service.  They are trying but not organized at all.  So friendly and working hard but they really need to just get things in order.  All of the supplies they need to operate efficiently are just scattered everywhere and they are just running into each other.  I felt bad because it's such an easy fix.

The ugly:  My face when I realized I finished my whole plate clean.

To sum the place up - go if you are not in a hurry and want to enjoy good food in Bernal!
author: Foodie J.

description: I guess it does a good job at appealing to people never exposed to the real thing.  For San Francisco this place is OK; for serious BBQ connoisseurs this place  is 1 or 2 stars.  The BBQ is edible and I was very disappointed to find yet another unauthentic claim to great BBQ.  Unfortunately the sides don't make up for their lack of BBQ knowledge.  The collard greens were undercooked and cooked in a tomato base, the rice reminds me of Rice-A-Roni, and the okra doesn't come fried because the restaurant doesn't have a deep fryer. (what a shame)
author: maggie m.

description:
There are not enough good BBQ restaurants in SF. I work in the Ingleside District, and it was nice to see Baby Blues open up. This place is KILLER! I met the owner who is the nicest guy around. He treats his staff really well. I really wasn't sure what to order, so i asked him what he recommended. He himself was on lunch break, but he graciously stopped eating, and with a smile on his face said, "I got just the thing for you". 

5 minutes later he brought out a platter full of 5 different meats, several side dishes. The meat and ribs were amazing!!! 

My favorite side dishes were the mac and cheese (it has melted blue cheese in it) and the shrimp! It was amazing. 

After we chomped everything down, he brought us a dessert sampler. The key lime was amazing, as was the peach cobbler. My fav however was the banana pudding. it was to die for. 

Its a good atmosphere, great employees, great owner. I read a few other reviews, and how they said that the food took long, the orders were messed up... Guys! give them time, The restaurant just opened, and I'm sure they are going to have kinks, but boy the food makes up for it. 

Once they get up and running, i can see Baby Blues taking off!
author: tony c.

description:
OK this is my first Yelp review and I will be changing it after I eat there again.  I have been there twice so far and both times it was good.  I love good BBQ.

The first time was the night they opened and there was some fumbling about but nothing that would keep me from coming back.  I was on a real tight budget that night so I only ordered a 1/2 rack of baby back ribs and coleslaw  that I split with my wife, plus I wasn't very hungry to begin with.  The BBribs where just a little over cooked but still very good, I will order thoose again.  The coleslaw was terrible, like it was only half made and missing something.

The next time I went (this time for lunch) I had the Memphis style ribs, creamed spinich and more coleslaw.  The ribs where most excelent, had plenty of meat on them and were very tasty, the creamed spinich was different from any creamed spinich I have ever had before, but it was very good and left me wanting more.  The coleslaw was way better this time and I will order that again next time I go there, which will be soon as I work close by sometimes.

As for the decore of this new establishment, the small tables are a little bit to small and the place could use some better bar stools.  I like the way this place is set up, it's not your everyday hole in the wall boreing BBQ place and I am sure that as time goes by all of this will improve.
author: Big D.

description:
We went on a Thursday evening around 6:00pm , no problem getting a table but it was getting busy when we left.

BBQ was good.  Had the pulled pork app., baby backs and shrimp for entree.  Tasty sauces and pretty good sides (corn on the cob with cojita cheese and lime, creamed spinich).  My friend had the Beef Rib.  Now, this is not braised short ribs, but if you like braised short ribs and you like BBQ, get the Beef Rib.  Meaty, flavorful, and it has the characteristic that makes braised short ribs wonderful (look, you don't eat this on a daily basis so live it up once in awhile).  Service was attentive and the portions were good sized.  Expect prices consistent with other places in San Francisco and other BBQ establishments.
author: Peter S.

description:
Eight of us went to eat here a couple of nights ago and to our suprise, we were seated after only a short wait.  We ordered the Teaser Plate which was, as it says on the menu, enough for 8 people.   The restaurant was packed so it took a little time before we got our food but the owner came by our table and offered us a free round of drinks for the extra wait.  

All of us enjoyed the food very much.  The only gripe I have is that the four side dishes that came with the Teaser Plate were small (same size as the individual portions) and not enough to share by everyone in our group.  

I'm definitely going back for more!
author: Loyd L.

description: 6 of us went...sort of a reunion of friends, for my 40th.  The server suggested The Teaser, and thank you for that suggestion.  We are certainly a group of foodies, which is just an uppity way of saying that we are greedy mofos.  Perfect amount of food, with some to take home, and it was 110.00 bucks, sans tax and gratuity and drinks.  Great time there, great atmosphere, comfortable, no fonies.  I don't get the lack of stars, unless folks went at off times.  The food was delicious- sides like mac n cheese, smashed sweet potato, okra, spinach...damn good!  My Mac is still #1, but damn!  We are lucky to have this place just down the block.  Perfect to take the family out to and not be broken by it- this economy is trying.   Welcome to the neighborhood BB's.
author: Andre S.

description:
my favorite BBQ in the city!
the pulled pork, sweet mashed potatoes, and blues on the cob are heaven
the atmosphere is comfortable and friendly
every employee is happy, kind, and accommodating
highly recommend
author: Deka M.

description: I was a little nervous after reading the lukewarm reviews...but I tried Baby Blues for lunch today anyway. My collard greens were steaming hot and flavorful. I loved the bite of potato salad I stole from my friend...not too mayonaise-y and with a bite of mustard. And my pulled pork was awesome. Wait staff was friendly and service was just right. I don't crave BBQ  on a regular basis...I'm not from the South...but I thought Baby Blues was awfully tasty and I left with some for later.
author: Favorite G.
