description: Me and my buddy were in the mission ready to check out some hoops, it is march madness you know and we were both hungry, so it was between bbq or phat philly. He said he wasn't too impressed with phat philly so we decided to walk a bit further and it was worth it big time. I had the hound dog which is a lunch special. It had beef brisket which was perfectly cooked and a third rack memphis ribs which was fall off the bone so good, you get to pick a side and I chose sweet potato mash which went perfect with the meat. They also bring corn bread not my fav but okay to sop up some meat juices.  They have a nice selection of beers on tap $5 each, I think it should be $4 each but anyway I found a great bbq spot.
author: Chris D.

description: The food was delicious. I had the brisket, macaroni and cheese, sauteed okra, and collard greens. I was a little disappointed that they had run out of Banana Pudding, but I will definitely be back to try it.
author: Christiane R.

description: I remember Flints in it's glory and like the hot sauce at Nate's. I think this place trumps both of them. I had the links sandwich and my friend had the pulled pork. Both were huge and delicious. I also was impressed by the friendliness of the staff. I read some of these other reviews and, except for the delivery complaints, can't imagine why they wouldn't have sent their food back or questioned the staff. They were great. Give them another chance. I plan to do so regularly.
author: Ken B.

description:
the one in LA is better.  better ambiance, better food, better vibe.

This one just feels so ordinary.  The service was prompt but unfriendly.  The server was unable to answer basic questions... 

The food was still good, but without all the commotion and bustle it just tasted blah.
author: Ambere S.

description: The most delicious bbq sandwich i've ever tasted.   Simply mouth watering.  Owner is super friendly and will bend over backwards to make it a awesome experience.  Excellent food, price and service.
author: Glenn B.

description: Good maybe even great bbq, at least for SF. Pros: very tender pulled pork, good traditional sides like okra (a bit mushy, but okra is tough to do right), and good collards. They get it - you can add your own sauces which lets you regulate the regionality and strength of your own BBQ favorings. Great to have in the area! Conclusion: if you want some twang on you tongue, it sure beats Nate's and the also rans like that place on Divisidero - hands down.
author: brian s.

description: I went to have lunch here yesterday with a friend and had wonderful service.  They restaurant was almost at capacity, however the service was attentive and quick.  I think they worked out and are still improving the restaurant-start-up kinks that most restaurants experience.   We had the ribs and brisket with a side order of collard greens and mac&cheese.  All was excellent....  I would definitely return.
author: michele g.

description:
When I heard that A BBQ joint was opening right down the hill from my house, No one could have been happier than me.
Then I found out it was the sister store of A barbecue joint I had recently seen on the Food Net work down in L.A.
So to say I was excited was an understatement.
I live for BBQ!
I barbecue at my house ever chance I get, I own 1 grill & A big ass smoker.
So I can't tell you how disappointed I was after eating there.
I even gave it more opportunities than most would.
I went not twice, not three but 4 TIMES!!
Some would say I'm foolish spending money on food that wasn't good, I'm just trying to illustrate how much I wanted it to be good.
I've tried, the chicken, the shrimp & the ribs, Oh the ribs.
The sides were adequate(nothing that blew my socks off)but if the meats sucks, what's the point.
Ribs for me are paramount & each time they were burnt.
The 3rd time I was there I actually left ribs on my plate! 
Which I NEVER do & my momma would slap me if she knew I wasted food!

Sorry for what I'm about to say I truly believe this may be part of the problem.
Let me preface by saying I love my Latino brothers, but they DON'T KNOW HOW TO MAKE BBQ!!!
They did not grow up smelling it, eating it & especially cooking it. 
That's not A racist comment it's A fact.
I truly believe that BBQ is kind of A culture & w/o growing up w/it, how are you to know what it's supposed to taste like & cook it properly?
I had A temporary glimmer of hope when one night I passed by & their was A "Brutha" behind the grill & he looked to be training the guys on the grill. 
So it was then I decided to give them the 4th try.
Nothing but A big fat let down.
Why not go on Craig's list in Memphis or KC advertise for A pittmaster, fly him out for A couple of months & train the staff properly?
As for the sauce, what the hell is that supposed to be?
It does not smell or even begin to remind me of BBQ.
I never advocate the use of store bought BBQ sauces but, most anything on the shelf at Safeway is better than that stuff they put on their tables.
As for the people that gave the 5 stars, I'd venture to guess they have never been to the South or Kansas City & especially Memphis.
There's no way you could say that it's good if you had real BBQ.
There is absolutely NO comparison, none what so ever!
The bay area is so starved for good Que,we really don't know what good Que is. 
So when someone cooks some meat over A grill we here in the Bay think "Its Awesome!"
Example; If you think Big Nate's is good...get on A plane to Memphis, quick.
I was in Georgia not too long ago & believe me even the "Chain-iest" BBQ restaurant is 10xs better than ANYTHING in the city.
What really blows is that I have to pass by this place almost everyday & I'll always wanna go in, then I'll have to stop & remind myself, Naaaw don't do it
I'm So bummed.

P.S. The reviewer that said there was no BBQ smell.
In the restaurants defense, these days bay area air quality management(the same idiots that brought us "spare the air" days/nights)Require new restaurants to install smoke arrestors & to cook w/wood pellets.
Yuk! So there will be NO smoke here or any other BBQ restaurants from now on.
author: Dominoe D. C.

description:
It's not BBQ!
I am from the South and was looking forward to some place in my part of town finally doing proper BBQ. I was also happy to see they deliver.
We went on a Friday night and were told the wait would be an hour. I thought that was quite strange - as I have been in literally hundreds of BBQ joints all over the country and never had to wait. Stand in line, maybe, but not actually wait. I mean, the meat is already cooked, right? It's not as if the waitperson has to send an order to the kitchen to cook. The only BBQ places I've been to that had wait people maybe had them to refill your iced tea or - on rare occasions - to take your order and bring it to the table. But the whole point of BBQ is that it starts smoking early in the morning and is all ready when the place opens - so waiting an hour was quite confusing. Oh well, we had movie tickets, so we left and thought we would try it again soon. So Sunday we were having friends over and we thought we would try the delivery. 
The food arrived and they had forgotten a few items. No biggie - new places always have kinks to work out. We called them and the super nice staff was very apologetic and promptly re-delivered the missing items. We had ordered the Baby Backs, brisket, and pulled pork with sides of beans, cole slaw, and mac and cheese. I was a bit leery because the meat didn't *smell* like BBQ. There was no spicy and smoky aroma. Yet I held out hope - thinking all that really mattered was the taste. This is where the trouble is - there is no taste. The meat is obviously cooked in an oven - not smoked. Thus it is NOT BBQ under any reasonable definition.
What a bummer. I thought with their "down-home" branding and image they would at least raise to the lowest common BBQ denominator of selling smoked meat. I know we're in San Francisco and most people here have never had real BBQ - but still! Yes, I was previously suspicious when I've passed by and saw no woodpile, no smokers, no smoke - nothing to indicate it was a BBQ joint - but I assumed they must smoke off-site somewhere and bring the meat in. WRONG. They cook it in ovens and finish the ribs on a gas grill.
Since it's not BBQ, not in cooking method or flavor - it's a bit pointless to review the meat. I will say the brisket by-the-pound was shredded - which as a BBQ aficionado - I've never had except in a sandwich. The pulled pork was lean and really flavorless. I mean, you do need some fat and you need it to be partly rendered out by slow smoking. That is just what BBQ is by definition. The ribs were OK - but I can make better oven-cooked ribs at home, if that's what I'm looking for.
The sides were very lackluster - the beans were a bland mixture of black beans, pinto beans, and a few others without the smoky-sweet-spicy taste of traditional BBQ beans. The mac and cheese just tasted of torn noodles and fat - not much cheese flavor and the advertised blue cheese was nowhere to be seen (or tasted.) The slaw was edible. The BBQ sauce was quite sweet and just lacked any soul or personality (which, I guess, is a perfect match to the meat.)
They have a very hip space, a really nice staff, and very reasonable prices for The City - but I just can't overlook the glaring fact that they're not selling BBQ. Thus the single star. One would think they might have visited Memphis, or Texas, or North Carolina to get a basic idea of what BBQ is before opening the place. Or at least stop in Lilly's on Divisadero (in my opinion still the best BBQ in San Francisco - though not top-notch.) Even Memphis Minnie's, which is sort of nuevo, lame, overpriced BBQ is much, much, much better.
Unless they start smoking meat, I give them 6 months. Maybe I'm wrong and the hipster vibe, location, and basic lack of BBQ knowledge in San Francisco will somehow pull them through - but I doubt it.
author: David C.

description: I really enjoyed my experience walking in during Lunch, I could sit at the bar, order my drink, I had the Lunch Special, Brisket w/ a side of Mac & Cheese.  Food came out right away, service was quick to all my needs.  I would definitely recommend it to a friend all the time.  Next time though instead of baseball on the tube we have to watch soccer.  j/k...
author: Tony A.

description:
This is a review written by someone who has been in the restaurant business for over 30 years, so please, bear with me here. Opening a new business is incredibly difficult, especially a restaurant. I know, I've helped open more than 8, including the Slanted Door, twice (Brannan and Ferry Building). It used to be that when a restaurant opened, they would have MONTHS before word got around about the new kid on the block, literally months. They'd have time to work out the kinks; service, ordering systems, how much food to order, etc... By the time word began to spread, they'd have had time to get their sh*t together and would be ready for their "hope full" success. Those days are long gone, thanks to the web, food blogs, yelp, eater-sf and the like. Folks are at your door minutes after you open, not months. The grace period to work out your kinks is GONE. And the whiny children and their whiny reviews on Yelp are all the proof you need that it's true. An additional problem with all these supposed-pundits and their ilk, is that now the mainstream press; Chronicle, SF Gate, Guardian, etc, now feel pressured to review new openings much sooner than the previous 3 month wait they used to observe. The upshot? Great new places that earn well deserved praise for their food can get crushed by the instant popularity and experience their growing pains in the space of days rather than months. 
My advice, ignore the spoiled children who didn't get their food immediately. Yes, the ones not mature enough to look around and see that the place was overwhelmed and that maybe they should give the place a break and come back some other time? I'd bet anything that they're never opened anything more than a menu, let alone a real business. I'd love to know what they have contributed to their neighborhoods, besides childish bile...

P.S. The food is rockin! Welcome to the hood gang.
author: Bill L.

description:
So anyone who is dissing this place before it has even fully opened is just mean-spirited.  They will be open soon for regular business soon, and then you can judge them on what they have or how fast they serve you or how yummy the food is.

I give five stars because I was at an early soon-to-be-open event and what I tasted was great.  Soft moist corn bread, fresh and diverse baked beans, great mashed potatoes (both kinds), terrific ribs and shrimp and super eager to please and friendly service.

So, ignore the negativity and be prepared for great BBQ in Bernal Heights when these guys finally get going.
author: K-Fa D.

description:
No delivery or take out at 7:00 on a Sat? WTF??? After looking at a menu for 20 minutes deciding what you want and getting into a I can't wait to eat ribs mode-and you ran out of food by 7:00? Shameful! This isn't your 1st weekend open. Hopefully your last won't be long. 

Maybe instead of posting pics of hot sauce they should put one of an empty plate.
author: nic d.

description: I live right near baby blues BBQ and have been here several times as its close by and I love bbq.  Tonight, however was the worst of several mediocre occasions.  I keep trying to give Baby Blues another chance, but each time, am disappointed.  The food is good. Very good, however the service leaves so much to be desired that the overall experience makes it not worth it.  Tonight, my boyfriend and I had to each go up in alternating turns to get every aspect of service needed.  First, they didn't refill our water. Then my boyfriend had to go up to request a beer even though they dropped the beer menu 15 minutes earlier. Then we had to ask for silverware.  I asked for a drink menu and never got one. Had to go up for one myself.  Then I had to go up and order a drink, of which never came.  It was one waitress and one dark haired guy who seemed to just stand there. Finally we were done with the meal and spent another 15 minutes staring him down for the check.  Finally, I went up and physically asked him for it, after which he said "sure"  and never sent it to us.  We were literally about to go up again when the blonde finally came over with it.  I have never had such appalling service. The food is so tasty but the service makes me never want to return.
author: julie r.

description: If you're thinking of going here, drive another mile (or take the bus) out to Geneva and go to the restaurant in the back of the Broken Record.  The Broken Record has phenomenal pulled pork on house-baked buns.  This is what pulled pork should be.  Everything else is good too, which only points out how lame the food is at Baby Blues.
author: Spike S.

description:
I like this place, the ribs and chicken that I've had so far were great, and not dry at all. They need spicier sauces in my opinion, their sauces need some help over all, they aren't really smokey or spicy like they should be.

The sides do kind of trump the meats though, the mac and cheese   hmmmm, the collard greens and cole slaw are all exceptional.

The service is just OK, maybe not enough waiters for the amount of people that are there usually.   I had to get up twice to find a wait staff for water.
author: Molly M.

description:
I REALLY wanted to love this place. Its so close to my house and, growing up near one of the barbecue capitals of America, I am a huge fan of the stuff. However, I was sorely disappointed. 

I won't rate them on the service/atmosphere - which were not good - because they just opened. Those things will work themselves out, I'm sure. 

I will, however, rate them on the food - which was also not good. I ordered the combination plate - 3 meats, 2 sides and cornbread. I tried to order a sweetened tea and was told they didn't have tea yet ( no tea? I'm pretty sure that's just tea bags, sugar and water requiring no high tech piece of equipment), so water it was. 

Now, there are lots of different styles of barbecue - Texas, Kentucky, Memphis, The Carolinas etc. The one thing they all have in common is that rich, smokey, slow-cooked flavor. That flavor was nowhere to be found in the three meats I sampled. The best of the three where the baby back ribs, which were tender but mostly flavorless. My guess is they were mostly boiled and then seared (possibly lightly smoked) but had no barbecue flavor. The pulled pork was completely tasteless (where is that beautiful, almost burnt, caramelized skin you should see on any well barbecued meat?)and the brisket (which was pulled) tasted like it had been sitting in water to keep it moist. It was by far the worst of the three. Every good BBQ cook knows that if you have to slather it in sauce to be edible, you've got problems. 
The sides went from nondescript and undercooked (collard greens) to strange (black, pinto and kidney?) and tasteless (Baked beans). The corn bread was like no other I've ever tasted (either made with white or yellow cornmeal) and not in a good way. 
Having said all that, I might actually have given the place another shot...if it wasn't so crazy expensive. The exact same amount of food (and better quality, I might add) can be had at any number of barbecue restaurants in the city for around $16.95. The total for the "Big Blue" was $25.95. If you are going to charge those prices - you should be able to back it up with quality. 

I hate giving a bad review - I mean, look at how few I've given - but this place needs to step it up. Until then - I have to say avoid it.
author: Jamie M.

description: I came here hoping to relive my awesome experience with the Baby Blues in LA, but boy was I wrong. All I gotta say is who the $%&*! eats pulled pork with ciabatta?! I don't care if this is supposed to be the smug San Franciscan's bbq joint, but booji bbq does not exist! Sweet tea was still good though!
author: Ray H.

description: this place will make a BBQ fan out of anyone who isn't.  The atmosphere is San Francisco mixed with excellent BBQ.  One of my favorite SF restaurants.  deserves 4.5 stars
author: Gregory E.

description: Every side dish is perfect!!! I especially love the corn on the cob with blue cheese and the okra.  The ribs are more than I can ask for!  They have their own specialty sauces that complement really well too!  Oh, and  an interesting thing to note is that the waitresses are really hot!
author: Amy H.

description: I know I seem like I give out the five-star reviews too often, but this place just opened like five minutes ago and I've been there a jillion times already. The brisket sandwich is an amazing treat, and everyone is super friendly and nice. So. Sorry. But I give them the five stars. Great place to hang out and rest between the walk down the hill and the walk back up.
author: Amy K.

description:
i'd say more like 2.5 stars...

first off, the pro's:
- 4 diff BBQ sauces, ranging from sweet to spicy... nice!
- decent quality napkins and wetnaps... no dingleberries on these hands!
- accommodates large and small groups (gets busy for sure though...)


everthing else:

it's BBQ, so it's not like it's going to be gross.  hell, you could put BBQ on a pigeon in the tenderloin and it wouldn't be half bad.

the ribs didn't fall off the bone at all.  it was more like corn-on-the-cob where you're just nawing at every little ounce.  the okra was a bland, and a little soggy, the cornbread was forgettable.

the mac and cheese was amazing like everyone says, but come on, put some tasty MEAT in my fat american belly!  to have good BBQ you've gotta perfect the meat first.

i wouldn't necessarily be opposed to coming here again, but i would definitely try out some other places first before doing so...
author: eric f.

description: My flatmate's boyfriend came over on a friday night with a delivery menu for Baby Blues BBQ. I'm not much of a bbq fan so I let my Southern flatmate decide what we were ordering. She ordered the Blue Devil (four meats and three sides) and some cornbread. The delivery arrived at the expected time. Food was hot and smelling good. We sat in peace while eating not to waste any of this deliciousness on small talk.  The food was good every container was scraped, the price seemed reasonable. I think I'm a bbq fan now.
author: Analise T.

description: I'm a pescatarian, but came here because my man is from Texas and had a hank'rn fer some BBQ.  Actually I've been here twice because the atmosphere is so friendly, it looks really cool, and my food was marvelous.  The shrimp po' boy was as good as could be- delicious pieces of giant shrimp with a nice sauce and fresh (non mayonnaisy) cole slaw on top.  I got a sizable side of sweet potatoes, which were good.  Another time I got four sides to be purely vegetarian- mac and cheese (yum!), mashed potatoes, okra, and creamed spinach.  The rice and collards are not vegetarian, but it is a decent place for vegetarians because the sides are so good.  The staff is very friendly and there are great things to sit upon.
author: Melissa W.

description:
After a spirited afternoon hanging at MANGO at El Rio, my group of six hungry dykes descended upon Blues in a cacophonous ravenous wave. We were greated by a cute freckled waitress & a massive fold out menu.
Dishes with names like "Gator Bait," "Lasker Burger," and "Blue Devil" baited our already watering mouths. As the one vegetarian in the group, I protested momentarily until I spied their "Side Car," any 4 side dishes served w/an order of corn bread. Side options included: Baked beans, sauteed okra, creamed spinach, collard greens and stewed tomatoes. I was sold. We ordered, drank our beers and waited expectantly.
It was around this time we got into a very loud conversation about all the men we've "known" (in the biblical sense) and all the large sets of balls that came with them! So many dykes, so many stories of men with large ball sacks!! When the food arrived, we continued with the tales of "ball games," and the woman at the table next to us giggled while delicately gnawing on her baby back ribs, "You guys are having just the BEST dinner conversation!" Blame it on the beer, the hunger or the bbq, but it was totally worth it and we are SO going back after the next Mango!
author: Shelley S.

description:
Baby Blues BBQ is now open as of 12/26/08. Too bad it doesn't really matter. I came here as soon as they opened so that I could try, yet again, to have great BBQ in the bay area. Yet again, I have failed. I don't know why it's impossible to cook and serve great smoked 'cue in this part of the country...but apparently it is.

The food was...average/not-so-great. The pulled pork was a lame attempt at north carolina-style 'cue that came out sweet, yet bland. The vinegar-type sauce they provided fell short of rescuing it. The brisket was...NOT EVEN BRISKET. It was like "pulled beef" or something. They advertised texas brisket and it's not even sliced, true-blue brisket in any sense. It was actually kinda tasty, but who cares...it's not brisket! The XXX hot sauce was not mind-blowing hot, nor was it anything more than a limited imitation of Texas Peet's hot sauce. Lastly, we had the baby back ribs. These were actually good. The only redeeming part of the meal. Go for these ribs, and don't bother with anything else. The ribs were actually great. Pricey for the Mission, but great.

Now...the service. I don't usually write about the service at any place where a meal is less than $20. I don't really care in these situations. But Baby Blues made me care. So here I am writing about it. We waited 10 minutes to get anybodys attention. We couldn't sit because they hadn't bussed the tables that were empty. Once we sat, we didn't get a menu for another 10 minutes, and couldn't order for an additional 20 minutes. That's 40 minutes BEFORE ordering. The food came 30 minutes after that. It's BBQ! It should have been smoked hours ago...an order of BBQ does not require more than 5 minutes to put on the plate and possibly heat a little bit. This was ridiculous. So....70 minutes in, the food arrived. We ate, and then it took them another 30 minutes post-meal to bring us our bill. This is just unacceptable, particularly on a Saturday night. I am the most lenient person when it comes to service, but this was outta line.

Now, I know, they just opened. Our server said as much several times (nice guy too). But still, the pure time and negligence was so bad, they shouldn't have opened under those conditions.

Lastly, the decor here was not thought-out at all. The interior looks like it supposed to be a bit up-scale, much more than your typical BBQ joint. Clean lines and walls, limited decoration. But...it was just bad. The colors were a mute grey-blue, very bleak. The lighting was white fluorescent. All bad...a BBQ place should be down-home and inviting, with warm feelings and colors, like wood and cowhide and lanterns or something. Or maybe a checkered tablecloth. Whatever. As a down-home place, it failed. As an up-scale place, they would have to hire an interior decorator. The wall-sized windows also don't work...you only want windows like that if you have something to look at. All you see here is a Kragen Auto Parts and the ghettoness of the Mission/Bernal heights stretch. Not an inviting vista.

So to sum it up, average food (except the ribs), unacceptable service, and terrible  atmosphere/decor. Not worth it. Again, a bay area BBQ failure.
author: Tolga E.

description: I loved this place! This is so much better than Nates- which has dry meat and stale bread...I loved the sauces, and the XXX sauce was nice n spicy. The sweet potatos, collard greens and spinach were great, and it was fun to drink Kool-Aid (the waitress called it "red flavor"). The ribs were good, and the beef brisket was juicier than much I've had in the city, with good flavor. The staff were friendly to boot. I am definitely coming back.
author: Nick M.

description: Don't order the full dishes it's just way too much food.  Order the beef brisket and the pulled pork by the pound.  Make sure you get the AWESOME mashed potatoes.  The owner was really cool and gave us free pie that another customer had brought in.
author: Jason S.

description: Went back tonight with a couple of friends.  Everyone loved it.  Including my friend from Georgia.  And on Tuesdays they have a honky tonk band.  Lots of great food and fun.
author: kevin c.

description: The mac-n-cheese is phenomenal!!! It's got like 4 different cheeses in it. I had a beef brisket sandwich for lunch and it was great! Cornbread was also yummy! People were friendly, atmosphere is cool, and I hear it gets even better at night.  Like 6 beers on tap which is cool and good wines on the list as well. The Bell Syrah is an amazing bottle of wine ;) Good place; try it!!!
author: Courtney M.

description:
I'm supposed to be on a diet. 
I promised myself this ENTIRE week that I wasn't going to go on my food craving binges. On second thought, I should've signed a contract....

My boyfriend is a BBQ fanatic. And i don't really understand why since he is half salvadoran and half irish. the closest thing he comes to the south is his eating habits. i blame him for my failure to diet. My excuse: I am dancing my ass off in carnaval nobody wants to see a jiggly out there! (at least in my case)

So after trying out the "free" samples at the Safaway nearest you, he was craving ribs. and not just any ribs, BBQ ribs. and being the sucker that i am i couldn't deny the man his ribs. what if he dies craving ribs?That's what my mother always says every time she runs to buy Pan Lido down the street only to come home and hide it from my sweet toothed father. Anyway, a friend of mine had recommended this baby blues southern bbq place and all he said was follow the DRUG sign. so i did. I followed it with my nose to be exact. you can't really smell this place like I can smell Pete's BBQ from a mile away. Literally. But let me tell you, ALL OF YOU, this place went beyond my expectations. I am a drowner. I love to drown my food in sauces and condiments and anything that makes my bread soggy. And I love to drown my pork ribs with BBQ sauce. I didn't have to here. My memphis ribs came out perfect. no need to drench my ribs with the 4 sauce bottles they place at your table. and the macarroni with the potato salad hit the spot! it's the closest to homeade southern BBQ i have ever tried (can you tell I have never dated a southern boy?). I was so stuffed I could barely walk out of the place. Good thing no one witnessed me licking my fingers non stop. The diet fairy would be so angry at me if she found out.....so shhh.
author: Brenda S.

description: Went with a group of friends, we got the "teaser" with 2x baby back ribs and a full bird. Amazing BBQ. It could easily fill 8 people. The banana pudding was an amazing way to finish the meal.
author: Soren M.

description:
In the past I would have given this place 4-5 stars, but things seem to be going off the rails a bit here: some of the (normally moist) cornbread seemed dry and a touch stale, the service was a bit off - but what was most distracting and unappealing were the bugs flying around the place.  Very difficult to enjoy the meal and the occasion with all the vermin flying about, landing on faces on food.  

I'll come back another time and see if this last meal of mine was merely a fluke.
author: yao y.

description:
Gave it one more try. Not much has changed. Service is ok. BBQ flavor and taste is non existent; the ribs and pulled pork taste like they are par boiled. The place does not even have the savory , slightly smokey smell of reall bbq joints. Do they even have a smoker ?
Sorry folks but this dog don't hunt.
author: Jeffrey G.

description:
I learned of this restaurant from the Examiner newspaper and let me tell you, the Examiner hit the nail on the head! This restaurant is delicious and a MUST re-visit. We went in on a busy Friday night. I ordered pulled pork with mashed sweet potatoes and mac and cheese. The mac and cheese was TO DIE FOR! Absolutely delicious! The sweet potato mash was tasty but i guess im just not really a fan of sweet potato mash. The pulled pork was amazing and juicy without any added BBQ sauce. My bf got the brisket which was surprising but good nevertheless. We were expecting sliced beef and got what looked like pulled pork, just beef. 

The restaurant brags about their XXL sauce which i found to be awful tasting. The regular BBQ sauce is much better. 

Also, the service was less than perfect! We were fine with a wait because we showed up at prime dinner time on a Friday night, however im not that cool with being quoted a time, and exceeding that time by a long shot. She told us 20 mins and said we can wander around the neighborhood and have her call us when our table is ready. Since it was only 20 mins, we decided to wait in the restraurant. Fast forward 45 minutes and we had barely gotten seated. Don't feel bad for us though; a large party of 9 was quoted 45 mins and ended up waiting over 2 hours! Also, our server was inpolite and never came to our table. 

The food was great. Unfortunately the service made me not want to visit tis restaurant again. Luckily for us though, they deliver!
author: Sarah I.

description: Man my brothers boss took us here back in april to this place. And I've never even noticed it (and I used to frequently visit NAPS BAR) but the cram spinach and the macaroni n cheese is off the hook. I had 2 servings of mac n cheese. The service was great too. I'm not a big BBQ person so I ordered a chicken sandwich and it was screaming.
author: Tareau B.

description: Huge portions, platters can be shared. BBQ is delicious... I LOVE the corn. mac n cheese is sadly meh.
author: Janine L.

description:
it's just ok....  since Left Coast Smoke came on the scene, i'd rather eat their pulled pork sandwiches anyday rather than Baby Blues....

the main selling point for Baby Blues now are the babyback ribs...  they are still pretty damned tasty
author: kevin w.

description: The sign out front says it all.  BBQ/ DRUGS.  The ribs, pork and beef, tender. The chicken is moist and flavorful.  The sides; baked beans, mac n cheese, collards, pork n beans, coleslaw...sublime.  For dessert the banana pudding is heaven.  Just tried the key lime pie, another winner.
author: Rob F.

description: Amazing collards and pork and beans and slaw and corn bread (almost like a corn pudding) and holy meaty goodness the que is right on and the food is yummy enough to make me write run on sentences.  It is a great space for groups of people as there are 2 communal tables.  The beef ribs were smokey slightly sweet and perfect with a dollop of extra sauce.  In fact I just continued eating well past sanity to try their 4 different homemade sauces with everything.  I've tried the brisket, pulled pork, and beef ribs and loved em all.
author: MJ C.

description: I kept hearing how great this place was so I decided to check it out. I have to admit I was not floored. I ordered the BBQ chicken sandwich and my gf ordered the pulled pork sandwich. I thought BBQ sandwiches were suppose to be dripping with BBQ sauce? The sauces they did have were ok. I wish they had more flavor. The best part of the meal was the blues on the cob and the mac & cheese.
author: Ursula R.

description:
i really wanted to like this place. well designed website, great decor, customer service and... it's BBQ for pete's sake. 

today was my second visit, and sadly, i won't be going back any time soon. my friend and i both had one of the lunch specials, which included pulled pork, a side of mac n' cheese and slaw. their mac n' cheese had good flavor, but was a little on the dry side. the pulled pork...meh. the meat was bland at best, and even adding a couple different types of sauce still didn't help my sammie. shortly after my friend and i left, intestinal battles broke out in both of our stomachs. for the record, we've never had... issues... with BBQ before today.

i will periodically check back on yelp and see if there are better reviews. until then, no more baby blues. sad.
author: Chris W.

description:
mainly excited about the praised mac n' cheese and cornbread, i had such high expectations for this place. to my astonishment, it all sucked pretty badly. i think we got an old batch of mac n' cheese and the cheese was all seperated and lumpy. the cornbread had an odd saltiness to it which was far from enjoyable for me. they ran out of the blues on the cob, so EFF that. the brisket was far from anything amazing. it was quite ordinary and seemed to just be a pulled beef. 

and i believe there was only one or two servers who were slow and ours forgot to bring my friend her sweet tea. i most definitely will not be back.
author: Regina C.

description: It's not everyday I give 5 stars but this one of those days. Let's just say, they hands down got the best BBQ in the entire bay area. Been there 4 times and each time was great, very consistent and the best thing is their BBQ isn't drowning in BBQ sauce. The staff is real friendly and the portions are always a surprise. I ordered the beef rib out curiosity and was given a giant piece of dinosaur trex meat, it was so big that I felt like a caveman. The sweet tea was great, but the hipsters that hijacked this isn't, they gotta stop serving PBR to keep those people away. Anyway, if you got 30 bucks and you're starving, then head over to baby blues, very very good stuff.
author: Jeffrey B.

description: I really like this place, the meat is excellent, you don't need to use the BBQ sauce unless you want to, the sauce is excellent also. The sides are interesting ... the only side I did not like was the creamed spinach it was a little too watery for me ... but oh my goodness the Memphis Style Ribs are Out Of This World Good
author: Joni C.

description:
Let me start by saying I really want this place to succeed and will try them a few more times before giving up but my first experience last night left a lot to be desired.   I waited a few weeks after opening to try this neighborhood restaurant for a couple reasons.  One is I like to give a new place some time to work out the opening bugs.  The other is signage - or lack thereof.  The restaurant has no exterior signage with the name of the place so I had no idea how to call in a take out order.  My friend Kurt and his boyfriends wound up going this past Tuesday and he brought me a menu yesterday so I knew I would call in an order on my way home.

My concern continued when I called in a pretty simple order (one whole chicken and three sides) and was told it would be 20 minutes.  OK - I can handle that even though I'd be passing by on my way from 24th St BART to home in about 10 minutes.  So I get there and no one greets me.  There is no signage regarding take out.  I get the attention of the bartender and say I'm early for a take out order and she goes to check but doesn't come back and tell me anything.  The place is LOUD.  Hard surfaces everywhere, a cheap , tinny sound system blaring music and the visual assault of a large screen tuned to ESPN.  I continue to stand by the bar but am not offered a drink - which I would have gladly bought to dull the noise and ease the wait.  

I want to get someone's attention to ask if they can run my card so that when my order is up I can go but the staff is pretty much running in circles.  This became more frustrating as eventually I could see what I was certain was my order bagged and ready.  The person behind the bar approaches me with my check (and not a bag) and I give her my card and she takes it while running to answer the phone.  She stays on the phone a few minutes and returns with my card.  I sign and she runs for the phone again.  I'm waiting and she eventually gets another waiter near her to bring me the bag.  I ask if there is any sauce in it (it's a BBQ joint!) and she says no and goes to get some of each of the two available.  I'm pleasant as I say thanks - now 35 minutes after placing my order - 25 of them observing the chaos under unpleasant conditions.

Anyway - they're new, I'm hopeful and hungry and only a couple blocks from home.  I get home and open the bag.  The sides are already a disappointment in size: three 1/2 pint containers: mashed potatoes (delicious) baked beans (OK but not baked enough - too saucy) and collard greens (pretty good but oddly saucy too).  I plate a little of each then open the chicken package.  Smells good and looks like a lot but wait something's wrong.  I mentioned I ordered a whole chicken and expected to see just that - perhaps cut in 1/4s but would have been fine whole.  Instead there are four 1/4s.  Now none of my friends would confuse me for a breast man and that goes for my taste in chicken too.  But the four 1/4s I was looking at were all breast/wing 1/4s.  Four of 'em.  I was looking forward to a leg/thigh which, to me, tastes better and also stays moister through a long smoking and would have left the expected two breasts for my roommate later or myself if super tasty.  

So, already disappointed on a lot of levels I cut up a breast/wing and no way this spent a long time in a smoker.  Roadside, for example, smokes their chickens 4 hours (and their pulled pork and brisket for 17!)  so that it's falling off the bone but this was actually difficult to separate the wing.  Don't get me wrong -  I am not saying it was undercooked - it was fully cooked - but not slow smoked by a long shot.

Last straw - I spent $30 on one chicken and three sides an no corn muffins?  "They come with all the meals and this is the same as two meals and there should have been at least a couple in there.  I'm pretty sure I didn't see them in the sides section or I would have even bought them.

Like I said, I *really* want to like this place and for it to succeed.  It's joined a neighborhood of very good restaurants who all do a large amount of take out so they will need to streamline that operation: signage, promptness, something to do while waiting - like selling me a drink - would all be good starters.

I'd like to see them publish their smoke times, temperatures and woods used - BBQ eaters care about these things.  And BBQ eaters who do their own smoking (like me in a Kamado) *really *care.  

I'll try more of their sides too - but think the portions should be full pints when a la carte at that price: they are as GFC up the street and at Petes @ 20th.  

I'm very happy to see catfish and shrimp on the menu which don't require long smoking for flavor/tenderness but am leery of the ribs and brisket if they are anything like the chicken.  And finally, when someone orders a whole chicken - give them one - preferably from one bird but at list try and replicate the parts from one.  

I promise to be back soon - hope it gets better.
author: Jon R.

description: DAMN - that's good eatin. Even at the pre-opening, with only a limited menu, this place is kickin. The ribs were cooked to perfection and scrumptiously seasoned. A plate of 4 different sides - all of which were licked clean. I couldn't get enough of the extra corny cornbread and the dessert sampler was divine. Typically, I find California BBQ joints to be mediocre at best and often just terrible. Either everything is way too salty or sauced to death or both, improperly cooked and uninteresting. This place honestly has it going on. I can't wait to go back.
author: elizabeth a.

description: imagine my excitement to hear Baby Blues was opening here in SF.  I took clients to the Venice location and fell madly in love.  Everything is great, the baby backs, the brisket, the crack & cheese!  Having lived in Memphis for a year, I know good BBQ and there ain't none in SF until now.  They even had a blue grass band playing there on sunday.  The owner is hands on and the service is spot on.  They had some big orders ahead of us for Super Bowl and came over several times to let us know it was coming.  How often does a new restaurant get the staff thing right?  Baby Blues - I've only got eyes for you!
author: Christine E.

description: The worse barbecue I've ever had in my life and definitely in San Francisco.  1. Beef brisket should be sliced against the grain like roast beef not shredded up like a pulled pork. 2. Both the pulled pork and brisket tasted as if it were boiled, as it was very watery and bland.  I did not taste the  smokey flavor that is present in barbecued meats.3. overpriced 4.  The ciabatta bread is the wrong choice of bread to serve considering that the meat was watery.  Terrible, terrible, terrible!  How dare they call this barbecue!
author: Food F.

description: Someone else mentioned the mac n cheese and I have to say-- it's pretty amazing. There are a few things there you wouldn't expect to be as great as they are, like stewed tomatoes and slaw. The pulled pork is really worth your while and I definitely recommend checking out the different sauces/vinegar with it! It can be a little more than you'd expect for bbq, but the quality of the food combined with the really relaxed atmosphere and great service make it worth coming back to as often as your waistline can handle it :)
author: Chris L.

description: First let me say I'll continue eating here because I like the food and the location.  That said, I didn't appreciate eating cold chicken in a restaurant.  Yes I said cold.  I ordered the smoked chicken, which I have enjoyed before, and the breast was charred on the outside, but literally cold on the inside when I cut into it.  No one once asked me how my food was so I didn't say anything.  Besides I don't send food back; just my philosophy after working in the restaurant field for a few years.  Instead I ate the delicious sides and the thigh/leg section which was not cold.  The breast came home with me and made a nice sandwich later.  So overall quality can be spotty and service is minimalist to put it kindly.  Hopefully they see this review and make sure not to serve people old food they forgot to reheat.  A few more mistake free meals and I'll upgrade my rating.
author: Al K.

description: I went here with one of my good friends, her father and my daughter.  As soon as we walked in, the guy behind the bar was all over my daughter and was soo sweet welcomed us pretty much with open arms.......This was the owner and he himself had a daughter a bit older than mine at the time.  We all had the ribs, pulled pork, chicken, mac and cheese, greens and oooooooh how i love me some of their corn bread!! i'm a sucker for corn bread and theirs was melt in your mouth yumminess.  For dessert I had asked if there was any way possible to try a little of everything such as a dessert sampler and the owner was so accomodating that we got our wish, well, more mine than my friends. hahaha! ate up every last bite of dessert.   The owner even gave my baby girl 2 blow up balloons, a kitty and a guitar......so sweet! I will definately come back here again with my baby girl and friends....thanks for being so sweet!!!
author: Ann P.

description: I really like this place.  The decor is nice and the bbq is great.  I think theres some better places out there but overall its great place to have bbq and its just a block away from my house.
author: ray s.

description: This place gets an extra star because the owner rocks!  He had noticed we were waiting for a bit, made sure he personally took our order and checked up on us frequently!  He even gave us a piece of pie that a patron brought in to share with his restaraunt, which was also very good.  Besides the great service, the food was good too, I'm glad we only ordered the meat by the pound because the meals would have been way too much!
author: Rebecca D.

description: The hot chef has left but the food is still pretty darn good.  I finally tried the okra though and am not a fan.
author: Jay W.

description: Mac n cheese is the shit! corn bread is the shit! sweet potatoe mashed potatoes hella good!!! beef briskit good, ribs good, pulled pork good!!! everything was hella good except the price! 75$ for 3 people
author: Shauna P.

description:
first of all this place is in BERNAL HEIGHTS!! so i don't understand what that person was saying about it being a scary place...they must be from pacific heights or something.
the food is good - not great but the atmosphere is wonderful 
real casual and friendly.
i always get "to go" but it looks like a mixed crowd.
get the pulled pork sandwich -
author: jaime r.

description:
Huge fan. Can't go wrong. I have been about 5 times and each time I love it more. Will always go back and recommend to anyone. Very casual and good for kids. I have 2 and bring them every time. Parking is tough, but that's the Mission. Usually get a spot around the hospital.

Baby back ribs are outstanding and all of the sides are great. 

I love the Mack and Cheese, Okra, and Collard Greens.

Just go there.
author: Marvin A.

description: Sa-weet!  Finally found me some good barbecue out here on the left coast.  Got a recommendation of this place from a fellow southerner (thanks Jamie!) and figured we should give it a try after a long Saturday afternoon of errand running.  We got take out this time but the dining room is a pretty cool space in an old pharmacy (look for the DRUGS sign from the street, not obvious it's a restaurant) Definitely much nicer than the scary places with bars on the windows on the south side that had fed my BBQ habit back in Chicago.  They had some good cajun music playing and good beers on tap.  Need to come back to dine in after I can drink again (yep..pregnant right now) so I can have a fine draft beer with my pulled pork.
author: katie b.

description:
went with a friend, ordered the 3 Kings  plate.   it was supposed to be  1/3 rack of ribs, beef brisket, and 1/4 free range chicken  bbq'ed.

the ribs were certainly small enough, about 5 inches long, 3 ribs.   the 1/4 chicken was a thigh/drumstick   which also was of the variety that KFC buys (small!) and was on the dry side..   but the "brisket" was the kicker!!  it WASN'T EVEN BRISKET.  it was pulled pork which they tried passing off as brisket!!! no matter how much i told them that this was in no way a beef brisket (the texture and color of a bbq brisket is totally OBVIOUS), they claimed they "pulled" the brisket into this mass of shredded pork!!!!  
i was utterly flabbergasted...  so, with the deception and little amount of food (for $23), i'm not going back here..  there are a lot of other bbq places (even more now with new ones recently opened) that one doesn't have to waste their time and money on this place.
author: dee c.

description:
Ok so let me start this off by saying my co-worker ate here last Friday night and had a dreadful experience. I for some reason thought it was a one time thing and decided to give them a chance anyway based on the fact that much is forgiven if the food is bombtastic. We waited for over 45 mins for a table last night....every 20 mins it was another 20 mins..it was busy and I get that sometimes you have to wait for good food. The staff at this place is stellar hence the two stars...however that is their only saving grace!! Once we were seated our server was nice and informed us that they were out of both sweet tea and unsweetened tea.....while reviewing the menu he was also very helpful in answering our questions about what was good and what was not.

My husband and I shared a mixed meat plate I believe it was the Baby Blues Plate...we got SHredded Beef...Pork Ribs (Memphis) and Chicken....our friends ordered a mixed plate as well with Catfish...Ribs..Chicken...Shrimp...so needless to say we had all of the meats covered at our table....we also got the Okras...Creamed Spinach...Mac and Cheese and Collard Greens. It took them almost an hour to bring our order over to us...not once did they check in to say that it would be right up or to bring the sodas that we ordered to replace the very awful tasting "blue kool aid" (I mean who messes up Kool Aid but that is another story). It would have been helpful to at least have some cornbread to eat since we were starving!! It was also at this point that I realized our wait had been this long based on the fact that the kitchen took a looooooooooooooooonnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnngggggggggg time to get the food prepared and to the tables.

The food came just as we were about to eat our arms off...The meat was luke warm and over cooked. The chicken was dry and did not taste good at all in fact all I could taste was charred over-cooked meat. I even got dark meat...dry dark meat just ain't right...in fact it is down right NASTY. The Catfish had a gassy after taste no doubt from the gas grill being used. The ribs were ok nothing to write home about  but I can do better ribs in my oven and the shrimp was decent....although it was a little over cooked but I can forgive that. I asked the server why it took such a long time to get our food to the table and he said..."they just opened and they are still trying to figure things out" We also wanted to try the banana pudding but they were out... our server did say "at least we did not run out of ribs this time" We ended up ordering cold pecan pie which was not bad and cold peach betty/cobbler... Cobbler should be warm with vanilla ice cream...I think they offer these two dishes cold so that they can be made ahead and get to your table before the night turns into day!! The peach betty was ok but they used canned peaches which for me is unforgiveable.....

Having eaten BBQ in North Carolina....Kansas City and Georgia this ain't cutting it for me!! The meat lacked so much in so many ways.... I was not impressed with the wait time...the food or for that matter the decor. If the food was good I could get over having to wait for it...with so many yummy dining options in the mission I would for sure pass this one up. If their meats are slow cooked for 18 hours then the flavor and taste should be tasted all the way to the bones...there was little to no flavor in anything that I ate last night. I really wanted to like this place because I love me some BBQ but once again San Francisco has proved itself to be a foodie paradise in many ways but not when it comes to BBQ.  I may visit their LA restaurant to see how it compares but something tells me it may not be any better. To sum up my experience please see below...


Ribs: Sorry Out...
Catfish:Running Low....
Chicken:Only White Meat....
Iced-Tea:Sorry Out of Tea....
Banana Pudding:Just ran out...
Water: Oh we have plenty:
Customers: Not for much longer if you do not get it together!!
author: T H.

description:
To the yelper who complained about the pulled pork
Being bland; if you had listened to yer waiter and tried
It with the applecider vinegar, you would have been in
Bliss. 

And the guy who complained about precooked ribs;
What do you call "managing it via pre-baking"? A 
Bad joke?

Anywhos

The lasker burger is one of the power items on the
Menu, as are the jack sandwiches, and the sauteed
Okra. Not slimy like I remember it.
author: Frit J.

description:
BBQ is like religion: people get a lot of enjoyment and reassurance out of it, and people get pretty (freaking) heated about it, too.  Not long ago I was in Texas and got all kinds of conflicting advice about where to go for barbeque, with explicit opinions that reminded me of, well, asking people what denomination was the best.  Lots of dreamy looks when talking about their favorite, and lots of fiery indignation when talking about the other (whoever the other may be). 

I'm sure that if Baby Blues was in Texas there'd be some polarization about the place, possibly at the same level there is from what I'm seeing in the reviews here.  Though personally, I really don't see what's not to like about this place.  Attentive, knowledgeable service: as shown by our waitress who checked in regularly and came over to tell us about the several cheeses in the mac & cheese.  A good location: as evidenced by being able to park within a block of the place, right on the street, no problem.  A nice space: good light, a good view of the street, comfortable chairs, and all that.  A good beer and (short, but adequate) wine list.  

And right, the food.  We had brisket, pulled pork, a link, baby back ribs, slaw, potato salad, mac & cheese, and corn bread.  The brisket was properly cooked and prepared, as was the pork.  The link was surprisingly spicy (though easy to handle) and good, too.  The ribs were just right as well, bone-gnawingly delicious.  The buttermilk style slaw was exactly the way I prefer it - more savory than sweet, crunchy, fresh, generously portioned.  The flavors of the potato salad were spot on, and while I thought the potato bits were a bit larger than they should have been, the lack of uniformity bespoke a home-madedness that overcomes that kind of quibble.  The corn bread is in the traditional, savory style as well - I like the cake-style better, but I can recognize that for folks who like cornbread in this way it was very nicely done.  The mac & cheese was, well, divine.  The different cheeses complimented each other very nicely, adding a great depth to the side that my date and I loved.  

I'm not from a major BBQ producing region of the country so I don't have much of a vested interest in the style one way or the other.  Memphis, Texas, Carolina; pig, beef, chicken; cheesy mac, cole slaw, potato salad: whatever's there, I'll eat and if it's good I'll like it.  So I don't have a problem with the fusion aspect of barbeque here.  And the portions are generous enough that my date and I split a Blue Devil and had leftovers for the next day.

So three meals from one ($30) entree, which I think puts a good spin on their price points, which I though were reasonable.  We will be back and we will be bringing friends and we will be telling others.  They're doing God's work here, and as long as you're not some overwrought vegetarian, or some other such misguided unrealistic affected vainglorious pissant, you will see the light.
author: Jacob R.

description: Pretty good overall.  The mac and cheese was delicious and my husband really enjoyed his meal.  While the food was good, Baby Blues gets three stars because the service was not so hot.
author: Roberta J.

description:
So I order delivery and they say 45 minutes. 50 minutes later they arrive with apologies, but just about everything else is wrong (and cold).

They bring me a Diet Coke I didn't order. They charge me for a dessert they don't deliver, and tell me they were out of it and someone "should have told me" on the phone. The driver swears he will get them to refund the price of the dessert. Does not happen.

No tip for you. Food is decent, but not worth being crapped on. Say goodbye to a local and regular customer; who will be sure to tell everyone how much you suck.
author: Myss T.

description: I love it when something new comes to the neighborhood. So I stopped by to get some BBQ to go. I went with the lunch special, The Cherokee Spike, which comes with Pulled Pork, Beef Brisket, Smoked Link, Cornbread, soda (got the Sweet Tea for a dollar more) and a fixin (I went for the Mac and Cheese). All this for about $14. Price-wise, that's not too bad. This is good BBQ overall. The Beef Brisket is what I like the most- cooked just right with plenty of flavor. The Pulled Pork was good, but not as tasty as I thought it would be. Everything else is good too, but nothing has "wowed" me yet. So that's when you bring in their extra spicy sauce for some sweet, tangy kick in your throat! The lunch special is like a sample of what Baby Blues has to offer. I'm looking forward to my next visit which will be in house.
author: Leroid D.

description: Burp! Lick Lick all clean! I have the BBQ chicken sandwich in my tummy with the mac and cheese. The chicken was moist and very flavorful. I like the bbq sauce, it's not too vinegary, or too sweet, it's just right! The hot sauce was a bit too hot for me. I got it to go and I think they gave me the XXX hot sauce. The mac and cheese, I didn't finish. I'm too full but I did taste it. It's better than I've had at other BBQ joints but it's not the BEST, just good. I will go back to try the ribs next time.
author: Karen T.

description: Still looking for someone in SF to scratch my BBQ itch....but Baby Blue BBQ came close. All in all happy with the quality not so much with the quantity. I had the pulled pork sandwich, pork was very good.....way too much bread way too little pork. BBQ Sauces are good nice variety....sadly still have not found a Carolina BBQ sauce yet in SF. My wife had the Beef Brisket platter and Baby Blue BBQ delivered with both quality and nice size portions. The beef was delicious and the sweet potato mash was fabulous.....greens where just ok and the corn bread was way below par. Service was excellent and we will be back BABY......probably for some baby backs ;-)
author: John F.

description: Best BBQ place in our area. Love their mac & cheese! Their portions are huge so come hungry. I had their half baby blue ribs with shrimp, and mac & cheese on the side. Yummy! Nice staff, yummy food, bar, and BBQ what else could you ask for? Umm parking...only thing that sucks in that area.
author: Carmelina A.

description: Disclaimers: I've only ordered delivery from here and I would not consider myself a BBQ aficionado.  My reason for the 2 stars is that 3/5 times I've ordered from them, they've made mistakes. Yes, I'm the fool for still ordering delivery.  But I hadn't had for a while & was craving BBQ. My roommates' grilled shrimp were good as always but the pork ribs were just too fatty.  Everything is too fatty & rich. The baked beans and cornbread were pretty blah. The mac n cheese is tasty but greasy.  I may give them one more try to see how the beef ribs are since I've been told they are good.
author: Rude G.

description:
Amazing food, even better service (the nicest, most knowledgeable service I've had in  LONG time)... A few of my faves:
bbq chicken, okra, creamed spinach, mac & cheese, XXX sauce, kahlua cake, key lime pie. Though everything I tried was tasty!
author: Patricia M.

description: YUM! The pulled pork here is seriously to die for! It makes my mouth water just writing this review! The service is friendly, the atmosphere is comfortable and the owner and his family are adorable. I highly recommend this place and recommend that you fast for a day before you get there! And save room for the banana pudding - it is insane!
author: Jessi B.

description: If you're in the mood for meat, this is the place to go.  Been here three times and never had a bad experience.  It's out in the Mission/Bernal Heights/Precita area so if you're in the area, definitely drop in for the best bbq in sf.  The sides are good and the portions are big.  Two dinners easily feeds three diners.  If you have four diners, just add an a la carte item to supplement and share family style.  If you're really hungry, order the Texas Beef Rib.  It's truly a "steak on a stick". Sauces are on the table and range from sweet/mild to vinegar/hot.  Friendly and helpful staff.  Highly recommend.
author: Andrew L.

description:
A welcome addition to the northwest Bernal hood.  This place is quite yummy, and while I haven't loved everything I've tried there the food quality is definitely good.

My favorite so far is the shrimp po boy.  The catfish is great too. Haven't had too much of the meat- it's best done with several people so you can all share. 

Their sides are delish; the macaroni and the corn on the cob (I think they call it , blues on the cob) are standouts; although the slaw, okra and greens are great too.

The decor is nice, the staff is nice, the sauces are nice. Love this place.

UPDATE April 2011: It's still just as good as ever!
author: Rusty H.

description: In my oppinion I love this place. But I only order one thing on this menu: Ace in the Sleeve. I love the grilled shrimp and catfish spritz with lemon and a little bit of their sauce, it's a taste of seafood heaven. The portions of these meals are huge for what you pay for. I rarely get to finish my ribs and touch my sides because I've filled up on the other meats. I'm not usually a big rib fan, but I come back here and never get tired of it. They serve kool-aid! Who serves kool-aid?! Baby blue does!
author: Joanne T.

description: Called a bunch tonight (a Monday) and there was no answer...a robotic female voice asked me to leave a message.   Right number?  Uh...yep.  Since it's in the 'hood, I walked over to check it out.  BB BBQ was not open for business, but there was no sign saying so (or why not or when that would change).  The house was dark, the door was open (!?!), so who knows what's going on.
author: Rawley V.

description: I ain't no rib expert but as a fatty I was impressed with the ribs at this place.  They were on the dry side but if you squirt extra BBQ sauce it was awesome.  I usually hate spare ribs but the memphis ribs here were delicious.  The baby backs were also good but not as good as Houstons danish baby backs.  But $25 for a 1/2 rack of baby and memphis plus 2 sides and cornbread is pretty reasonable.  The next time I come back I am going to go for the Texas beef boner.  It was huge.  I wanted to grab the bone and spank the manatee with it.
author: Fatty A.

description: It isn't the "best" BBQ in town, but it is good, friendly, accomodating.  Kid friendly.  Nice live music.  Great service!  A real neighborhood treat!
author: K A.

description: This rating is for the baby back ribs only. The fixins probably deserve 2 stars, and I wouldn't recommend the other types of ribs. I like the fact that they deliver.
author: Nat O.

description:
I ate here with two buddies this past Sunday. As you can tell from my nickname, I LOVE ribs. I love them more than I love many people in my life, sad but true. Anyways, we had the Memphis Ribs and the Baby backs, some pulled pork and some links. Ribs and links were really good, I didn't care much for the pulled pork.For sides we had the creamed spinach, mac & cheese & cole slaw. Creamed spinach was good, a bit watery though, the cole slaw needed a bit more...marinating, is that the right word? Too crunchy. The mac & cheese was the bomb. Nice roomy restaurant, we sat at the "high table" at the front and we had plenty of table space.

 I notice there are a few bad reviews about the service here. For those who don't know, the SF Chron and SFgate.com ran a piece about new BBQ places in the Bay Area and Baby Blues was the main one featured. As a result they got inundated with customers...and they are new, a month old, so they are still getting their groove on. We waited about 35 min for our orders but I'm willing to go back again. This neighborhood can be a bit rough so watch your six.
author: Steve K.

description:
I dont know why y'all are giving this place more than one star. it's like they have never tasted BBQ before, let alone cook ed it! It sucked. See below:

hostess didnt know the menu
pork  ribs - ok
catfish - overcooked, rubbery
mashed potatoes - ok
baked beans - kidney beans?? Blek!
greens - OMG sucked! So sad.
corn bread - REALLY?? consistency of a bran muffin, no butter 
completely overpriced

We live in the neighborhood and had been excited to have a BBQ spot close by. Boy, was this place a disappointment. Dont waste your time or money.
author: c h.

description:
ehh...

the perfect word that can sum up the overall experience at san francisco's baby blue bbq.

ehh...

for example.

you:"hey rommel, how was the chicken there?"

me:"ehh."

you:"how about the beef brisket?"

me:"ehh."

you:"ohh...well how about the cream spinach? that looked promising!"

me:"ehh."

you:"how about that cornbread?"

me:"that was great."

- fin.
author: Rommel B.

description: Today's update:  The pnone message says that they are not yet open, they are  having some minor electrical problems  and problems with the hood, and expect to open "in a few days",  "after the new year", which of course it is.  So.. soon maybe!
author: Art S.

description: came here and got lunch to go after reading the reviews in the Examiner and the Chronicle . It seemed mouth watering so I had to try it out. It's easy to get to also. I got the lunch special - Beef Brisket sandwich that came with coleslaw ( got it on the side) also got a side of collard greens. It was delicious the meet was super good just melted in my mouth coleslaw was good and I liked the greens. Good portions I was full the rest of the day. I would definitely come again especially when I'm hungry as the portions are really good . Tasty food !!
author: lyn m.

description:
food was ok

ridiculously overpriced hipster bullsh*t.!
If you want real bbq than go to mcdonalds because you will probably also get good service as well.

We complained and the owners brother ripped up the check and called some of my friends b*tches but pretended like he was kidding.

If you have a choice than go eat a burrito instead.

Besides, WHO THE HELL CHARGES 2Dollars For a GLASS OF KOOL AID!?!?!?!??!
author: ben G.

description: I ordered the baby back ribs with the mac n cheese and the blues on the cob.  The baby back ribs were good, but nothing to die for.  The mac n cheese was very tasty but a bit to heavy for me.  It seem like they melted a brick of cheese onto the macaroni.  The corn was bomb.  It was laced with chipotle butter with blue cheese.
author: Cedric F.

description: This place was a lot of fun, and the service was great!  Only thing is I found myself comparing it to Memphis Minnie's on Haight Street,  I will return because the food is good, however, M.M's pays closer attention to detail overall.  And the food is just a bit better, probably because of experience.  Baby Blues has more parking and a larger dining room as an added benefit for customers.  They were also quite appreciative of my feed-back regarding the sweet tea.  I will try it again after they have made a few improvements. (This was 4 months ago and not posted until now.)
author: Charlene M.

description: I'd been wanting to try this joint since it opened up a couple months ago - SF only seems to have a few BBQ spots so having one open in my 'hood seemed like a Christmas miracle.  We tried the pulled pork plate and the baby back ribs......Both were great (big portions).... Lotsa different sauces to try as well.  The platters come with 2 sides/each so we shared mac n' cheese, mashed sweet potatoes, creamed spinach and beans....All of them were great!  The cornbread was ok (different from the fluffy mix most of us bake at home).   I'd definitely go back and try more options (they have lots)... Not cheap but seemed less $$$ than Big Nates.
author: Mike S.

description: Solid BBQ, friendly staff. Won't blow your mind, but won't blow your wallet either. Easy choice if you're in the Mission and in the mood for BBQ.
author: tw s.

description: YUM!  I love me some ribs and Baby Blues BBQ does not fail.  It's a 20-25 minute delivery from the time of order to my front gate (Potrero Hill).  I've had each of the A LA Carte items on the menu sans the fish and seafood.  All are de-lish.  Seriously.  My favorite Fixins are: cole slaw, sauteed okra, collard greens, potato salad and stewed tomatoes.  Good BBQ that arrives lickety-split and HOT... win, win for me!
author: Nikki C.

description: Also besides the BBQ, the hamburger was one of the best burgers I've ever had in the city. And that pecan pie is a dream. Plus our Punk Rock server with the pink cast and the PIL t shirt was adorable.
author: Cydney B.

description:
This is the second time my family and I have eaten here.  I'm familiar with the best BBQ in the country -  Memphis, TN.  Granted, this isn't in TN, however, this place needs to learn how to cook ribs.   The memphis ribs are very tough and flavorless.  The baby back ribs taste like they were bought at Safeway, boiled and then basted with sauce.  I've made better ribs than this restaurant using the "boil and BBQ on the grill" way.  The sides are just okay.   The collard greens were decent, but, avoid the mashed potatoes that are hard and lack flavor.  

The restaurant is not very busy during the afternoon - that should tell you to stay away.  The staff is cordial, the sides are just okay.   They do not know how to make ribs.  

The prices are way too high for what you will receive.  Your going to walk away wondering "why did I put down all that money for this".
author: Jerry H.

description:
ah yeah! we did family style so i was fortunate enough to try the brisket, the beef ribs, and the chicken. all super good and the blues on the cob was really an awesome twist. but i don't know if you can actually mess up or can you master sweet potatoes at all because they never stop bringing the yum-but let's just say that they were perfect in a way that i just can't put my finger on.

our server was great and the service was timely. and how is the neighborhood sketchy? you are just off of precita and bordering on bernal heights? it's much safer than the rest of the mission, and we all know that the inner mission has been singing the blues lately. sorry maybe they just need to put one in the marina to spare some people the trauma of having to experience a diverse and unique neighborhood. sheesh!
author: Wendolyn A.

description: Not quite worth the wait but if I'm not starving, I'd go here again.  The meat dishes were pretty good, the coleslaw was awesome.  However, the okra was pretty yuck as were the pork and beans.  The BBQ sauces weren't quite right either.  My boyfriend hated the cornbread but I liked it.  It was a little on the heavy side and not as sugary sweet as most cornbread is nowadays.  Yeah, the neighborhood isn't great for parking but I'm not sure why a bunch of posters think the neighborhood is sketchy.  Maybe they should keep to N. Beach and the like.
author: shannone e.

description: best bbq place ive tried sooo far a lil pricey tho
author: Truman N.

description:
Last night my good friend Graham from the U.K. wanted to go out to eat. His Friend Susan suggested we go to Bably Blues BBQ in the mission. I love BBQ so I was willing to try it.

Let me start by saying I'm a big fan of Everett and Jones BBQ in Jack London Square because of their Briskett and their Spicy BBQ Sauce.

We were seated quickly, the place was full, loved the fact that the bar serves plenty of pulled beers especially Guiness! I opted for iced tea; they offer regular (not flavored thank god) and sweet tea; unlimited refilss too!

The menu is amazing, lots to choose from, the prices started from $13.95 up to $31.95. Everything comes with 2 sides or "fixins" and corn bread. I chose "The Three Kings" because I wanted to try their ribs, it has Briskett and I like chicken. My "fixins" were Mac n Cheese and mashed sweet potatoes.

What was presented to me by our ever so friendly waitress was a mound of food that looked delicious. Before I continue, I was asked if I like white or dark chicken meat. I'm a thigh and wing fan but was told I could only have thigh/leg and breast/wing; Now why is that?

The ribs were big, moist, the meat came right off the bone. There are three sauces to choose from which were mild, medium, and spicy/hot all with a vinegar base and added a nice touch to the Briskett. 
The Briskett was more of a pulled pork and not the nice slices with a crispy topping I'm used to at E and J's. It tasted great but I just wouldn't call it Briskett.  The Chicken was moist, had a nice grilled taste and I had that wrapped up in a to go box for lunch today. 
The sides were tasty, served hot. The Mac and Cheese was my favorite side, it's one of those dishes that takes me back to my childhood and this did just that, I should have ordered a double side of this. The sweet mashed sweet potatoes were good too, can't complain about them but wished I would have ordered mashed potatoe since I'm a fan. The cornbread was unique, not sure what they do to it but it was brown instead of yellow  but had a "Stick to your ribs" quality that I liked and was moist and not crumbly. I used it to sop up the Sweet Potatoes and bbq Sauce.
I'd definitely come back to this place.
author: David P.

description: Had the pulled pork sandwich and a side of mac n cheese.  I thought the sandwich was fantastic and the mac n cheese was good.  Looking forward to my next visit to try something else.
author: Eric K.

description: Yum, yum!  A great addition to the growing restaurant scene in Bernal Heights.  I was very excited to find out they deliver!
author: Jinenne S.

description: We ordered from BBBBQ for my husbands b-day party for 25 people. More than enough food the "Extravoganza"- even some left overs... ...mmmmmm mmmm. The cornbread is amazing - moist and chunks of corn yeah! Sorry that is always a test to me, hate dry cornbread. The bbribs are great, brisket, greens, mac and cheese and smashed sweet potatoes---all great too. Oh and the chicken is pretty good too. Def recommend for a party platter and make everyone's bellies happy and filled! And best of all the DELIVERED and I didn't have to cook!
author: SF N.

description: Look out San Francisco, REAL SOUTHERN BarBQue is here!! Attended the opening tonight and it was AWESOME!! Can't wait to see the finished product!
author: Sweetie M.

description:
i thought the food was deelish - particularly the sauteed okra and creamed spinach. the bbq was pretty tasty and i liked the sauces, though the "XXX OMG FIREFIREFIRE YOURE GONNA DIE" sauce that the server tried to scare us with really isn't that spicy. but who knows? i was hella hungry before i got there and to be honest, i was (and still am) completely sold by the fact that they serve kool-aid with unlimited refills. AND they had my favorite flavor: *RED*! omg. fucking amazing.

RED!!!
author: Jonathan M.

description:
danger danger danger!  please please it was bad enough when luna park started delivering to my neighborhood, but their food does not hold up to delivery that well.  baby blues, though, absolutely does.  so delicious.  after 3 delivery orders trying a variety of options i can safely say that these are my favorite bbq ribs i've had in sf (especially at an actual bbq joint.  i've generally been disappointed).  i can't even decide if i like the baby backs or the memphis style better, they are both so amazing.  i recommend the plate that includes a half rack of each (with 2 sides and cornbread) for two folks.  my husband and i did well with that the other night.  

don't let them trick you into the baked beans with pork as opposed to normal baked beans for your side.  their pork is not their best dish, so the baked beans with pork are just not as good as the plain baked beans.  

i highly recommend the mac n' cheese.  the chicken is good too.

i'd also add that delivery is fast and friendly and the folks who answer the phone are also pleasant to talk to, which feels like a rarity to me.
author: Sharon M.

description: This is hands down the worst bbq I have ever had. I ordered the pulled pork and it had no seasoning at all. Even the corn bread was awful. Mac N cheese tasted like it had been cooked in a microwave with velveeta. The greens were awful Our server was very nice and tried to make it seem like it isn't southern so I must not be used to that type of bbq. No I 'm not used to the type of bbq that has no flavor at all. I am not used to cardboard flavored bbq. Last time I checked BBQ was born in the south. Memphis to be exact. This was an insult to BBQ. If you love it, you don't know BBQ. Only reedeming thing is that the servers are very nice.
author: Yayne A.

description: I love this place, it is consistently good and the wait staff is friendly and attentive.  The sauces are all SO good, great mac n' cheese, greens, and every piece of meat I've had from the beef rib, pork ribs to chicken has been dee-lish!!  I drive from the other side of the city to go here specifically, due to disappointment elsewhere.  YUM!
author: jessica f.

description: I went to this place with a few friends last week and was very disappointed. he prices where high, their was long wait, followed by bad service.... but i could handle all that until...... my chicken was cold and flavorless! Really.... cold like it had been sitting on some counter for a few hours cold and dry with NO flavor. Yuck. My friends liked their dishes which why I give it two stars. I would never return.
author: Emily S.

description:
Terrible.

Let me say as a connoisseur of Memphis BBQ (Born and raised 23 years in Memphis) this isn't even a close substitute.  That being said, I am not just being overly pretentious.  Here's why:

When I ordered sweet tea (which I made a big deal about because it is hard to find real sweet tea outside of the South) I got about 2 blocks down the road and took a sip.  Not a speck of sugar could be tasted. 

Baby Blues, do you know what sweet tea is or just forget to add sugar?  Either way it was not what I ordered.

I opened up my sandwich when I got home and couldn't believe that the sandwich was not served on a regular white bread hamburger bun.  It was also very small for the price.  A sandwich that size back home goes for $4 tops.  The first bite I took was filled with a giant sized piece of cartilage.  Gross.  I found 3 or so more as I ate.  That is unacceptable and I took a picture for proof.
