I haven't given up hope yet that there is a decent Memphis-style BBQ joint in SF but this is definitely not the place.  At $11.99 for a lunch, this was a terrible experience.
author: Andrew H.

description: I definitely love my BBQ, and I feel like Baby Blues has some OK BBQ. I came here with my friends and we had the BBQ chicken, Beef brisket, and BBQ shrimp. They all tasted pretty good, but the portion size was unforgivable! We asked them if the three-item combo would be able to feed three people, and when they said yes, we expected it to feed all three of us! What we ended up getting was 5 pieces of shrimp, the leg quarter of a chicken, and maybe a handful of brisket. The sides were pretty good as well, especially the mac n cheese, but they were sides, and definitely not enough to make up for the lack of meat. I left feeling unsatisfied--I've had better BBQ and paid less money for it. Plus parking is horrible, so I have no reason to come back.
author: Deena H.

description:
I spoke with Sharon, the owner, after she saw my review and she handled the problem professionally and graciously. She invited us back and we went last night. 

Everything was fantastic. We split "The Deuce"-Memphis ribs and 5 bbq'd shrimp. The shrimp! The shrimp!(as someone here previously wrote) were perfectly cooked and I wished there were more. It also came with 2 sides-we got the mac & cheese (yummy cheesiness) and rice with smoked chicken. It also came with a piece of cornbread-on previous visits I didn't care for it so much, but last night it was good..

The place was pretty busy-the service was pefect-friendly and fast.
Thank you Sharon and Baby Blues-we will definitely be back!
author: Deb N.

description: Amazing....  Just got back, that's all I can say  right now.    Best ribs that I've ever had in my life, hands down.
author: Jason M.

description: New restaurant in the neighborhood, down the hill from Bernal Heights to the corner of Precita and Mission.  Fantastic Food.  I had to keep the menu on our table, as we were constantly adding to our table.  I loved everything that reached my lips from the creamy spinach, the corn cob, meat that fell off the bone to the banana pudding.  We will definitely be back often with friends.
author: Christina V.

description: Not being a big red meat eater, bbq places can be tough. But this one serves up options for everybody. They were out of chicken for the night, so I ordered the shrimp po'boy, which was by far the most delicious shrimp po'boy i've ever had, with huge grilled shrimp and coleslaw on the sandwich. Mac n' cheese was pretty delicious, creamed spinach good, but baked beans and mashed potatoes were average. Nice, clean and hip atmosphere, and very friendly service.
author: Cody E.

description: I've had good BBQ in Texas and Kansas City and I've never really found that right place here in SF, except for the old Brother-in-Laws from the 1980's-1990's.  So when this place opened up two block from my house, I was excited.  My neighbor gave it a thumbs down, but he hit this place during the first week. I shared a three combo plate with my wife and we each had a beer.  The chicken and pulled pork was good; the baby back ribs were decent, not mind blowing.  So food wise, it was good.  Service was a little spotty, I think the staff needs to figure out how to deal with crowds and seating folks.  We will return.
author: Timothy W.

description:
Admittedly, they had a bit of a rocky start here, but I'm surprised to see some who have had such a hard time getting in - probably I was lucky the four times that I have been here now:
-  I was here on a smokey opening night
- Another time when the hood wasn't yet fixed and sides and pulled pork/braised beef brisket were only on the menu
- The last two times the full menu was in play - and it was excellent! I recommend either style of pork ribs (memphis or baby back ), the beans, creamed spinach, collard greens, mashed potatoes, and the cornbread is amazing. Time before last, we had 8 people and ordered the "Teaser Feed Bag" which feeds "6-8 people" -- we had more than enough food and ended up packing a lot back. It was $110 and could have easily fed 10 of us. They also have a nice Malbec available and some good beers (Stella, Blue Moon, Fat Tire, and some others).  Ah, and the grilled shrimps were very tasty, too!

The vibe of the place is a really great local gathering spot where lots of folks know each other and the owner (from walking dogs on Bernal Hill and Holly Park and just around the Bernal 'hood). Last night, we sat near the door and all the tables and bar spots were filled while friendly people milled about having a drink and chatting while waiting for a table. Good vibe.

Through all the initial hiccups, the owner (Paul) and his staff have been friendly, giving, and apologetic about the issues. They absolutely have nothing to apologize for as far as the food goes - it's great.
author: Scott M.

description:
Not consistent. Great the first time, horrible the second and the third was OK. 
First time loved the garlic, tomato side dish, the 2nd time I ordered this it was just canned Roma tomato's thrown in a bowl, no garlic, no oil no great taste. 
Same with portion size, large and generous once, skimpy the next. 
I wrote the "Contact Us" on their website twice expressing my pleasure and dismay and tho it says we'll get back to you...they never did. 
I love the sauces they have on the table, especially the very hot and the sweeter one. The ribs are good...or at least sometimes.
author: Richelle D.

description: OMG...this place is really bad and i will never return! I drove over here from Oakland looking forward to some good 'soul food' type bbq and I was totally wrong. Forget that the place is tiny and dingy looking...the food was horrible. I ordered the ribs, mashed potatoes, corn bread and mac and cheese. The ribs were not juicy, corn bread was stiff, mashed potatoes did not taste fresh and let's just say Kraft makes better mac n cheese. I took a few bites of the ribs, tasted the rest and ran out of there so fast, I'm surprised I didn't get sick the next day. I want my $60 back!
author: Helen M.

description: I ordered from here twice, and I do like their food.  But my second delivery order was missing an item.  Restaurant acted as if they did not believe me and offered only a token refund.  Not sure if I will ever order from there again.  Got burned at the BBQ.
author: Jim C.

description:
Great addition to the hood. I love that they kept the original signage. 

The pulled pork sandwich deserves to be in the pulled pork sandwich hall of fame so lesser pulled pork sandwiches can bow to it's greatness - seriously - it's a damn fine sammich. 

A nod to the staff - super attentive - it's been a while since the manager of a restaurant has introduced himself and had a conversation - hats off to you Maurice.
author: Mark R.

description: Delicious meat, great choices on menu, good ambience, very friendly, helpful waitstaff.  The owner, Paul is on the floor making sure everyone is happy with their meals and that things are running smoothly.  Extremely well run for a newbie restaurant!  The corn on the cob was decadent - all the other sides were delicious - cornbread was hearty and spicey - YUMMY!!! Carnivore's heaven!!
author: Angie K.

description:
Would I tell a friend to try it out? yes. Would I say it's the best bbq in the city? no.

Pulled pork did lack flavor, but there are several sauces on the table so I worked it out. Good sweet tea. The mashed sweet potatoes were way too sweet. The service is... a little strange. Trying way too hard. The inside is cute in a garage sale in Arizona type way- which I'm sure some SF snobs hate. 

I'll definitely be back to see how it progresses here- I want to love it! and I'm sick of half good not cheap enough places opening up in the hood. I want deliciousness!
author: Mr. Marie T.

description:
Pretty good. Definitely solid. Casual but cool decor. We sat at the bar and the bartender/waiter was very helpful. 
Ordered BBQ Memphis pork ribs dinner, 1/4 chicken, collard greens, mac and cheese, fried okra, and cornbread. 
Perfect amount of food for two people.
BBQ chicken was very good. Super juicy and moist and plump.
BBQ ribs were good but not great. Fall off the bone and dry style. The vinegar style sauce was very tasty, the hot bbq sauce was insane hot. 
Mac and cheese was very tasty, but i'm not sure it lived up to the hype. Okra was the best. Collard greens were very tasty too, but the okra was better. 
Cornbread was just right too.
author: Jacob K.

description: Amazing sides! Not many BBQ places have a bar either. Eat, drink and be very merry!
author: Dawn S.

description: dare i say it--- bombest BBQ in the city.  ribs, brisket, cajun shrimp, chicken, all the sides, umm i can' t find one thing i don't like about this place. i even like the artwork on the walls :)  and they have a good selection of brew on tap.  my bf knows one of the cooks and he always hooks it up with a lil somthin extra.  oh ya, don't forget to try the banana pudding.  im not a huge banana fan but this stuff is made from all sorts of goodness.
author: Olivia D.

description:
I threw a backyard b-day bash for my partner and wanted to treat her to some good BBQ with friends since she use to cater for a BBQ co. on the East Coast years ago.  I was a little nervous because I had never tried this place and she's picky about her BBQ.  I have to say they totally came through!!

Food was delivered exactly when I requested.  We got the Teaser and it was so much food we're having a second gathering tonight to get rid of all the leftovers!  The bb ribs are the bomb and the mac n cheeese was excellent!  When they say their hot sauce is hot- they mean it!  whew- good stuff!  The corn bread and the greens were also amazing.  Overall, the que was excellent and delivery service made it so easy!  I will definitely start dining in at this place now!!
author: Jenn S.

description:
This place sucks.  The food, the service, everything.  The guy at the bar took my to go order and had no idea about the menu.  The ribs are not tasty, not tender, not smoky, the sauce is not good.  The baked beans were not great, but the mac and cheese, was good--I have to admit.  The banana pudding had a weird consistency like cake frosting.

Overall, save your money--it is expensive.  Johnson's BBQ on San Bruno is 100 times better and is not that far from this place.  Even Lily's (used to be Brothers in Law on Divis) is better and half the price.
author: smrt O.

description:
I haven't written a Yelp review in a long time, but feel compelled to write one about Baby Blues BBQ. 

I went again last night. This was my fifth visit in the few months that they have been opened. Everytime I leave feeling like that was the best meal I had of my life. 

On weekend nights, the wait for food is long. It's well worth it. The wait staff knows you are waiting and are genuinely concerned for your experience. They kick ass given the crowds. 

The XXX bbq sauce is some of the best ever. The brisket,...to die for. The chicken juicy. The sides....mmm..the blues on the cob is brilliant. 

Last night, my girl and I both ordered full plates and two beers...bill came to just over $40 and we left with a full meal that is sitting on my desk now that I can't wait to eat. 

The negative reviews seem to be limited to jaded hipsters who dont appreciate good BBQ and are more concerned about being witty then honest. This place kicks ass.
author: B H.

description: Forget the BBQ, I've been brainwashed by too many southerners to even try a new take on BBQ.  But run, don't walk, to Baby Blues for the burger.  DEEEE-LISHHHH-US!
author: cheryl h.

description: i went there alone for a lunch. The place looked nice. Not crowded at all. The waiters were pretty friendly. I think they have to sit some where around you in order to take your order. I noticed that the two waiters do the exact same thing with every customer. I had " the three king", 1/3 rib, pull pork ( but on the menu says beef brisket ??) and chicken leg & thigh. it comes with 2 fixies, i had mac'n cheese and stir fried  okra for side dish. The ribs was amazing. the meat fell off the bones. I'm not a fan of pull pork and chicken though, but it was pretty good. In spite the fact that it was too much, i had a good time there. I had to ask for a doggy bag which is the coolest doggy bag i have ever seen. It's like a shopping paper bag that that you'll get from H&M. So if you crave for a big portion of meat, i would recommend it. Try bring some one with you.
author: tim t.

description:
I went to Baby Blues on 12/26 for my birthday dinner with about 20 people and we were all stuffed and happy when we left!!!  We called the owner Paul earlier in the day to say we had closer to 20 people than the original 12-14 that we'd mentioned to him, and his ready response was "Bring it on!"  I liked this place already.

They had our tables ready when we arrived, and they started us off by passing around BBQ shrimp.  Deeelicious (and I don't even eat shrimp -- it just looked too good to pass up!).  Paul told my fiance that if we were ok with it, he'd give us a set price per person (very reasonable) and just keep bringing out different dishes and sides.  That was an excellent suggestion considering the size of our group, and it worked out perfectly.  Out came the BBQ chicken, ribs, catfish, hot links...along with mashed sweet potatoes, mashed potatoes, greens, mac & cheese, and cornbread (to die for!).  Paul and his daughter (who was our server) did a fantastic job of keeping us eating and drinking and everyone loved the food!  Let's just say its no small feat to do that with a big table of 20 people.  After dinner, the plates of dessert came out with pecan pie, key lime pie, kahlua cake etc...the kahlua cake was divine.  

Paul was terrific throughout the entire meal -- always making sure "the birthday girl" had a beer or glass of wine, bringing out extra desserts and making sure we'd all had enough, etc.  As we were getting ready to leave, my friend accidentally knocked a bottle of wine I'd been given as a gift from the bench to the floor, shattering it.  Paul cleaned it up and made a little joke about it, and as an incredibly sweet gesture, he brought over a bottle of his best Syrah to replace it as a gift.  I was floored!  He and his staff really went out of the way to make us happy, and his friendliness and his kitchen's amazing cooking helped to make my birthday very special.  

It's hard to satisfy a group of 20 hungry people, and Baby Blues definitely delivered!  We'll be going back again and again.  This place is not to be missed!!!
author: Kellie J.

description: Yes, this place is open.  They're stil working things out (the sign in the window still says "coming soon," there isn't a "We're Open" sign on the door) but the food was damn tasty.  Brisket and pork, mashed potatoes, beans, and an elote-style corn on the cob (minus the mayo -- they'll have to fix that).  The cornbread is really excellent!  They are serving some alcohol (no hard stuff).  Definitely put some of the chili-infused vinegar AND bbq sauce on the meat.  The owner is nice and the staff is eager to please.  I see this place getting better and better as time goes on.
author: Jeanne G.

description: I loved this place. The barbecue was excellent. I'm from the deep south so I've grown up with barbecue. The okra was delicious and the corn bread was to die for.
author: Claire S.

description: For a city that's not supposed to know anything about good BBQ, we sure do take it seriously don't we.   I personally really like Baby Blues.  The sweet tea is cavity causingly sweet the way it should be, the sides are made care and  have soul, they are not just afterthoughts like at other places.   And the meat... the beef rib is fantastic, so much flavor and cut nicely so there is lots of tender meat.  The pulled pork is legit  especially with the hot vinegar sauce.    The only thing I didn't care much for was the brisket.   I prefer a slow smoked and sliced brisket as opposed to the one at baby Blues that is pulled and cooked in sauce.   Overall  I still think it beats out the other bay Area BBQ spots.
author: Aman M.

description: The ribs were mediocre, the okra was not cooked properly, the Mac and cheese was just not right. The hot link was "mysterious meat," as far as I am concerned. I won't even go there about the sweet tea. But MCd's does a better sweet tea. Bb-bbq tea tasted like tap water with sugar in it... I could make that at home myself. People in San Francisco, don't know what real BBQ is. The service was so so. They were not accommodating about "requests" to alter the food either. I wouldn't go back to this place if you paid me. I have yet to find a real BBQ place in the SF/Bay Area. Go to the south!
author: Nana O.

description: Been here twice now & the service is the one thing that seems to be inconsistent. Avoid the Philly fanatic fratboy with the halting, annoying-ass cadence as your server and you probably have a good chance of getting your food or whatever requests you have before the bill arrives. Dude seemed completely out of it when I asked for a sweet tea refill, left my glass on the bar all the while walking around servicing everyone else in sight. In fact, he seemed pretty jovial with everyone else except when WE needed something. Undeterred by this smarmy prick, I still managed to enjoy the pulled pork sandwich smothered with coleslaw and a side 'fixin' of shell-shaped mac'n cheese. It finally became clear that this moron was either hopelessly forgetful or just downright avoiding us after nearly 15 minutes of waiting & STILL trying to flag his ass down for my refill. Only when we finished our meals did this guy utter ANYTHING of significance (yes, we might actually need the check, you douche). On the next visit, I arrived with a bigger group of people as Mr. Philly made his exit...perfect timing. The servers this time around were friendlier, but clumsy (one broke a few dishes in a span of a few minutes) and running into chairs while in high-heels. The Memphis style pork long rib came seasoned well, not overdone & not exactly falling-off-the-bone tender, but just tender enough. The big surprise came in the form of their collard greens. Had plenty kick to it and could possibly be a meal on its own or with a side of their perfectly made cornbread. The condiments include a zesty, tangy BBQ sauce, a less piquant and subtly sweeter version & a ketchup bottle of nearly weapons-grade tabasco sauce. Diners are flanked by mini-baskets of large tri-fold napkins and individually packed, lemon scented hand wipes.
author: Chris C.

description: Sorry folks... Just 'cause they're both Southern, BBQ & Po-boys don't mix.
author: Los V.

description:
Emmy's Spaghetti Shack is so RIP.

I live in the hood.  I've been over to Emmy's, and had to deal with wait-staff who were so busy basking in their own fabulosity that I felt like I didn't fit their "boiled starch 'n' meatball" profile or something.  I guess I just don't qualify.

I walked into Baby Blues tonight, for the first time.  Sat down at their raw tombstone counter, and a friendly waitress bounced over, put her hand on my shoulder, looked at me, talked to my face, and got me all straightened out.  

I ordered the pulled pork with baked beans, potato salad, and cornbread; draft PBR to drink.  I'm a cornbread devotee and pretty much make my own, but I give this cornbread five stars.  The potato salad was home-made fresh; the baked beans were excellent; I loved the pulled pork and I'll order it again.  Good vinegar/pepper sauce in a bottle.

The pecan pie I had for dessert was almost as good as my dear departed Atlanta gramma's.

 I felt right at home at Baby Blues.  The counter and floor staff were cool, friendly, attentive, but not annoyingly attentive.  I fit right in; no snooty "You may not fit our standards" attitude.  Busy, noisy, friendly, hard-working, good music, good-vibes atmosphere.  I sat next to people I didn't know, and we ended up friends and and exchanging emails at the counter.  

Good food for a rainy Sunday night.  I'm happy, and I'll go back.

I'm glad Baby Blues is here.
author: Neil B.

description: b4 i u read any further bout this review....im not a bbq guy~i know party pooper rite =x...i only eat bbq goods that my friends cook~had the beef brisket meal with okra/mac cheese on the side....cousin had the ribs with rice & potatoes...the sauces helped a lil....the flat screen showin my penguins hockey was a plus...the waitresses were cute....spot had a bar but is not really a happy hr scene...almos $50 was the bill including tip....i dont think ill b back
author: elmer d.

description: Best BBQ in the city...hands down.  Especially if you take a big group, they spoil you even more.  Amazing!
author: Phillip P.

description: Good service and BBQ. We had them cater an event  and the food arrived on time and with plenty of sauce for the meats. The sides were all good (of the ones I tried). Okra very yummy (lots of garlic!), corn bread good, the Mac and Cheese was so popular I didn't even get to try it! Sauce is tangy and spicy, just the way we like it!
author: Jamie C.

description:
I love BBQ. I did not love Baby Blues BBQ. 

Maybe I'm spoiled by the barbecue by my parents' house in South Carolina. But while the service was very friendly and nice, and the creamed spinach and corn on the cob delicious, the meat just kinda... bleh. The ribs were moist but fatty and had seemingly no flavor. The pulled pork was dry and stringy, the brisket stringy and drowned in sauce. 

My two cents: not worth the money. But I went during the first week they were open so who knows? Maybe they've since worked out the kinks.
author: elgin m.

description: An avid fan of Southern cooking, I was very happy to find Baby Blues BBQ.  Some friends and I conducted a Sunday night dinner there after reading a couple of articles about its recent opening.  All in all, the food was excellent.  Wide selection of traditional bbq and other Southern dishes made for some tough decisions, but our group ultimately decided to go with the Memphis ribs which did not disappoint.  What really enhanced the experience, however, was the owner 's (Daniel) table visits.  He made it a point to come over to our group and explain the smoking process and provide some insight into the various BBQ sauce compositions, which we really enjoyed.  This is an excellent bbq joint I will definitely be frequenting.
author: Brian N.

description: I went again last night with my friend who wanted to try it. He had pulled pork with collards & potato salad for sides. I had brisket with baked beans and mac & cheese. I think that the meat isn't actually smoked - if so, the tell-tale flavor has miraculously gone MIA. So what does that leave? A tasteless mess that only a good BBQ sauce to some extent might remedy. Alas, no good BBQ sauces are to be found here. The pulled pork and the brisket look the same - pulled - and that sure isn't right in my book. I tasted both the pork & the beef with the same reaction...ugh. The collards were a bit strange but tolerable, the potato salad was good, the baked beans can be skipped and the mac & cheese is good - not the best ever...just good. If I'm ever forced to go back, I'll have only sides and leave the pulled pork & brisket eating to everyone else since it's disappointing...disgusting, even. I haven't tried the ribs...perhaps they're better...
author: Phil S.

description: I've eaten here many times and have done "take away" a few times.  I really like this place...and so have the numerous people who have gone with me.  I haven't seen a reference to their hamburger - which is exceptional!  There are a few weak sides but generally all is good.  The pork & beans are unbelievable 'cuz they put pulled pork into the beans.  I'm not a fan of their blackened catfish and some of my pescetarian friends have complained...but HECK it *is* a barbecue joint.  I recommend Baby Blue highly!
author: Dennis S.

description:
I totally wanted to give this place one star and tell people never to go there ... b/c that way there would always be a table open, friendly helpful waitstaff to make suggestions, and piles and piles of fabulous bbq all for me!

But I decided that it was more important that it be around forever and that everyone get to experience bbq  rib goodness...and mashed sweetpotato goodness...and banana pudding goodness...the list could go on.

Go there. If you don't have time to sit down, get take out.  If you don't want to leave home, get it delivered.
author: Dana S.

description: Baby Blues started out good then we tried it a couple of times and the place looked like they never cleaned the floors or the tables and the staff most acted like they were getting over drinking tooo much the night before and the food kept changing in taste and when it comes to desserts, i think that the cake they serve was dry, at a BBQ place the desserts should apple pie, peach cobbler, sweet potato pie ect, not dry chocolate cake.  needless to i stopped going there, waaaaaay toooo yuppie for me !!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Tammy b.

description: I eat at Baby Blues a few times a month and it's always delicious! No, they're not perfect, but who is? This is my go-to barbeque joint in the neighborhood and I keep coming back because the food is good and reliable and sometimes all I need is some tasty bbq and a blue moon after a long day.
author: Zoe S.

description:
I walked by this place on their opening night to find out that it was a new BBQ joint. I love me some good BBQ, i wanted to go that weekend but it was packed, so i waited till this past Sunday to go for dinner. 
Me and my Lady supposedly ordered the three kings, waiter suggested we order that, i said "oh okay sounds pretty good, give me a sec to look over the menu," next thing you know the platter of three kings arrived. My Girlfriend was kinda bummed because she really wanted a shrimp po boy. He didn't offer to take back the platter but he did offer to give us a side of bbq shrimp.5 minutes later he comes back and says "sorry we are out of shrimp." oh okay.... but he did hook us up with another slab of ribs.
Alright, the food.
The food was not what I had expected, everything came out luke warm.  Call me crazy but i thought bbq was suppose to be hot and saucy. The pulled pork had potential, I had to add some vinegar to give it a boost in flavor, ribs were nice and moist but lacked flavor. It didn't have that zesty tangy, burnt, smokey and crispy goodness that I liked. And the worse of the three was the dry and rubbery bbq chicken tasted like cafeteria food or something you would get in the freezer aisle. For the sides we ordered the runny, bland potato salad, and the mac and cheese that was okay. The cornbread looked kinda funny to me,  kinda like a smashed,burnt pancake.
The triple X sauce was pretty tasty. I made sure my food was drowning in that for the extra flavor.
I would wait a while before I would give this place another try.
author: Clarence W.

description:
not bad.     i'll definitely come here again.

Their cornbread was probably my favorite. Imagine a brownie with corn instead of a chocolate. The ribs are great. The sweet potatoes were good too.

minus a star, because I was very disappointed with the brisket.
author: Brent S.

description: Baby Blues goes straight to the top of the list for this genre.  Happened to drive by today around lunch time and went "hmmm...."  It was not a wasted stop.  The "Razorback" lunch special was an excellent first choice for what I am sure will be many visits.  It consisted of a generous 1/3 rack of baby back ribs with 3 sauces.  My favorite was the spicy  haberno and jalapeno, but I also liked the milder one flavored with mango.  Also on the plate was the most tender pile of pulled pork I can remember, flavored with the tangy vinegar sauce they provide, the scrumptious cornbread, and a side of mac and cheese.   Everything was first rate...a neighborhood treasure worth a trek from just about anywhere when you have the craving for the ultimate in barbeque.
author: David T.

description: I'm a big fan of the Venice Beach Baby Blues that happens to live in the hood.  I found out from headquarters that they will most likely not open until they recieve some equipment from Lousiana.  That means that you will have to wait a couple more weeks. I was told anywhere from 12/26 to 01/03.  I concur with the select few that were present on their soft opening night....this is great BBQ and we are in for a treat once they do open.
author: chris h.

description: I like the fact that there is a new BBQ joint that is so much closer to home! I was curious so after work we came here to order for takeout. I ordered a shrimp po'boy that came with a side with cole slaw. I also ordered a "fixin" of mashed sweet potatoes. He ordered the "three kings" which consisted of beef brisket, ribs, and chicken along with two fixin's: mac n' cheese and collared greens. It came with a cornbread. As you can tell this isn't a light meal so come on an empty stomach. Okay, I'll talk about the food now. The po' boy was good--the shrimp were well cooked and had good flavor but that's all the sandwich was. No lettuce or tomatoes-just bread, sauce, and shrimp. I still ate the whole thing! The mashed sweet potatoes were my favorite!!! It wasn't too sweet and you can tell there is a hint of orange juice in it! Divine. The collared greens were in a sauce that made it too rich. I like it plain and simple. The meats were all tender but the sauce I recommend to go with it is this concoction they have: apple cider vineger and chili extract. That made it even more delicious! Oh also, they have XXX hot sauce which I loved. It wasn't hot to me but then again, I put hot sauce on everything so I'm used to it...Snaps to them for free refills on drinks (Soda, sweet tea, and freakin' Kool Aid!) What else? Oh, yes, they deliver (which is also a good thing)! I will definitely go back to try the other items on their list. The staff are friendly and helpful especially if you aren't sure what to order--they'll help you out. This place is still new and you can tell they are still trying to get into the swing of things but kudos to them for bringing some soul to Bernal Heights...
author: Mel P.

description: Since I'm a vegetarian my review is limited only to the veggie sides and the service.  I did not like the mac and cheese.  The mac was overcooked and it tasted over salted to me.  That, and I wasn't a fan of the mix of cheeses used.  The cornbread was dry and not very savory.  The mashed sweet potatoes were ok - nothing too great.  Also, the service was poor.  Granted, we had a large party but I had to remind the waitress twice to bring me my iced tea.  She also mixed my sides up with another set of vegetarians that were there and we had to play musical side dish.
author: Amanda H.

description: We found out about Baby Blues from a flyer left on our door - while we generally throw them away, this one intrigued us because BBQ is the one thing we hadn't tried in the city - even after 7 years of living here. I'm from the south, my partner is from New Jersey, so we both went in with different expectations... That was 6 visits ago - a visit to Baby Blues has become a Saturday ritual for us. Among the marvelous treats they serve: the Memphis ribs are my favorite, but I've loved everything I've tried. The creamed spinach is AMAZING. The variety of homemade sauces at the table is terrific, but I find myself going back to their house sauce - with occasional forays to the standard molasses-based BBQ sauce. Though I don't usually have room for dessert when I eat there (substantial helpings) - I did try the banana pudding once - it was closer to a mousse than pudding and each bite was a little piece of heaven. Do yourself a favor and RUN to Baby Blues!
author: Jeremy C.

description: If you go, save your money and just order a side of mac and cheese, which is from what I can tell the only thing on the menu that's priced fairly based on what you get.  The mashed potatoes were good the first time, tasted weird the second time. The BBQ is less than average. Not impressive. I've been twice, the ribs were a dried out and some were basically charcoal on a bone. The brisket was at least edible. Both flavorless, with a crappy bland sweet sauce.  The sauce tastes pretty generic and very sugary, like they bought it from Safeway, added water and sugar, then over sauced the meat with it to cover up that it is burnt and bland. There is a difference between the charred flavor of food done on a grill or BBQ and just plain burnt.  Corn bread was a little weird, with actual corn kernels in it and kind of dry on the outside and soggy on the bottom. Maybe that's a southern thing that I don't get cause I'm from the pacific NW.  Another reviewer commented that her burger was way over done. I would have to agree. My friend ordered medium and it was definitely medium well. Also, the mashed sweet potatoes tasted good, but the texture made me gag. They didn't mash them well and there were a lot of little stringy fiber things left in.  Maybe below average is what you get from a chain restaurant (or is it a franchise?), who's other restaurant is in So Cal and not from Memphis.?! Basically, there isn't much that's positive about the food. I'm not a BBQ expert, and I don't think you need to be to know that this place is below average. I could go as high as 2 stars, but the prices seemed out of sync with the quality (below average).
author: Lin N.

description: VERY DISAPPOINTED!!!  I ordered the BBQ beef rib and it was cold in the middle.  I guess they don't make them fresh but keep them in the refrigeraton till they throw them back on the grill again.  The fat in the middle was still white cold and congealed...it would have tasted better if they pop them in the microwave.  I will never go here again and never recommend it to any of my friends...for the price I paid, I expected better.
author: Tokyokid G.

description:
Wow, what a disappointment.  Have been looking for a good bbq place in the SF for awhile and just haven't come across one.  I don't make it out to this part of town too often but figured while I was there I would try out the place I had heard so many good things about.   Ordered pulled pork with two sides and my husband got the st louis style ribs with two sides.  We were very excited to get 4 different sides to share.  I got the pork and beans and coleslaw, he got the baked beans an mac and cheese.  All of the sides were a disappoint and even more disappointing, the pork and beans were just their "baked beans" with pork on top, neither of which were technically baked beans or pork and beans.
  On top of the sides not tasting great they were all cold, as were our entrees.  The pulled pork was fine but needed a sauce to have any flavor, with 6 different sauces to try I figured I would find one I liked but I couldn't.  The ribs were not thoroughly cooked and required a steak knife to cut!
And after all that we asked about their desserts and the waiter proceeded to tell us that their regulars usually order dessert first because it is so good and because you can take home left over dinner but not dessert.  First off his pitch made him seem like a car dealer and second whose to say I can't take a piece of pie home.  But I guess he didn't want me to look silly taking home pie, so for that I thank him.
author: Stefanie N.

description: This place sucked - waiter was way too slow and when we finally got to order they ran out of corn bread and some of the sides...basic stuff you should never run out of in the early evening.
author: Randy Y.

description: This place is for people with big appetites.  Food is ok and the sides are good. Can get a little pricey.  I'd say average of $50 per couple.  Cool place to try if BBQ is your thing.
author: Kaleena S.

description: The food here is yummy.  Not extremely gourmet, but tasty stuff.  And they deliver.... kind of.  Actually I called the place at 8:54 to order delivery and the guy said sorry, we stop delivering at 9.  I said it's 8:54.  He said yeah well tonight we stop delivering at 8:55.  I repeated, it's 8:54.  Really bummed on this place right now.  Still hungry.
author: Sarah K.

description: Delicious comfort food. No, it's not authentic southern food. Who fucking cares? Whatever it is its really good. And they ALWAYS deliver on time. Perfect thing for a rainy day.
author: kris l.

description:
i consider myself a hardcore bbq fan, so i was excited to hear that baby blues was opening in my hood. i have been to the one in venice beach several times. the brother of the venice owner opened this one in SF. i know this from my short conversation with him today. nice guy, and clearly proud of his restaurant. no association between them and i, fyi.

i went in for lunch and had the "hound dog", which consists of 1/3 rack of memphis ribs and beef brisket. i'll get straight to the main attraction;  ribs are the centerpiece of any bbq restaurant. if you don't get the ribs right, you got nothin'. they got the ribs right at baby blues. they were juicy, falling off the bone, well seared on the outside, and full of flavor. my only criticism is that they could have been more smoky. nevertheless, they are the best ribs i've had in SF, and i've tried a lot of joints. lulu's and big nate's do not cut it in my book. this is the only bbq joint that's good enough to go back to regularly. very glad to have them in SF.

despite the gushing i just indulged in, i must note that the brisket was unimpressive. it's served saucy and pulled  - that is shredded and stringy. i prefer my brisket smoked whole, and sliced. 

i had cole slaw and cornbread on the side. the cole slaw was decent, and the cornbread had a wonderful crust on it, but is just a tad dense for my tastes. i still enjoyed it though.

if i could give baby blues 4.5 stars, i would. the ribs are outstanding, and my other criticisms are minor in comparison. if you haven't tried it, it's worth the trip.
author: Ben H.

description: best delivery ribs in the city, about to order more now.  beans cornbread and corn with cheese slamming!! dont care for the brisket but well worth a trip.  the grilled shrimp are excellent.  go there u will b happy
author: seth r.

description: Stopped by this place for lunch today.  Being a vegetarian, all I could eat were some sides, but it was very good. The mashed sweet potatoes were possibly the best I've tasted.  The atmosphere is cool.  They obviously set up the place on a budget, but I always find that charming.  Looks like it would be a fun place to go with a group.
author: Yogini R.

description: was walking down the street when i got a hunger in my belly.  the "drugs bbq" sign was enough to draw me in. turned out that it was actually really nice on the inside (compared to what i was expecting).  had the burger, and it was fantastic. probably the best i've had in san francisco. maybe it was above average for the night or maybe i had plenty of beer in me. but get the burger. yum
author: justen e.

description: I'm so happy to have a BBQ place in the neighborhood.  We went there on Valentine's evening, were seated promptly (lucky us).  We ordered ribs, but at 7pm they were out already!!!  Bummer.  How could you be out of ribs at 7pm???  They wouldn't be ready for another hour to hour and one half!!!  The waiter told me they ran totally out of food the night before!  After a long wait for our plates to arrive (40 minutes), we finally got to chow down.  Good cornbread, my husband's pulled pork was better than the brisket....which is also pulled.  The okra, if you like okra, was great.  They are a new restaurant and probably need sometime to iron out the kinks....I'd go back knowing the above info......
author: Andee W.

description: finally ate at baby blues and loved everything about it!! great food, great honest and real service!! we had baby back ribs and BBQ shrimp along with some creamed spinach and mashed potatoes... the meat was just perfect and shrimp was perfectly executed... cant wait to go back... good job baby blues!!
author: meme b.

description:
it's interesting how mixed the reviews are on this place, but thinking back on my own experience, I understand why - I feel internally conflicted.  on the one hand, I want to love this place:

* great, airy space with a casual and friendly vibe
* really nice service (at least when I was there, all 3 of the servers I interacted with were above-average nice and helpful)
* it's bbq - everyone loves bbq, and I americans have a gene to get instantly excited when they hear the words "new bbq joint in town"

On the other hand, a couple things are holding me back

* it is no doubt pricey - $40 for one meal + two beers (including tip) feels like a ton for bbq, even in SF.  
* it was good, but not amazing.  It's all NC style, which means it's got a bit too much vinegar for my taste.   but i think this is a matter of taste, not quality, which is why the reviews on yelp are so binary
* finally, i had a bit of a weird experience with the owner.  i happened to be standing next to him and he asked me how my meal was.  i said "excellent" and he was pleased, I walked away.  Then I thought for a minute and went back and said "actually, one thing, the cornbread wasn't my favorite - I like what you're trying to do but I'd prefer a more classic-style cornbread."  His response to this was, no joke, to just ignore me - look away and kind of act like I wasn't there anymore.  I stood there awkwardly for a minute, then started walking away, and he says, with just a slight tone in his voice, "We've only been open 2 month you know."  Dude, you ASKED me how my meal was.  I'm trying to be thoughtful and help you succeed!  Next time I'll just BS you, but wouldn't you rather know what your customers really think?

I can tell these guys are working hard to make this place a hit, so going to go back again sometime and check it out.  I want to like this place
author: James R.

description: very good brisket , amazing chicken , good portion or the price , looking forward to go again and try something else
author: NAEL K.

description: Since I moved to SF from Texas 6 years ago, the search for great BBQ has been disappointing to say the least. Finding a place that has great meat, great sauce, and great sides is a challenge. I grew up in Texas eating a lot of barbecue so I pretty much know what I'm looking for. The food here is excellent. We ordered a mix of different meats and sides and we liked everything. To make things even better, Paul (the owner) and his daughter gave us excellent service and clearly Paul is knowledgeable and enthusiastic about his food. If you decide to eat here definitely ask for Paul and chat with him about how he cooks his meat....you'll learn something new I assure you. We will be eating here often!  If I eat somewhere that has really good food a four star rating would be the norm.  The fifth star is for Paul and his family that works the restaurant....they add something extra and I'd really like to see the succeed
author: Terrence J.

description: Justin K. and I went here last night for our St Patty's day dinner. We were going to have Mexican food, but our spot was closed. I decided on getting the  1/2 Memphis Long Ribs and  1/2 Baby Back Ribs. I was quite hungry. The "Tripple-X" sauce was awesome and hot. The ribs were over cooked and when they were pulled apart it was not fall off the bone and I had to fight the meat resulting in two ribs worth of meat on one bone, leaving the neighboring bone naked and lonely. I might be picky, but I feel that if I can cook a more tender rib (which I suck at) then you shouldn't be charging 25 bucks for ribs. The mac and cheese side tasted like they were made from a box. When we walked in the restaurant, it was about half full (or half empty as the tone of this review is going). It filled up after we ordered and it took a real long time for us to get refills on our drinks. They were nice about it and admitted that they lagged and didn't charge us for a round. I appreciate the free round, but if I'm sitting right next to the bar it shouldn't have happened in the first place. The waitress was hot and flirty, but it still doesn't make up for it. I'm here for ribs, not hot chicks. Justin's beef brisket was tasty, but I'm not a brisket fan. I might go back and try the pulled pork but the ribs are off my list.
author: Dustin S.

description: Good times here. Now, I've only been here twice and with large orders for a number of people. We decided to order as much off the menu as we could to sample everything. So, the meats are cooked very well and the Corn bread isn't too sweet. This is nice to me because it doesn't wipe away the taste of all the sides. The flavors of all the sides were a bit mild to my liking and I wasn't too impressed with the sauce. *I've spent some time in Dallas, TX* Overall, we all came to the agreement that this place is sure to be around for a while. The Servers are really sharp and very very friendly. We were greeted by a gentleman who we later learned is the owner (forgot his name). He presented himself as person who really takes pride in his product. Great service is always a big plus for me. If they keep this up during my next few visits, I'll bump'em up another star. So, if you're not in the mood for a good burrito, this place is worth a try.
author: Jubei K.

description: i'm going to preface this with i don't seek out bbq but i have had it many times in my 38 years. this place is good.  give it a try. i typically give sf restaurants about 3 tries. my first 2 at baby blues were good. that warrents attention.
author: chris p.

description: I stopped on the way back home from mountain biking in Marin for a late lunch since it was "sorta" on the way. I had read that they had Carolina style pulled pork sammiches. I had been craving a proper Carolina pork BBQ sammich since leaving NC back in 2006 so I was happy to visit this place. I walked in saddled up to the bar and ordered a Guinness and a Pork BBQ sammich. The beer was served up cold and fast. I was just about two long sips into the pint before the sammich showed up. They guy behind the bar offered it up with some special vinegar oil stuff and with three bottles of different BBQ sauces. All these were variations on the vinegar-y hot sauce that I'm familiar with. I devoured the sammich bite by bite, each time squirting the sammich with a different sauce. They were all delicious. That's all I ate. The Carolina style pulled pork sammich and I must say, it's a darned good impression despite the fancy bun and coleslaw. I'll have to return to try their other BBQ offerings.
author: Ranier D.

description: Oustanding. I have had the Memphis style pork ribs, and twice in one week at that. Furthermore, the 2nd time I had them ( a full rack of course) with no sauce. That is how good they are!!! Some places try and hide there mediocre ribs with sauce, but here they have nothing to hide. I highly recommed.
author: J B.

description: I've read some of the 1 and 2 star reviews, and am surprised.  The sides are made from scratch.
author: W. W.

description: We live in Bernal Heights & try to go out to neighborhood places as much as possible.  We had heard good things about this restaurant, glad to see the vacant space filled, happy when there was finally time to try it out.  Big mistake.  There was nothing in this place remotely inviting.  For only being open a few months, the place already looked run down & neglected. The floors were filthy; everything looked haphazard. The bartender was eating behind the counter; the guy in the food line was eating while preparing food (gross); another guy in the food line kept taking off his cap & smoothing down his hair - he did not wash his hands after doing this, nor did he put on gloves for food prep. The waitress' jeans were so low her behind was showing; the pants looked like they would fall off any moment.  She kept pulling them up, taking orders, bringing food to the table - not very sanitary. We ordered a platter of ribs & chicken.  The ribs were so dry it looked like there was no meat on the bones. The mac & cheese had big chunks of cream cheese in it - very strange. Cornbread was burnt.  The chicken & sweet potatoes were ok.  We didn't even stay for dessert. The lack of professionalism was unbelievable. The place was such a turn-off.  In all honesty, I would not recommend this place to anyone.  Usually I give a place 3 tries but in this case once was enough.
author: Pam R.

description: let me say first of all, i don't like pork, well except for bacon, but that doesn't count who doesn't love bacon?? anyway, i tried their pulled pork, OH MY GOD, it was sooo good!! and their chicken was cooked perfectly and yummy, not at all dry. their hot bbq sauce was actually hot and good. and the wait staff, including hostess were all very sweet and cute. thanks, i think i'll be going back again soon, hmmm maybe this weekend!
author: Jennifer L.

description: You want BBQ?  Plenty of good dishes to choose from, ample portions, a variety of hot sauces, and a good vibe.  A great way to start the night.
author: Josh J.

description: We have eaten at Baby Blues many times and really like the food a lot.  But tonight when we visited, the service was really so awful that we had to write in. Our waitress was non-attentive and downright rude.  Has Baby Blues gotten too cool to provide decent service? Trust me, we won't be back.
author: margaret d.

description: Jan and I are barbeque lovers and like to try new barbeque places. So, we checked on yelp what other barbeque joints we haven't been to yet and saw this place. We decided to check it out. Man, does parking suck around this area but fortunately we were able to find parking close to the restaurant. We walk inside and we like the ambience. We get seated right away and look over the menu. They have a lunch special that goes on everyday from 12-4 so we decide to order from the lunch menu. I get the pulled pork sandwich w/cornbread and soda while Jan ordered the "Cherokee Spike" platter that consists of pulled pork, brisket, link, cornbread and drink. While we wait for our food, we decided to try their barbeque sauces that they place on every table. We thought they weren't bad, but not hella good so we ended up using all 3 sauces together on our food. I thought my food was ok good while Jan enjoyed his food a tad more than me. This place is all right.
author: Jan And Daph S.

description: This is my first experience with the "dry rub" style of BBQ-ing (I'm not even sure I'm using the right term). Simply put, the meat is not slathered in sauce. Unfortunately, I'm accustomed to lot of sauce on my BBQ meats, so I was underwhelmed by my gigantic "Texas" beef rib, and baby back ribs. I also ordered the catfish which was too dry. Don't get me wrong the "Texas" beef rib was very tender and tasty, but I wanted some sauce! Born and raised in California, I'm not an expert on BBQ, so take my review with a grain of salt.
author: Myron Y.

description: Just ate at this place last night, it's in the neighborhood and we were delighted when we walked in.  The place is full of life and we were lucky enough to get a place at the bar.  The food was great, and I'm not a huge BBQ fan but my husband is and we both were satisfied.  I love the pulled pork sandwich and I don't eat much meat, so that says something.  The only reason this place is getting 4 stars and not 5 is the hope that the owners will read this review and GET A NEW SOUND SYSTEM!  They play good music but it's coming from what looks like a bookshelf stereo and it's terrible.  Please invest in a good sound system if you are going to play music that loud.  Anyway, rant over, this place is very good and I really did like the customer service and there is no doubt that we will be back.
author: L G.

description: Well, i must say this was a waste of a lot of money. my boyfriend and i have been looking for this place for about a month, and we drove by several time because there isn't a sign but anyways, for the amount of money we spent $35.00 for 6 to 8 ribs, 1 leg quarter, burnt fish, the ugliest corn bread i ever seen and the sides, mac and cheese (OK), sweet potatoes(bland), dirty rice(like mexican rice gone bad) and the BBQ sauce was straight vinegar. By far the worst BBQ SF. Very disappointing. PLEASE DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY. TRUST ME
author: anita b.

description: The neon BBQ over the door was the only thing barbeque about this place.  The ribs, chicken and spinach had a smokey taste because they were burnt beyond repair.  This was after waiting about two hours for the food to make it to our table!  It seems like the kitchen was too busy preparing the take-out orders to notice that the dining room patrons had no food on their tables....the cooks need to look over the food counter once in awhile to check on their guests!  The pulled pork sandwich meat was very bland and needed more than the xxx sauce from the bottles on the table to get any flavor...geez Gordon Biersch makes a better pulled pork sandwich.  The sides were nothing to speak of...plain cole slaw, soggy chicken flavored rice, and corn on the cob doused with imitation cheese.   The only thing good to say were the nice cute waitresses who kept apologizing for the poor service from the kitchen...I really felt sorry for my waitress who was on the verge of tears and felt helpless...she wanted us to have a better dining experience.  Maybe they can blame it on being Friday the thirteenth...unlike Jason, I won't be coming back again to stab the meats...sorry for singing the blues...I am driving to Everett and Jones in Jack London Sq. for some bbq.
author: Ed Y.

description: Love this place! Very tasty BBQ and huge portions. I would eat here everyday if I could. The people there are super nice too.
author: NIcole N.

description: This is more of a response to Kristin T.'s comments.  I am a customer at Baby Blues and I was present when this "altercation" happened.  I can't speak for the cold sides and stuff but I will tell you I do know the owner and he is a very generous man and treats his employees well.  In no way was he spitting in her face or scaring customers as a matter of fact she was more out of hand than he was.  And please don't make him seem like a gay basher because thats not the case at all here, it was simply an argument between the boss and a disrespectful employee.  As a matter of fact I don't remember him saying your fired I clearly remember her walking through the dining room screaming "I am not working here anymore".  But besides all of that jabber the food is excellent (especially the shrimp) seriously you have to try them.  I will certaintly be back.
author: Deek K.

description: was really hoping to like this place. rainy day, too cold. hubby wants BBQ and in our 'hood AND they deliver... well, 75 minutes later they delivered. then, the delivery person has no change, so basically takes our money.  $30 for a $22 meal... i mean, we gave him a tip for the rain and the effort, but then no change = massive tip for late, late cold BBQ. even called them to complain. was told manager would get back to us. yeah. right. sigh. and was so willing to cut slack even for average BBQ since they delivered...
author: Fish F.

description: This is by far, the best BBQ place in San Francisco.  We ordered the lunch platters which included pulled pork, beef brisket, ribs and hot links.  We also ordered chicken, mac n cheese and beans.  Every part of this meal was incredible.  Meat was incredibly tasty, moist and melted in my mouth.  The service was incredibly friendly, welcoming and hospitable.  Definitely worth it.
author: ND S.

description: This place is fantastic! We had delivery and everyone was super impressed. They were a little late in getting here, but the food was so great all was forgiven. We ordered a little bit of everything and it was all really really tasty!
author: Joshua R.

description: normally, I do updates so I can up my rating. sadly, this one brings down baby blues one star. i wanted to try their lunch specials 'cause they looked scrumptious and fairly reasonably priced. it would have all been enjoyable and I would have absorbed the document on housing rights and the fight for affordable housing SF history were it not for the #$%^&@! double doors being WIDE OPEN on a FRIGID DAY making the entire restaurant feel like a walk in cooler. I finally said something to one of the servers (oh, yeah, the one assigned to me seemed to also be a bit on the lackadaisical side, quite a contrast from the last time I was here)  - he said that the owner keeps opening the doors. (!). Then I overheard the server talk to the owner - who uh, happened to be behind the grill and apparently was feeling hot - to which the server said "Well, of course you're hot, you're there by the grill, the rest of the restaurant isn't the same way!" (hooray for you oh server who wasn't the one assigned to me...). anyway, it wasn't for another several minutes before the doors were finally closed but by that time, I had already donned my jacket (which didn't do much on top of my 3 layers of clothing - that's how cold it was). Yup, just for that, 1 less star. And if I get sick from having gone through that frozen lunch, I'll knock off a couple more stars.
author: ray e.

description: I have read the mixed reviews of this place and it sounds like it is not always consistent but my experience was AWESOME!  I was hesitant, not because of it's hipster interior (if the food's good fuck it) but because it seemed a bit too pricey for this kind of fare.  I was totally wrong, I can easily get two moderately sized meals out of my brisket platter and I am a serious eater.  My brisket was tender, juicy and had that sweet smoky flavor of well cooked meat.  My sides TOTALLY stood up to the main.  The pork and beans had big chunks of pulled pork thorough out and was sweet and seculant.  The potato salad was one of the best potato salads I have ever had, tart and sooooooo good.  I usually hate okra (so slimy) but loved it here, it is flash fried with vinegar and had great flavor.  My boyfriend's smoked chicken rice was pretty boring (I'd opt out of that).  The cornbread was coarse, moist and dense -loved it.  My boyfriend got the chicken which was equally good.  We both agreed that the flavor of all the meats did not need to be spoiled with sauces but tried the sauces none the less which were quite tasty (we tested them on the bland rice).  Service was awesome and we didn't wait (although we were there around 5 on a Thursday).  In the end I spent about $15 for super high quality food and the left overs will make a hearty lunch for tomorrow.  So good, will be back.
author: liz w.

description: I've gotten delivery from this place and it was NOT worth it!  Super cold.  Blah.  And I only live a couple blocks away.  In person the place is pretty good!  Huge servings, good food, huge servings.  Did I mention their servings are huge?  I did find a weird red plastic thing in my mashed potatoes once.  Gross.  Complimentary dessert.  Whatever.  Should've given me the meal for free if you ask me.  A friend's burger was extremely undercooked on one of our visits.  I think the sides are just okay.  My husband loves the blue cheese stuffed burger.  I like the baby back ribs!  The decor in this place is seriously lacking--the area where the employees put their jackets and purses was RIGHT next to our table in the corner--strange having employees getting ready to work out in the open like that.  Pretty weird if you ask me.  Tables are overcrowded too.  I go to this place because I like meat and it's close to my pad.
author: Jo M.

description: Baby Blue BBQ is at the top of my list when it comes to Great BBQ in the city. We (3) went there on a Sunday afternoon soon after they opened  and were seated right away by a very friendly host who also was our waiter. We ordered off the lunch special section of the menu, which had some very good deals on some delicious looking meals(served 12pm to 4pm daily) . 2 of us ordered  the Cherokee Spike platter and one ordered the pulled pork sandwich. The wait for our food wasn't more than 10 mins. When it arrived , I couldn't believe the amount of food on the platter. The portions were huge. With a combo of pulled pork,hot link, and beef brisket, along with cornbread and a side of baked beans. It was hard to believe this was the lunch special (all for $11.95). The other platter  person in our party got the side of cole slaw which was also delicious. The pulled pork sandwich was also huge with alot of meat and a topping of cole slaw , with a side of mashed sweet potato. Also very delicious. The total bill for us with 2 ice teas and 1 kool aid was $38.00. One of the best lunches we ever had in the city. We'll definately be back.
author: R D M.
